itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1369066814\" />\n    <a title=\"Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat\"><img alt=\"Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1458308353p2/6759885.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1369066814?book_show_action=false\">Jul 17, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)\" href=\"/user/show/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat\">Jessi (Novel Heartbeat)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat?shelf=books-i-own\">books-i-own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6759885-jessi-novel-heartbeat?shelf=5-star\">5-star</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1369066814\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13665234460194070316\"><a href=\"http://novelheartbeat.com\" rel=\"nofollow\"> <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1422374869i/13493565.png\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><b>4.5/5</b><br><br>I am very surprised by how addicted to this series IU+2019ve become! IU+2019ve been trying to watch each movie after I read the book, but the anxiety caused by the differences in this one tell me I should probably stop doing that, ha.<br><br>IU+2019ve reached the point now where IU+2019m starting to see drastic differences between the book and the movie, unlike the first two. I was really upset that the significance behind Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs wasnU+2019t explained! That was one of my favorite parts of the</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText13665234460194070316\" style=\"display:none\"><a href=\"http://novelheartbeat.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">\n  <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1422374869i/13493565.png\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><b>4.5/5</b><br><br>I am very surprised by how addicted to this series IU+2019ve become! IU+2019ve been trying to watch each movie after I read the book, but the anxiety caused by the differences in this one tell me I should probably stop doing that, ha.<br><br>IU+2019ve reached the point now where IU+2019m starting to see drastic differences between the book and the movie, unlike the first two. I was really upset that the significance behind Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs wasnU+2019t explained! That was one of my favorite parts of the book. It barely even mentioned Sirius being the black dog and his relation to the Grim. Actually, most things werenU+2019t explained. HermioneU+2019s class overload and her being in two places at once, the Patronus, ScabbersU+2019 missing toe....Crookshanks was nearly non-existent, BuckbeakU+2019s situation was glossed overU+2026it was all very frustrating. IU+2019m glad now that I did read the book, because I got so much more out of it. There were SO many things going on behind the scenes that I didnU+2019t even realizeU+2026Everything makes so much more sense when youU+2019ve read the book. So many little yet important details were skimmed over! I think the fact that they left out Prongs and the reason behind HarryU+2019s Patronus being a stag upset me the most. Like, how long would it have taken just to say that was his fatherU+2019s Animagus?<br><br>I also really didnU+2019t like how they showed Peter Pettigrew (in the movie) on the map wandering through Hogwarts, because it wasnU+2019t a surprise in the scene when Sirius finally appears. Bad planning there! Two other scenes I didnU+2019t think were portrayed very well were the Quidditch match with the dementors and the discussion about Sirius and his involvement with HarryU+2019s parents (seriously, how awkward was that?).<br><br>Anyway, back to the book. The map!! I loooved the MarauderU+2019s Map. I totally want one!! I loved that it was created by the four best friends and the whole backstory behind it.<br><br>I also love that Sirius was portrayed as a bad guy but he really wasnU+2019t. The whole book was building him up as this evil villain, and the perception was broken when Harry finally met him. I think Sirius is my favorite character of the series so far!<br><br>Side note: Okay, am I freaking tripping, or was Dumbledore's quote from the movie, <em>\"Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light\"</em> NOT in the book?! I mean, I love that quote to death and I swear I never remember reading it, and surely I would have remembered that...?!?!<br><br><b>Favorite quote</b><br><em>\"You think the dead we have loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly than ever in times of great trouble?\"</em><br><br><br><b>This review was originally posted on Novel Heartbeat. To see a breakdown of my assessment, please visit the full review <a href=\"http://novelheartbeat.com/?p=11645\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\">here</a>.</b></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13665234460194070316\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_359322409\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/359322409\" />\n    <a title=\"Rashika (is tired)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/8492956-rashika-is-tired\"><img alt=\"Rashika (is tired)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476647072p2/8492956.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/359322409?book_show_action=false\">Dec 11, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Rashika (is tired)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Rashika (is tired)\" href=\"/user/show/8492956-rashika-is-tired\">Rashika (is tired)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer359322409\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13921925407588899004\"><b> SPOILERS </b><br /><br /><i>psttt there may be errors in this, I am not to blame. Blame dey feels</i><br /><br />There are so many feels when it comes to this book. It was my favorite book in the series and now I finally re-read it and it broke my heart a million times over.<br /><br />The first time was when Remus was introduced as the new teacher and Snape was glaring at him. I couldn't. I just wanted to bawl my heart out because. BECAUSE. We all know what would happen. <br /><br />I thought a lot of things while reading this book. It just made me th</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText13921925407588899004\" style=\"display:none\"><b> SPOILERS </b><br /><br /><i>psttt there may be errors in this, I am not to blame. Blame dey feels</i><br /><br />There are so many feels when it comes to this book. It was my favorite book in the series and now I finally re-read it and it broke my heart a million times over.<br /><br />The first time was when Remus was introduced as the new teacher and Snape was glaring at him. I couldn't. I just wanted to bawl my heart out because. BECAUSE. We all know what would happen. <br /><br />I thought a lot of things while reading this book. It just made me think about the whole series as a whole. Like Snape and why he was the way he was. About Remus. About Sirius. About everyone. <br /><br />One of my other thoughts was how WRONG it was for Ron and Hermoine to end up together. I amp probably n the minority with that one but I don't understand why they did. It's so weird seeing them not really be bffs in the first couple of books and then become a couple. I don't want to imagine how these two, such adorable kids, will grow up to well. Yeah. <br /><br />Which also brings me to Harry and Ginny. I never ever ever liked the idea of those two. It was too random for my tastes. It seemed force. They shouldn't have ended up together. Hell while I was reading this book, I was wondering if I would have liked the ending of the 7th book a little bit more had J.K. pulled a Luke Skywalker and left Harry single. <br /><br />I love Sirius to bits and pieces (he is my fav character) but sometimes I wonder about him and James. I don't agree with the way they treated Snape. They were bullies. It hurts me to say that but they were. Snape was an annoying pain the ass but he was also somewhat powerless compared to them. They did some pretty awful things to him and it sometimes makes me wonder why I love Sirius so much. <br /><br />Lily isn't that much better in my eyes. I actually realize that I may be too harsh in judging her but I cannot help how I feel. She basically cut off all ties to her muggle life and embraced everything James offered. Her life seemed to revolve around him. His best friends were hers and yeah. It always pains me to imagine how Snape must have felt. She may have hated James initially but when Snape became a douche bag what did she do? First of all, she knew him for almost all her life, she should have known better and should have seen through his bullshit, second.. she kind of did marry the guy who bullied her ex-best friend. That breaks some sort of code doesn't it?<br /><br />I mean whenever Harry mentioned that wedding photo and the best man who was 'their best friend' it kind of just broke my heart into little pieces because at that point Snape held no value in Lily's heart whereas for Snape, well we all know how it was. <br /><br />Despite how I feel about Harry's parents. I love this book to bits. Also I thought I'd make a list of my favorite characters, it might explain why re-reading this series sucks.<br /><br />-Sirius<br />-Snape<br />-Remus<br />-Dumbledore<br />-Dobby<br />-Hagrid<br />-Fred<br />-George<br />-Neville<br />-Draco<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13921925407588899004\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1278089042\" />\n    <a title=\"Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm\"><img alt=\"Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364999103p2/7436809.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1278089042?book_show_action=false\">Jun 22, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)\" href=\"/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm\">Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747560777\" href=\"/book/show/297566.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=review\">review</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1278089042\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5941513455098680762\">Warning, this review has spoilers for this book and the entire series.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban is the third book in the Harry Potter series and you can tell that the tone of the books are getting darker. I felt this book was faster paced and better story than the first two book as when I first read it I did not expect that Sirius was innocent. This Harry Potter book is unique as it is the only novel without Voldemort, which shows that his followers can be just as dangerous.<br /><br />Harry</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5941513455098680762\" style=\"display:none\">Warning, this review has spoilers for this book and the entire series.<br /><br />Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban is the third book in the Harry Potter series and you can tell that the tone of the books are getting darker. I felt this book was faster paced and better story than the first two book as when I first read it I did not expect that Sirius was innocent. This Harry Potter book is unique as it is the only novel without Voldemort, which shows that his followers can be just as dangerous.<br /><br />Harry feels trapped in this book as he is over protected, for his safety and feels no one is telling him anything. I really like Lupin as I can relate to him, he has a tragic affliction yet it never affected how he treated people and was a very good teacher. However, while Sirius is an interesting character I donU+2019t love him like so many others do.<br /><br />While I love this book there are somethings that donU+2019t make sense. Firstly Bogarts in this book donU+2019t show real fears, as even when I was 10 my fears are not things like spiders and mummyU+2019s but more abstract like harm happening to my family. Another thing is how come Fred and George never noticed that an unknown man was in either Percy or RonU+2019s room on the maraudersU+2019 map? Also if Hogsmead is the only muggle free place then how come most wizards have no understanding of the muggle world? Finally it is obvious the Rowling had not planned the Deathly Hallows as here is this all powerful invisibility cloak which is meant to hide a person from everything but apparently can be seen on a map made by teenage boys.<br /><br />I love Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban and the entire series and I would recommend it to everyone. <br /><br />This and my other reviews can be found at <a href=\"http://amethystbookwyrm.blogspot.co.uk/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Amethyst Bookwyrm</a><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5941513455098680762\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" Keely\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/84023-j-g-keely\"><img alt=\"J.G. Keely\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1274333636p2/84023.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/3599188?book_show_action=false\">Aug 16, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"J.G. Keely\" class=\"user\" name=\"J.G. Keely\" href=\"/user/show/84023-j-g-keely\">J.G. Keely</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fiction\">contemporary-fiction</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=novel\">novel</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/84023-j-g-keely?shelf=contemporary-fantasy\">contemporary-fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer3599188\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17613391990643932214\">The first of her series where Rowling really catches her stride. Though her plotting is always a forced joining of unnecessary moments smoothed over Lucas-style by action and magic, in this occasion, the emotional and character exploration of such moments helps to lend them a certain importance. There is an irony here: that Rowling seems to profit from the reader leaning on Chekhovian Realism in a story where the psychology and meaning are so contrived and poorly-executed that it cannot be</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17613391990643932214\" style=\"display:none\">The first of her series where Rowling really catches her stride. Though her plotting is always a forced joining of unnecessary moments smoothed over Lucas-style by action and magic, in this occasion, the emotional and character exploration of such moments helps to lend them a certain importance. There is an irony here: that Rowling seems to profit from the reader leaning on Chekhovian Realism in a story where the psychology and meaning are so contrived and poorly-executed that it cannot be considered with that genre.<br /><br />As ever, Rowlings adoption of characters, themes, and tropes from other British authors prove to be her best and most powerful elements. From Mr. D'arcy to Gandalf to Gaiman, she runs the gamut, arms outstretched and grasping gleefully.<br /><br />Of course, for those who argue 'there are only XX stories' (scientifically defined as somewhere between 1 and 77), Rowling's gentle lending is not much of a literary crime. Quite the opposite: she is not an author who could create from whole cloth, her strength lies in combination of elements and in romantic adventure.<br /><br />And though her disparate story elements are as hastily built as old Winchester Manor, and as unkind to see from afar, traveling interiorily--though sometimes needlessly confusing--provides a view of many well-constructed and beautiful rooms: a lovely little tour. <br /><br />At the risk of insulting someone who misses my intent, the greatest gift to her merry throngs may be that they cannot step back and look upon the whole picture. A house of cards is a pretty feat, after all.<br /><br /><a href=\"http://starsbeetlesandfools.blogspot.com/2012/06/suggested-readings-in-fantasy.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">My Fantasy Book Suggestions</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17613391990643932214\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div \n\n<div id=\"review_149067106\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/149067106\" />\n    <a title=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow\"><img alt=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1428960569p2/886144.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/149067106?book_show_action=false\">Apr 11, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" class=\"user\" name=\"Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*\" href=\"/user/show/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow\">Brigid *Flying Kick-a-pow!*</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=childrens\">childrens</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=time-travel\">time-travel</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/886144-brigid-flying-kick-a-pow?shelf=middle-grade\">middle-grade</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer149067106\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9367024381799981385\">In case you didn't know, I'm trying to re-read all the Harry Potter books this year. And I have now re-read book 3U+2013 U+2013yay!<br /><br />Obviously, I love this book. But I do have to stand by my original review, in which I said it was a bit slow starting out. Especially the second time around, I found it a little frustrating; there are a lot of ~big secrets~ and it takes a long time to get to the reveals. And once we get some answers, it's quite a lot of information to take in at once (and I feel like this kinda</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9367024381799981385\" style=\"display:none\">In case you didn't know, I'm trying to re-read all the Harry Potter books this year. And I have now re-read book 3U+2013 U+2013yay!<br /><br />Obviously, I love this book. But I do have to stand by my original review, in which I said it was a bit slow starting out. Especially the second time around, I found it a little frustrating; there are a lot of ~big secrets~ and it takes a long time to get to the reveals. And once we get some answers, it's quite a lot of information to take in at once (and I feel like this kinda happens at the end of every HP book, but ehh it's fine). <br /><br />I'm being nitpicky, though. And I feel like the ending makes up for some of the slowness at the beginning. The last 100 pages or so are really intense, and I feel like they start to set a darker tone for the rest of the series. Plus in general, I just love the characters and getting to spend some time at Hogwarts. <br /><br />(Old review under the cut.)<br /><br />----------<br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<br /><b>Original review (3/31/11):</b><br /><br />Best one yet! A little slow starting out, but by the end it got very good. Very intense/exciting/etc. I still have some issues with the writing style (mostly the excessive dialogue tags and adverbs, argh!) and how at the end of every book it's like \"I'M THE BAD GUY AND I'M GOING TO TAKE TWENTY PAGES TO PROVE HOW CLEVER MY EVIL PLOT IS\" ... but other than that, very enjoyable. I'll start the fourth one soon, but I'm intimidated by the size of the next four books. *stares at mile-high pile of remaining books* But, I will get through them. I WILL. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9367024381799981385\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review149067106\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link149067106\" title=\"Flag this 13 year old boy, and is a young wizard. When he was 1 year old, his parents got killed by the most powerful dark wizard, Lord Voldemort. But when Voldemort tried to kill Harry as well, he failed and since than, Harry is very famous. He is a 3rd year student in Hogwarts, the school for Witchcraft and Wizardy.<br /> Harry wants to go to Hogsmeade with his friends. But he can notU+3000 because Uncle vernon obviously would not give him permission, and Harry does not have any other relatives. Even the Ministery of Magic would not sign it for famous Harry Potter because there is another reason. The reason is that the Minestery of Magic, Mr. Fudge, thinks that Sirius Black, a prizoner that killed 13 people in a curse is after Harry. Black worked under Voldemort, and hates Harry for making Voldemort lose his powers.So Fudge wants to keep Harry safe in Hogwarts.<br />Also, Harry wants revenge. He hears that Black killed his parents; Black was Harry's dad's best friend, and was a spy for Voldemort. Black had betrayed Voldemort.<br /> But it was not Black that had killed his parents. It was Peter Pettigrew, who had been living 12 years as a rat, and no normal rat; Ron's pet Scabbers. He had powers to transform into a shape of an animal. When Harry, Hermoine, Ron, Professor Lupin, and Black had tried to hand him over to the dementors, he had escaped.<br /> So once more, Black had been captured. But Harry and Hermione rescued him by using the time warp charm. He escaped with Haqgrid's bird. And Harry had ended his 3rd year at Hogwarts.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15484215161740781179\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n href=\"/user/show/223837-nikki\">Nikki</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/223837-nikki?shelf=children-s-and-ya\">children-s-and-ya</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/223837-nikki?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1335094014\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12219269597056937047\">Back to my Harry Potter reread! Woo. This was always my favourite of the four books IU+2019ve read, and I was actually a little reluctant to finish it and move on to the next. I enjoyed HarryU+2019s relationships with Lupin and the brief glimpse of his relationship with Sirius, and the way that their inclusion expands the world a little and gives us a hint of HarryU+2019s parentsU+2019 lives, and also of the dark frightened world before Voldemort was defeated.<br /><br />The Dementors, to me, are more frightening than Voldemor</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12219269597056937047\" style=\"display:none\">Back to my Harry Potter reread! Woo. This was always my favourite of the four books IU+2019ve read, and I was actually a little reluctant to finish it and move on to the next. I enjoyed HarryU+2019s relationships with Lupin and the brief glimpse of his relationship with Sirius, and the way that their inclusion expands the world a little and gives us a hint of HarryU+2019s parentsU+2019 lives, and also of the dark frightened world before Voldemort was defeated.<br /><br />The Dementors, to me, are more frightening than Voldemort. At least as far as IU+2019ve read in the books, he canU+2019t take away your capacity for hope, even if he plunges you into despair. The DementorsU+2026 the moment when Sirius cringes in front of them, near the end, is horrible. TheyU+2019re the first real signs of a darker touch to the wizarding world; something that canU+2019t just kill you, but can steal your soul U+2014 Voldemort canU+2019t do that.<br /><br />The teenage drama of Ron and Hermione isU+2026 less fun. I gather it pretty much carries on as it is, and that maybe itU+2019s meant to foreshadow their relationship being different to the relationship with Harry, and itU+2019s not really an aspect IU+2019m interested in. Honestly, IU+2019m not particularly fond of the idea of any pairing up in these books U+2014 unless itU+2019s Sirius and Lupin. Uh.<br /><br />Enjoyed the reread, though IU+2019m not sure I enjoyed it to the same extent I used to.<br /><br /><a href=\"http://breathesbooks.com/2015/07/29/review-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Originally posted here.</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12219269597056937047\" href=\"#\" id='comments_for_review_1335094014' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_90457846\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/90457846\" />\n    <a title=\"Shannon\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1301989-shannon\"><img alt=\"Shannon\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1219235900p2/1301989.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/90457846?book_show_action=false\">Feb 19, 2010</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Shannon\" class=\"user\" name=\"Shannon\" href=\"/user/show/1301989-shannon\">Shannon</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was ok</span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"it was ok\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer90457846\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer3260607031045981561\">People love this book, I know, and I feel bad about giving it just two stars. But look, J.K. Rowling has a great imagination and is skilled at world-building, but those don't automatically add up to a good book. Writing skills are necessary, as is character development. And those are sorely lacking here. I know from having seen all the HP movies and from having read <i>The Deathly Hallows</i> that some things are resolved, such as Snape's hatred of Harry. But, really, what's the point of his hatred? Ho</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText3260607031045981561\" style=\"display:none\">People love this book, I know, and I feel bad about giving it just two stars. But look, J.K. Rowling has a great imagination and is skilled at world-building, but those don't automatically add up to a good book. Writing skills are necessary, as is character development. And those are sorely lacking here. I know from having seen all the HP movies and from having read <i>The Deathly Hallows</i> that some things are resolved, such as Snape's hatred of Harry. But, really, what's the point of his hatred? How is it important to the story, other than to add an unexpected twist at the very end of the series? What's the point of the Dursleys? Why are they so over-the-top hideous to Harry? One expects to suspend disbelief when reading books about wizards and the magical world, but this was just too much. Nobody is purely evil or purely good, and yet everyone that surrounds Harry and his friends is exactly that. It gets tiresome.<br /><br />There's plenty to like about this book. I love the descriptions of Hogwarts, of the people there, and of the classes. I can easily picture everything, and I find myself wishing I could attend Hogwarts, too. But that doesn't change the fact that this story leaves soooo much to be desired. <br /><br />Good for the people who like this series, who can see things in it that I just can't see. I really wish I could love it as they do. But I just can't.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"3260607031045981561\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review90457846\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link90457846\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=90457846&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_90457846'><a id=\"like_count_review_90457846\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/90457846?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_90457846\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_90457846\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=9&rating[page]=10&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=90457846&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_90457846\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 90457846, true, ''); return false;\">13 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/90457846?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=10\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_90457846' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/90457846/comments?reverse=true\">View all 13 comments</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n<div id=\"comment_111773348\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Shannon\" href=\"/user/show/1301989-shannon\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1219235900p1/1301989.jpg\" alt=\"1301989\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/1301989-shannon\">Shannon</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1438439139917422276\"><i>Ciara wrote: \"Why are the comments on this so venomous? Guys, it's an opinion. These books aren't perfect. Granted, people like to pretend they aren't</i></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1438439139917422276\" style=\"display:none\"><i>Ciara wrote: \"Why are the comments on this so venomous? p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=miei\">miei</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9489799-yukino?shelf=2015\">2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1018369540\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5070373332838013410\">SERIE HARRY POTTER n. 3<br /><br />Spiegatemi perchU+00E8 ho letto solo adesso questi libri!!! Bello bello bello!<br /><br />L'inizio U+00E8 come l'altro, Harry in vacanza dagli zii che non puU+00F2 fare nulla, che viene sempre sgridato..perU+00F2 quest'anno i suoi amici riescono a fargli avere i regali per il suo compleanno. E' davvero commevente quando li riceve e li scarta.<br /><br />Le vacanze stanno per finire..e arriva la notizia di un pericoloso killer che U+00E8 riuscito a scappare dalla prigione..e intanto Harry scappa anche lui dopo aver fatto</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5070373332838013410\" style=\"display:none\">SERIE HARRY POTTER n. 3<br /><br />Spiegatemi perchU+00E8 ho letto solo adesso questi libri!!! Bello bello bello!<br /><br />L'inizio U+00E8 come l'altro, Harry in vacanza dagli zii che non puU+00F2 fare nulla, che viene sempre sgridato..perU+00F2 quest'anno i suoi amici riescono a fargli avere i regali per il suo compleanno. E' davvero commevente quando li riceve e li scarta.<br /><br />Le vacanze stanno per finire..e arriva la notizia di un pericoloso killer che U+00E8 riuscito a scappare dalla prigione..e intanto Harry scappa anche lui dopo aver fatto gonfiare come un pallone sua zia.<br /><br />Fortunatamente non viene sospeso, anzi viene messo sotto protezione perchU+00E8 in realtU+00E0 il killer scappato di prigione U+00E8 un mago potentissimo al servizio di Voldemort e il suo obiettivo U+00E8 uccidere Harry.<br /><br />Da qui se ne vedono delle belle. Pieno di colpi di scena..vedi Crosta & Co..e di scene divertenti che smorzano un pU+00F2 l'atmosfera (Hermione che schiaffeggia Malfoy la migliore!) Bello veramente. Il nostro piccolo Harry sta crescendo e..Expecto Patronum!!!! ma quanto mi sono galvanizzata quando c'U+00E8 riuscito? e la spiegazione di Silente *_*<br /><br />Insomma ormai il Castello di Hogwarts U+00E8 diventata casa mia. ^_^<br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5070373332838013410\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1177336654\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12345428060665018134\">First re-read since... what, has it already been 14 years? I definitely need that special thing that a certain character got ifyaknowwhatImean.<br /><br />This gets 5 stars just out of principle. If this book is not the essence of fun and entertainment, I don't know what is. It's also unbelievable how much more mature and simply <i>better</i> the language/storytelling in this third installation is, compared to the previous two -- though this might as well be because I'm getting used to/into it more the more I read</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12345428060665018134\" style=\"display:none\">First re-read since... what, has it already been 14 years? I definitely need that special thing that a certain character got ifyaknowwhatImean.<br /><br />This gets 5 stars just out of principle. If this book is not the essence of fun and entertainment, I don't know what is. It's also unbelievable how much more mature and simply <i>better</i> the language/storytelling in this third installation is, compared to the previous two -- though this might as well be because I'm getting used to/into it more the more I read this series (it might also be as well thanks to the amazing Stephen Fry).<br /><br />This story is magical, simply and purely magical.<br /><br />P.S.: Still not sure if I should be reading or listening to the books starting from book 4 or 5. They're just getting so long and I don't know if I could stomach the end of book 6 while out and about, listening to it while commuting (also I feel that might do the book way too much of a disservice...?).<br /><br />Anywhoo. Me gusta!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12345428060665018134\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1149132551?book_show_action=false\">Jan 21, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Niina\" class=\"user\" name=\"Niina\" href=\"/user/show/11898921-niina\">Niina</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9789513117375\" href=\"/book/show/3310088-harry-potter-ja-azkabanin-vanki\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1149132551\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13040255699994518948\">Toiseksi paras Potter-kirjoista. Toisin kuin kaksi edellistU+00E4, kolmas ja neljU+00E4s kirja kestU+00E4vU+00E4t uudelleen lukemisen. TU+00E4mU+00E4 oli omalla kohdallani vU+00E4hintU+00E4 U+00E4n neljU+00E4s lukukerta. Kolmannessa osassa esiteltiin paljon uusia hahmoja, outoja olentoja ja velhomaailman ihmeitU+00E4. Suosikkini uusista tulokkaista on ehdottomasti persoonallinen kissa Koukkujalka. Vaikka Rowling kirjoittikin teoksen masentuneena (siitU+00E4 ankeuttajat), ei teos ole toivottoman synkkU+00E4. </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1149132551\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right Smith\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/24367086-joshua-smith\"><img alt=\"Joshua Smith\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1440859857p2/24367086.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Joshua Smith\" class=\"user\" name=\"Joshua Smith\" href=\"/user/show/24367086-joshua-smith\">Joshua Smith</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\"       <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/24367086-joshua-smith?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/24367086-joshua-smith?shelf=2016-read\">2016-read</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1664133323\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1136825557223632877\">4.5 Stars. I don't know if I should do four or five stars. On one hand, It really was amazing. The characters were developed, history was filled in, things got more complex, and the story felt like it started building to something bigger. On the other hands, I have a guilty conscious when I give it five stars because I can't help but think of that fucking time turner and how flawed everything about it is. </span>\n\n          </span>\n id=\"reviewTextContainer1705062775\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5619770350184395265\">Es svinU+012Bgi atzU+012Btos, ka esmu kU+013Cuvusi atkarU+012Bga no Harija Potera. Ja iepriekU+0161 U+0113jU+0101 grU+0101mata iet uz beigU+0101m, bet nU+0101kamU+0101 bibliotU+0113kU+0101 nav, es palieku stipri nervoza. TU+0101 viennozU+012BmU+012Bgi ir atkarU+12BBa!<br />U+0160 U+012B daU+13CA man U+013Coti, U+013Coti patika. JU+101Dodas medU+012Bt Uguns biU+137Eris!</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25821784-xime-garc-a?shelf=love-love-love\">love-love-love</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/25821784-xime-garc-a?shelf=reseU+0F1Ados\">reseU+0F1Ados</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer997087263\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15635587665523523280\"><b> <blockquote>U+2014 U+00BFPiensas que los muertos a los que hemos querido nos abandonan del todo? U+00BFNo crees que los recordamos especialmente en los mayores peligros? Tu padre vive en ti, Harry, y se manifiesta claramente cuando lo necesitas. U+0BFDe quU+00E9 otra forma podrU+0EDAs haber creado ese Patronus tan especial? Cornamenta volviU+00F3 a galopar esta noche. [...] AsU+00ED que anoche realmente viste a tu padre... lo encontraste dentro de ti mismo. </blockquote> </b><br><br>Estoy muy triste. En serio, esta novela es muy triste cuando uno la relee ya conociendo</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15635587665523523280\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <blockquote>U+2014 U+00BFPiensas que los muertos a los que hemos querido nos abandonan del todo? U+00BFNo crees que los recordamos especialmente en los mayores peligros? Tu padre vive en ti, Harry, y se manifiesta claramente cuando lo necesitas. U+0BFDe quU+00E9 otra forma podrU+0EDAs haber creado ese Patronus tan especial? Cornamenta volviU+00F3 a galopar esta noche. [...] AsU+00ED que anoche realmente viste a tu padre... lo encontraste dentro de ti mismo. </blockquote>\n</b><br><br>Estoy muy triste. En serio, esta novela es muy triste cuando uno la relee ya conociendo el final de las cosas. <br><br><u>Amo a los Merodeadores</u>. Creo que por eso este es uno de mis favoritos en la saga. Es uno de los libros en donde hallamos mU+00E1s informaciU+00F3n sobre este grupo de amigos. <br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1413038905i/11458637._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"318\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1431056045i/14789150._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"450\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1413038905i/11458636._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"282\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1431056045i/14789151._SY540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"560\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>A veces me pregunto cU+00F3mo todo habrU+0EDA sido si todos los Merodeadores siguieran vivos y juntos... pero si uno se pone a pensar, al menos se sabe que estU+00E1n los cuatro juntos de nuevo. <b>*try not to cry* *cry a lot*</b><br><br>No puedo ser imparcial con estos libros. Me retiro. <br><br><b>Dibujos por <a href=\"http://viria13.deviantart.com/gallery/24966310/Harry-Potter\" rel=\"nofollow\">Viria13</a>. Entren a ver sus dibujos, son muy buenos.</b></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15635587665523523280\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n After 14 years that I've been waiting... to find the courage to start this saga and surpass my \"trama\" and now I just can't stand the idea of finishing!!!!! <br><br><u>\n  <b>Harry don't leave me!</b>\n</u> <br><br>This book IS AMAZING!!! I loved the first two but this one was MIND Blowing! I just <b>loved it<br><br>LOVED IT<br><br>LOVED IT</b><br><br>And then there is Sirius Black... you just can't help not falling in love with Harry's father best friend! Locked up in the worst prison of all Azkaban for 12 years! :((( <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1420717966ra/13255398.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"260\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>This book just amazes you and keeps your eyes enchanted on every single page! An adventure that we live, that we fight for! Rowling's style is just ... Mind blowing! <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1420718669ra/13255401.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"260\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Una saga che non fa altro che migliorare, che non fa altro che tenermi incollata alle pagine e trasmettermi un milione di emozioni! Stupenda! Per ora questo libro U+00E8 il mio preferito anche se ho amato ed adorato anche i primi due! E' molto difficile scegliere in realtU+00E0, semplicemente questo mi ha completamente rapita!<br><br>Stupendo!!!!!<br><br><img <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1684625766\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13187527458624226827\"><br>I was reading this on-off and recently finished it. It is re-read (may be 5th time), but it is my least favorite of Harry Potter books. <br><br>Many of my GR friends like this and raves about this being the most favorite of theirs but it didn't work out for me. Reason - <b>time travelling</b>. People who know me or at least read my profile, knows that I simply don't like (read hate) time travelling. The concept makes me highly uncomfortable - even Hermione confirms that -<br><b><br>\"Harry, what do you think you'd do if y</b></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText13187527458624226827\" style=\"display:none\"><br>I was reading this on-off and recently finished it. It is re-read (may be 5th time), but it is my least favorite of Harry Potter books. <br><br>Many of my GR friends like this and raves about this being the most favorite of theirs but it didn't work out for me. Reason - <b>time travelling</b>. People who know me or at least read my profile, knows that I simply don't like (read hate) time travelling. The concept makes me highly uncomfortable - even Hermione confirms that -<br><b><br>\"Harry, what do you think you'd do if you saw yourself bursting into Hagrid's house?\" said Hermione.<br><br>\"I'd - I'd think I'd gone mad,\" said Harry, \"or I'd think there was some Dark Magic going on -\"<br><br>\"<i>Exactly!</i> You wouldn't understand, you might even attack yourself! Don't you see? Professor McGonagall told me what awful things have happened when wizards have meddled with time. ...Loads of them ended up killing their past or future selves by mistake!\"<br></b><br><br>But regardless it is still great read because of Sirius and Lupin and <b>\n  <i>Moony, Padfoot, Prongs and wormtail. </i>\n</b><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470291484i/19910137._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>But this one is my favorite -<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470291484i/19910139._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13187527458624226827\" </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1577434013\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer14514176039854531642\">I am basically asking for my heart to be ripped out and trampled on. I <i>know</i> what happens to some of these characters. Yet I have fallen deeply in love with them anyway. I have moved past really liking and caring about the characters, to wanting to pull them out of the book, hug them, then protect them from any bad thing ever! I'm in trouble....<br /><br />The Weaslys continue being awesome! The twins are now my favorite characters.<br /><br />Hermione.....just don't know what to make of her. I was agreeing with her a s</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText14514176039854531642\" style=\"display:none\">I am basically asking for my heart to be ripped out and trampled on. I <i>know</i> what happens to some of these characters. Yet I have fallen deeply in love with them anyway. I have moved past really liking and caring about the characters, to wanting to pull them out of the book, hug them, then protect them from any bad thing ever! I'm in trouble....<br /><br />The Weaslys continue being awesome! The twins are now my favorite characters.<br /><br />Hermione.....just don't know what to make of her. I was agreeing with her a some points, mostly in the beginning, but she remains very annoying. I also got to the point where I absolutely hated her for a while. On that note, I have now seen the first movie. Hermione is far less annoying in the movie. Yeah, just don't know what to make of that.<br /><br />Lupin is awesome! <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ please let him come back!!  <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Defense Against the Dark Arts class is something else.<br /><br />I still don't understand why people like Snape. I'm hoping for more development as the series continues!<br /><br />This book was, by far, the best plot wise.<br />And we finally got some back story!! Yaaay!!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"14514176039854531642\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div         <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9788478885190\" href=\"/book/show/357546.Harry_Potter_y_el_prisionero_de_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/17658376-javiera?shelf=2015\">2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1386964441\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9779909210596671336\">Lo que mU+00E1s me gusto de este libro es que se puede ver un cambio en la forma de escribir que va de dos libros anteriores con mucha, para mi parecer, narraciU+00F3n infantil a un libro con una narraciU+00F3n mU+00E1s adolescente. De los tres libros que solo llevo de la saga, este es el que mU+00E1s me ha gustado.<br /><br />Siempre dije que Harry Potter era una lectura pendiente y despuU+00E9s de haber visto todas las pelU+0EDCulas una y otra vez, me arrepiento tanto de no haberlos leU+0EDDo antes de verlas por que asU+00ED me sorprenderU+0EDA mU+00E1s cu</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9779909210596671336\" style=\"display:none\">Lo que mU+00E1s me gusto de este libro es que se puede ver un cambio en la forma de escribir que va de dos libros anteriores con mucha, para mi parecer, narraciU+00F3n infantil a un libro con una narraciU+00F3n mU+00E1s adolescente. De los tres libros que solo llevo de la saga, este es el que mU+00E1s me ha gustado.<br /><br />Siempre dije que Harry Potter era una lectura pendiente y despuU+00E9s de haber visto todas las pelU+0EDCulas una y otra vez, me arrepiento tanto de no haberlos leU+0EDDo antes de verlas por que asU+00ED me sorprenderU+0EDA mU+00E1s cuando los leo. <br /><br />Cosas que me gustaron: Sirius Black, la forma en que apareciU+00F3 y la carta que le escribiU+00F3 a Harry al final del libro <3 siempre he amado a ese personaje y lo seguirU+00E9 amando.<br />Cosas que no me gustaron: Ninguna. <br /><br />Esta demU+00E1s decir que esta super mega recomendadisimo la lectura de Harry Potter, casi todo el mundo lo ha leU+0EDDo y es fascinante!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9779909210596671336\" id=\"reviewTextContainer741069190\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12129207324763729603\">Actual Rating: 5 Animagus Stars!<br><br><img just a roughly skimming review. More detailed review will be posted by the end of the month!</u><br><br>The Prisoner of Azkaban begins the trend of the books getting steadily darker as they move towards the actual return of Voldemort in Goblet of Fire. Dementors are introduced, the creatures which feed on the sadness of humans, and the conditions at the wizarding prison Azkaban are spelled out. We learn more about the inherent prejudices o</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12129207324763729603\" style=\"display:none\">Actual Rating: 5 Animagus Stars!<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1446002560ra/16733173.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"190\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><u>I finished it last night so, this is just a roughly skimming review. More detailed review will be posted by the end of the month!</u><br><br>The Prisoner of Azkaban begins the trend of the books getting steadily darker as they move towards the actual return of Voldemort in Goblet of Fire. Dementors are introduced, the creatures which feed on the sadness of humans, and the conditions at the wizarding prison Azkaban are spelled out. We learn more about the inherent prejudices of wizards and witches through Professor Lupin, a werewolf who takes over the perpetually rotating Defense Against the Dark Arts teaching position.<br><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12129207324763729603\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div id=\"reviewTextContainer1469416088\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8834051576916515832\">Review for audiobook ~ 5 stars story  5 stars narration:<br />I really enjoyed this story. It was so well written and extremely enjoyable. The world of Harry Potter is so magical and I wish I could visit! My first stop would be Flourish & Blotts and after the books, I'd head to Hogsmeade... but since I'm a muggle I can't go. *Sigh* At least I can go when I read about Harry Potter. <br />The narration by Jim Dale for this book and series is over the top wonderful! It's hard to believe it is just one narr</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8834051576916515832\" style=\"display:none\">Review for audiobook ~ 5 stars story U+266B 5 stars narration:<br />I really enjoyed this story. It was so well written and extremely enjoyable. The world of Harry Potter is so magical and I wish I could visit! My first stop would be Flourish & Blotts and after the books, I'd head to Hogsmeade... but since I'm a muggle I can't go. *Sigh* At least I can go when I read about Harry Potter. <br />The narration by Jim Dale for this book and series is over the top wonderful! It's hard to believe it is just one narrator! The things he can do with his voice is truly amazing. I am in awe! I can't wait to listen to more! \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1351360130\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4564012676472097457\">*RE-READ*<br /><br />What an amazing story! Not only is there great character development in each installment in this series, but there's also fantastic world building. In this book, Hogsmeade is introduced along with new creatures in the wizarding world. We also meet new characters like Professor Lupin, Professor Trelawney, and Sirius Black. There are so many fun scenes in this along with dark chapters. This book has a really good balance of everything, including beautiful writing. As always, I'm blown awa</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4564012676472097457\" style=\"display:none\">*RE-READ*<br /><br />What an amazing story! Not only is there great character development in each installment in this series, but there's also fantastic world building. In this book, Hogsmeade is introduced along with new creatures in the wizarding world. We also meet new characters like Professor Lupin, Professor Trelawney, and Sirius Black. There are so many fun scenes in this along with dark chapters. This book has a really good balance of everything, including beautiful writing. As always, I'm blown away by Harry Potter and I'm left dumbfounded.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4564012676472097457\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n Altrimenti come avresti fatto a evocare proprio quel Patronus? Ramoso U+00E8 tornato a correre la notte scorsa\" <br />Penso di non aver mai pianto cosU+00EC tanto per un libro.</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter id=\"freeTextContainer9509962982545641490\"><br />4.5/5<br /><br />You all were right. Although those little fights they kept having in the middle of the book kept breaking me. :( :( I just ship their friendship so much. I don't want anything to tear them apart.<br />I'm truly excited/nervous to see where the series goes next and what You-Know-Who comes up with! <br /><br /></span>\n\n          </span>\n class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/40088076-chelsea-martin\"><img alt=\"Chelsea Martin\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1424767050p2/40088076.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Chelsea Martin\" class=\"user\" name=\"Chelsea Martin\" href=\"/user/show/40088076-chelsea-martin\">Chelsea Martin</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\"            >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5714590678246826053\">This is my favorite of the books so far. The movie did a good job, but the book has SO much more detail. I really loved all of the little hints we got to future books--like the mentions of Cho Chang and Cedric Diggory. I loved seeing more of the Quidditch games! I wish they'd shown more of it in the movie. Even though I'd read this before, I remember the movies more. <br /><br />I'm very happy to be rereading them! </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1474999028\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1301377157\" />\n    <a title=\"Rowan\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/21665136-rowan\"><img alt=\"Rowan\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1434915199p2/21665136.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1301377157?book_show_action=false\">Dec 29, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Rowan\" class=\"user\" name=\"Rowan\" href=\"/user/show/21665136-rowan\">Rowan</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9789076174143\" href=\"/book/show/871319.Harry_Potter_en_de_Gevangene_van_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1301377157\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4646283686001434603\">Ik vond dit deel echt heel erg leuk om te lezen, hoewel ik sommige dingen toch beter vond in de films. Zoals het stuk dat Harry met Scheurbek over het meer vliegt of het stuk waarin Harry en Hermelien teruggaan in de tijd.<br />Maar desalniettemin heb ik van elke bladzijde genoten. Zwarts is echt ontzettend lief, net als Lupos (waarvan ik het nog steeds zo jammer vind dat hij weg ging), Scheurbek en Hagrid. <br />Alleen maar liefde voor dit boek!</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1301377157\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div });\n\n//]]>\n</script>  <script type=\"text/javascript\">\n  //<![CDATA[\n      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');\n      var $copy;\n      if ($ratingGraph.length > 0) {\n          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();\n          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');\n          $copy.find('script').remove();\n          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);\n      }\n  //]]>\n  </script>\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n<div id=\"bookReviews\">\n  \n\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section firstReview\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1951264\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1951264\" />\n    <a title=\"Namratha\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/114559-namratha\"><img alt=\"Namratha\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1406702134p2/114559.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1951264?book_show_action=false\">May 12, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Namratha\" class=\"user\" name=\"Namratha\" href=\"/user/show/114559-namratha\">Namratha</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=mystery\">mystery</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=classics\">classics</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=adventure\">adventure</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=childrens-fantasy\">childrens-fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=ya-lit\">ya-lit</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=books-i-love\">books-i-love</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=pottermania\">pottermania</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/114559-namratha?shelf=children-s\">children-s</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1951264\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10574312706152194200\">Life at the Dursleys is the usual unholy hell, accentuated this time around by the presence of Aunt Marge (<i>horrible sister to the terrible Mr.D</i>). Constant barbs make <b>Harry</b> lose his temper and unknowingly inflate Aunt Marge (<i>a serious bit of Non-Permissive Underage Magic</i>). Resigned to the fact that he will be expelled from Hogwarts, Harry sets off on his own and after one bone-rattling ride on the magical Knight Bus, unfortunately ends up meeting the Minister of Magic himself. <br />Talk 'bout rotten l</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10574312706152194200\" style=\"display:none\">Life at the Dursleys is the usual unholy hell, accentuated this time around by the presence of Aunt Marge (<i>horrible sister to the terrible Mr.D</i>). Constant barbs make <b>Harry</b> lose his temper and unknowingly inflate Aunt Marge (<i>a serious bit of Non-Permissive Underage Magic</i>). Resigned to the fact that he will be expelled from Hogwarts, Harry sets off on his own and after one bone-rattling ride on the magical Knight Bus, unfortunately ends up meeting the Minister of Magic himself. <br />Talk 'bout rotten luck.<br /><br />But he gets off scot free. <br />Why? <br />Because a spot of underage magic is nothing compared to the more pressing matter of an escaped dangerous convict, <b>Sirius Black</b>. A follower of Voldemort, Black has broken out of the wizard prison Azkaban for the apparently express purpose of scouring out and murdering Harry Potter.<br /><br />So another year at Hogwarts starts with the spectre of Sirius Black hanging over everyone's heads. But there is also a a new Defence Against The Dark Arts teacher, <b>Remus Lupin</b> who seems to know his grindylows from his Hinkypunks. There are also the much-awaited trips into the glorious Hogsmeade. <br /><br />But there is also a wee bit of puzzlement for Harry as to why people keep telling him NOT to go looking for Sirius Black. After all, one doesn't go looking for his prospective murderer! But BlackU+2019s past is entwined with HarryU+2019s and thereU+2019s serious evil underfoot.<br /><br />Adding to the joyous proceedings are the shudder-worthy <b>Dementors</b>. This was RowlingU+2019s imagination at itU+2019s scariest best. Faceless, cloaked figures with decaying hands who feed on human happiness, they leave despair and depression in their wake. <br /><br />Infact,Rowling introduced some of her most innovative creations in this book: <b>The Knight-Bus</b>, <b>Dementors</b>, <b>Boggarts</b>, <b>Hogsmeade</b>, <b>The MarauderU+2019s Map</b>, <b>Patronuses</b>, <b>Hippogriffs</b>, <b>Animagi</b> and <b>the Time-Turner</b>. She also created two extremely memorable characters in Remus Lupin and Sirius Black. <br /><br /><b>\n  <u>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</u>\n</b> takes delightfully shocking twists and turns and keeps the reader completely smitten. For me, this book reaffirmed what true friendship and loyalty is all about. I am not ashamed to say that I teared up more than once.<br /><br />The book was perfect in every way: narration, build-up and unexpected surprises, all tied together in Rowling's inimitable style.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10574312706152194200\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter \n\n<div id=\"review_1669315813\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1669315813\" />\n    <a title=\"Jackie (JackiesPaperbackWonders)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/50452403-jackie-jackiespaperbackwonders\"><img alt=\"Jackie (JackiesPaperbackWonders)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473278633p2/50452403.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1669315813?book_show_action=false\">Sep 05, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jackie (JackiesPaperbackWonders)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jackie (JackiesPaperbackWonders)\" href=\"/user/show/50452403-jackie-jackiespaperbackwonders\">Jackie (JackiesPaperbackWonders)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50452403-jackie-jackiespaperbackwonders?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n                  <em>\n                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,\n                    <a href=\"#\" onclick=\"Effect.toggle('reviewTextContainer1669315813'); return false;\">click here.</a>\n                  </em>\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1669315813\" class=\"readable\"\n                    style=\"display:none\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17830593080475671404\">Since so many people have already read this book and are dazzled by its brilliance, there isn't actually much point in reviewing it. I'm simply doing this because there are a couple of things I noticed while reading the book that I'd like to share and I'd also like to praise J.K. Rowling because she's just absolutely amazing. <br />I'm not going to deny that the Prisoner of Azkaban is my favorite of all the HP books, mainly due to the introduction of the Marauders and the fact that they are of immedia</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17830593080475671404\" style=\"display:none\">Since so many people have already read this book and are dazzled by its brilliance, there isn't actually much point in reviewing it. I'm simply doing this because there are a couple of things I noticed while reading the book that I'd like to share and I'd also like to praise J.K. Rowling because she's just absolutely amazing. <br />I'm not going to deny that the Prisoner of Azkaban is my favorite of all the HP books, mainly due to the introduction of the Marauders and the fact that they are of immediate importance to the story, they're not just there until their significance in the story is only revealed at, for example, the end of the series (Snape). The whole story of the Marauders is also beautiful and tragic at the same time and it just messes with my feelings.<br />***THE NEXT PART CONTAINS SPOILERS NOT ONLY FOR THE PRISONER OF AZKABAN, BUT ALSO FOR THE GOBLET OF FIRE AND ORDER OF THE PHOENIX.*** <br /> The first thing I'd like to discuss is that, and I only noticed this when re-reading it, this book is basically the introduction to the complication of the entire series. Professor Trelawney's prediction points out that the servant of Voldemort will set out and help bring the Dark Lord to power and everyone knows she was referring to Peter Pettigrew. But I didn't realize how important this was until I thought about how, in the Goblet of Fire, Pettigrew is the one performing the ritual to give Voldemort a new body. I was literally MIND-BLOWN! Can we all just bow down to J.K. Rowling and her sheer talent of making things fit together perfectly? <br />Rereading it also made me love Sirius and Remus all the more, I'm sure I'm not the only one who thinks they're absolutely precious. Pettigrew's escape made me all the more sad since I realized that Sirius died (Order of the Phoenix) without being proven innocent *cue the tears* and, let's not deny it, we all got a bit excited when we thought Harry would live with him and get away from those awful Dursleys. And once again, I'd like to commend J.K. Rowling for creating characters so wonderful and so dear to all our hearts.<br />5/5 stars for this work of art! (I know this review was pretty long, but I just wanted to share my thoughts with you guys because my mind was literally blown, also, thanks for reading this far!)<br /></span>\n  <a
