           <span id=\"reviewTextContainer857517110\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17488844439725067767\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1405749709ra/10445311.gif\" width=\"250\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I forgot how amazing this part is.Like,<i>really really amazing</i>.The story is so captivating,with so many twists,suprises and little things and details that will make your heart flutter.Every part becomes a piece of one giant puzzle that will make you gasp.And you'll get one of the best characters ever-Lupin and Black:<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1424607802ra/13783052.gif\" width=\"250\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>The friendship between Harry,Ron and Hermione is absolutely beautiful.I love the moments with Oliver Wood and,of course,my babies Fred and George,they got me laughing out loud.Cedric i</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17488844439725067767\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1405749709ra/10445311.gif\" width=\"250\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I forgot how amazing this part is.Like,<i>really really amazing</i>.The story is so captivating,with so many twists,suprises and little things and details that will make your heart flutter.Every part becomes a piece of one giant puzzle that will make you gasp.And you'll get one of the best characters ever-Lupin and Black:<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1424607802ra/13783052.gif\" width=\"250\" height=\"150\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>The friendship between Harry,Ron and Hermione is absolutely beautiful.I love the moments with Oliver Wood and,of course,my babies Fred and George,they got me laughing out loud.Cedric is a sweetie.Sigh.<br>So,overall...one of the best ever.<br><br>Favourite quotes:<br><br>U+201CHe was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run.<b>He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...</b>U+201D <br><br>U+201CWhere is Wood?\" said Harry, suddenly realizing he wasn't there.<br>\"Still in the showers,\" said Fred. \"<b>We think he's trying to drown himself</b>.U+201D<br><br>U+201CHarry!\" said Fred, elbowing Percy out of the way and bowing deeply. \"<b>Simply splendid to see you, old boy-</b>\"<br>\"Marvelous,\" said George, pushing Fred aside and seizing Harry's hand in turn. \"Absolutely spiffing.\"<br>Percy scowled.<br>\"That's enough, now,\" said Mrs. Weasley.<br>\"<b>Mum!\" said Fred as though he'd only just spotted her and seizing her hand too. \"How really corking to see you-</b>U+201D <br><br>U+201CI'll fix it up with Mum and Dad, then I'll call you.<b>I know how to use a fellytone now</b>U+2014\"<br>\"A telephone, Ron,\" said Hermione. \"Honestly, you should take Muggle Studies next year...U+201D <br><br>U+201CGet off me,U+201D Harry spat, throwing PettigrewU+2019s hands off him in disgust. U+201CIU+2019m not doing this for you. IU+2019m doing it because U+2014<b>I donU+2019t reckon my dad wouldU+2019ve wanted them to become killers U+2014 just for you</b>.U+201D </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17488844439725067767\" href=\"#\" class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1329424423\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1329424423\" />\n    <a title=\"Rebecca (whymermaids)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4713345-rebecca-whymermaids\"><img alt=\"Rebecca (whymermaids)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1347213351p2/4713345.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1329424423?book_show_action=false\">Jul 08, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Rebecca (whymermaids)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Rebecca (whymermaids)\" href=\"/user/show/4713345-rebecca-whymermaids\">Rebecca (whymermaids)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\" href=\"/book/show/17347383-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1329424423\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6627858595502460227\">Prisoner of Azkaban always felt a little different than all the other Harry Potter books. It's the only one without a Voldemort (or Voldemort-esque) confrontation at the end, and it starts moving the series into a darker place. The thing I love about the Harry Potter series is that it ages and matures along with its characters, and while the first two books are fun, they're much more juvenile, as Harry and co. are only 11 and 12. Thirteen, however, is the year you start dealing with emotions of</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6627858595502460227\" style=\"display:none\">Prisoner of Azkaban always felt a little different than all the other Harry Potter books. It's the only one without a Voldemort (or Voldemort-esque) confrontation at the end, and it starts moving the series into a darker place. The thing I love about the Harry Potter series is that it ages and matures along with its characters, and while the first two books are fun, they're much more juvenile, as Harry and co. are only 11 and 12. Thirteen, however, is the year you start dealing with emotions of a deeper nature, and you start growing up more. Thirteen is when things get hard, and Prisoner of Azkaban embraces that and allows the characters to go through it.<br /><br />Harry, Ron, and Hermione have always had to deal with things over their heads, but in Prisoner of Azkaban, they have to start making tough choices, and some of them aren't always the right ones. Harry gets more arrogant, foolish, and hotheaded, Ron lets his temper and stubbornness take control of him, and Hermione fails to reel the two of them in with her pretentiousness. All three are stressed, and it takes this year of fighting and self-doubt to force their bond into a stronger one, one that they'll need in the upcoming years.<br /><br />Thirteen is a tough year for anyone, but with a murderer on the loose who's got you in his crosshairs, I can only imagine it would make it ten times worse.<br /><br />When I was younger, POA used to be my favorite of the as-yet-released books because it felt different, because it had a cool time-travel sequence, and because the mystery and confrontation at the end were just so clever and interesting. It's still my favorite of the first three, but some of the later books take over as my all-time favorite; but that being said, Prisoner of Azkaban is still a wonderful installment of the Harry Potter series, and introduced some of the greatest characters of the series.<br /><br />What's not to love? Crookshanks, Butterbeer, Buckbeak, Sirius, Lupin, Trelawney, Hermione hitting Draco, time travel, morphing into animals, two weeks in Diagon Alley, great Quidditch... <br /><br />Love.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6627858595502460227\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/421014443\" />\n    <a title=\"Arielle Walker\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker\"><img alt=\"Arielle Walker\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452561487p2/6762949.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/421014443?book_show_action=false\">Jun 06, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Arielle Walker\" class=\"user\" name=\"Arielle Walker\" href=\"/user/show/6762949-arielle-walker\">Arielle Walker</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=fantasy-unusual\">fantasy-unusual</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6762949-arielle-walker?shelf=children\">children</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer421014443\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7665678215575962001\">As I have previously established when talking about anything Harry Potter here on Goodreads, I cannot write an unbiased review. I cannot even write a <i>biased</i> review! The best I can give you is ramblings about my adoration for the series.<br /><br />Every so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books - in order - over the</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7665678215575962001\" style=\"display:none\">As I have previously established when talking about anything Harry Potter here on Goodreads, I cannot write an unbiased review. I cannot even write a <i>biased</i> review! The best I can give you is ramblings about my adoration for the series.<br /><br />Every so often when I'm sick in bed; a little depressed; or just generally cold and want nothing more than to snuggle up with blankets and forget the world for a few days, I go on a Harry Potter marathon. I read every single one of the books - in order - over the course of around two days (I've read them so often that I can devour them in almost a single go now) followed by as many of the films as I can fit into the time I have left, before I'm forced back into reality.<br /><br />I am one of the Harry Potter generation. I was four when this first book was published, fourteen when the series concluded, and around the same age as the characters in the films when they eventually came out. I still remember my mother insisting that I was too young to read <i>The Philosopher's Stone</i> (at the age of 5) and so I hid it under the sofa cushions so I could read in secret anyway. <br /><br />I don't think I could pick a favourite Harry Potter book. The answer would change depending on my mood, on the weather, on the time of day, on whatever I felt like reading at the time. That being said, I think I would pick <i>Prisoner of Askaban</i> the most often. This is the book where he meets Sirius! How could it not be one of the best? The only book where Voldemort is not the primary plot-point, the only book that breaks all its own rules and brings in time travel, the first book where it shows Harry and Hermione as friends even without Ron, the book where we meet Lupin (and of course Sirius, my all-time favourite character <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[don't even get me started on the Order of the Phoenix, that ending was so not ok <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>)... <br /><br /></span>\n 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=2001\">2001</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=english\">english</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=audio\">audio</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=written-in-1990s\">written-in-1990s</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=2013\">2013</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=female-author\">female-author</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2963923-gitte?shelf=2016\">2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1471423938\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8070188211859080919\"><b> <i>I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.</i> </b><br><a href=\"http://bookwormscloset.com/harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/\" rel=\"nofollow\"> <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452947186i/17763457._SY540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><br>I started rereading this one in December when I had a bit of baby blues. With the huge terrifying change in my life, I needed a book that made me feel warm and fuzzy; like coming home and curling up under a blanket. Something magical with a hint of Christmas. In other words, I needed a dose of Harry Potter.<br><br><i>Hogsmeade looked like a Christmas card; the little thatched cottages and shops were all covered in a layer of crisp snow; there were holy wreaths on</i></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8070188211859080919\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <i>I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.</i>\n</b><br><a href=\"http://bookwormscloset.com/harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/\" rel=\"nofollow\">\n  <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452947186i/17763457._SY540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><br>I started rereading this one in December when I had a bit of baby blues. With the huge terrifying change in my life, I needed a book that made me feel warm and fuzzy; like coming home and curling up under a blanket. Something magical with a hint of Christmas. In other words, I needed a dose of Harry Potter.<br><br><i>Hogsmeade looked like a Christmas card; the little thatched cottages and shops were all covered in a layer of crisp snow; there were holy wreaths on the doors and strings of enchanted candles hanging in the trees.</i><br><br>Having recently watched the first two movies, my choice naturally fell on the third book: The Prisoner of Azkaban. I liked it for all the reasons listed above. It was safe, familiar, warm and friendly. It held my hand when I was feeling shaky about being a mother, it padded me on the head and told me everything was going to be OK. The magic of books never ceases to amaze me!<br><br>IU+2019D forgotten how good the third Harry Potter novel is (even though I reread the entire series only a couple of years ago). I like that Harry is starting to grow up and has a bit of an attitude when it comes to the Dursleys. And I adore Sirius Black! IU+2019ve always had a bit of a crush on him. All in all it was perfect to revisit Hogwarts, Harry and the gang. ItU+2019s nice always to have this series to come back to. Thank you Rowling!<br><br><i>DonU+2019t let the muggles get you down.</i><br><br>My blog: <a href=\"http://bookwormscloset.com/harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Bookworm's Closet</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8070188211859080919\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1471423938\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/845775\" />\n    <a title=\"mary\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/26737-mary\"><img alt=\"mary\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1174367314p2/26737.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/845775?book_show_action=false\">Apr 23, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"mary\" class=\"user\" name=\"mary\" href=\"/user/show/26737-mary\">mary</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer845775\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10948177719071618299\">this is the only harry potter book i'm going to comment on. simply, because this is the only one worth a damn. let's not lie. <br /><br />i started reading the harry potter books one summer in college when i couldn't figure out what all the fuss was about. my little cousins wouldn't shut up, and fundamentalists across the nation were waving their arms around about witchcraft. and i do love seeing the evangelical nation in a huff. the first two went down smoothly, fun stories, simple reads, but very obviousl</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10948177719071618299\" style=\"display:none\">this is the only harry potter book i'm going to comment on. simply, because this is the only one worth a damn. let's not lie. <br /><br />i started reading the harry potter books one summer in college when i couldn't figure out what all the fuss was about. my little cousins wouldn't shut up, and fundamentalists across the nation were waving their arms around about witchcraft. and i do love seeing the evangelical nation in a huff. the first two went down smoothly, fun stories, simple reads, but very obviously children's fiction. <br /><br />this book, however, was the one that really got me hooked. it is notably darker than its predecessors, which i welcomed fully. and it introduced my favorite character by far in the series - sirius. his name is about as subtle as getting whacked in the head with a frying pan, but i guess it's a vehicle for kids to learn about astronomy. and the twisty turny elaborate climax of this book had me gasping and oooohing and made me finish the book in a day. the characters were sympathetic, the concise focus on the story-line was great, and it's the only one i'll willingly read over again. rock on, rowling!<br /><br />unfortunately, it's gone swiftly downhill from there. the later ones are still beach-readable, because even though they are painfully and uncompromisingly and bloatedly LONG, they do have some fun stuff happen. and the big bang last couple chapters are still somewhat gasp-worthy. but huge chunks of the middle should be ripped out at random by her editors, in the purest hope of making the books less tedious. <br /><br />and tedious and children's fiction should not be used in the same sentence. <br /><br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10948177719071618299\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer57105730\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6814728789823690337\">I'm reading this book again. I'm fed up with all of the bad new books I've been trying to read, so it's time to crack open a classic.<br />It's still as enjoyable so far as the first time i read it.<br /><br />Having read it again in 8/2011 I must say this book is STILL good. I think it's when you realize the Harry Potter series is fantastic and for a change the masses who read this series and love it are actually right about it!<br />In this book Harry learns more about his past. He learns to face his fears and gain c</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6814728789823690337\" style=\"display:none\">I'm reading this book again. I'm fed up with all of the bad new books I've been trying to read, so it's time to crack open a classic.<br />It's still as enjoyable so far as the first time i read it.<br /><br />Having read it again in 8/2011 I must say this book is STILL good. I think it's when you realize the Harry Potter series is fantastic and for a change the masses who read this series and love it are actually right about it!<br />In this book Harry learns more about his past. He learns to face his fears and gain control over them, which is important for the next 4 books in the series. You have to wonder if Dumbledore is trying to train Harry to deal with the inevitable in book 7. <br />Hermione has a secret that will be the key to solving a major problem in the book. Come on, if you haven't read this series by now, you are behind, deprived and missing out!<br /><br />Also, might I add that the werewolf in the movie looked stupid? Why didn't they make the werewolf look like a dang wolf instead of a naked stupid looking rat thing? This is around the time the movies start to fall apart compared to the books. Some of it was good, but most of it was missing the awesome that was in the book! Not to mention that scene at the beginning. <br /><br /><br />Reread it again. DANG I LOVE THIS BOOK. It's just so good. It's full of things you don't think are important, but the are and it's great how it all comes together.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6814728789823690337\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));;         <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\" href=\"/book/show/17347383-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8800217-lonneke?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8800217-lonneke?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1201515862\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4570121142864319086\">I love this book. It might even be my favourite out of all of them. This is why we need a prequel, the story of the Marauders in Hogwarts would be the second best book series ever. In this book we get to know Lupin and Black and from the first time I read this book I loved them. They are highly in my top 10 of favourite characters. Also the trio is growing up, they're not the little 'innocent' childeren anymore that they were in the start of the series. I love their friendship, who doesn't want</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4570121142864319086\" style=\"display:none\">I love this book. It might even be my favourite out of all of them. This is why we need a prequel, the story of the Marauders in Hogwarts would be the second best book series ever. In this book we get to know Lupin and Black and from the first time I read this book I loved them. They are highly in my top 10 of favourite characters. Also the trio is growing up, they're not the little 'innocent' childeren anymore that they were in the start of the series. I love their friendship, who doesn't want anything like it? The fact that they're so different, but the friendship works so well. There isn't a way that J.K Rowling could have done any better than she has with these three. <br><br>My mind is all over the place everytime I read this. It's so actionpacked and even though I have read it like 10 times I'm still always on the edge of my seat the last 100 pages wishing it didn't end the way it's does. (But also not really, because otherwise the other books would have been different.) I can't wait to start the next one! :)<br><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1452114624ra/17649339.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1433575029\" />\n    <a title=\"Liam Gardner\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner\"><img alt=\"Liam Gardner\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451864455p2/38154660.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1433575029?book_show_action=false\">Dec 02, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Liam Gardner\" class=\"user\" name=\"Liam Gardner\" href=\"/user/show/38154660-liam-gardner\">Liam Gardner</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1433575029\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8596053100151331394\">I don't even know where to start with this book! It was well constructed and written BEAUTIFULLY! It gave me so many different emotions. I could not get enough of this, any free time I had was spent reading this book.<br /><br />The Prisoner Of Azkaban was by far darker than both The Philosophers Stone and The Chamber Of Secrets which I just loved. The Dementors were absolutely terrifying, the fear that they bring out in Harry is written so well it was almost disturbing! I also love that Harry, Ron and Herm</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8596053100151331394\" style=\"display:none\">I don't even know where to start with this book! It was well constructed and written BEAUTIFULLY! It gave me so many different emotions. I could not get enough of this, any free time I had was spent reading this book.<br /><br />The Prisoner Of Azkaban was by far darker than both The Philosophers Stone and The Chamber Of Secrets which I just loved. The Dementors were absolutely terrifying, the fear that they bring out in Harry is written so well it was almost disturbing! I also love that Harry, Ron and Hermione are also one more step towards adulthood and it definitely shows. Another thing about this book I thoroughly enjoyed was Harry and Professor Lupins relationship it was very heart-warming. I just wish he could have stayed on as the Defense Against The Dark Arts teacher. :(<br /><br />Overall, this book is wonderfully plotted, with lovable characters and a great amount of mystery and excitement so I give it a 5/5 :)</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8596053100151331394\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n You know a book is good when you get warm, fuzzy, happy feelings all over. You know a book is good when you are mind-blown by all of the plot twists you read. You know a book is good when you beg your younger brother to finish the book so that you can discuss it with him. <br><br>You know a book is good--when it's as good as this.<br><br>~<br><br>Oh, and yes, I read this at the same time as my almost eight-year-old br</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2890720433436794555\" style=\"display:none\">You know a book is good when, although it's your first time reading it, you get feelings of nostalgia. You know a book is good when you get warm, fuzzy, happy feelings all over. You know a book is good when you are mind-blown by all of the plot twists you read. You know a book is good when you beg your younger brother to finish the book so that you can discuss it with him. <br><br>You know a book is good--when it's as good as this.<br><br>~<br><br>Oh, and yes, I read this at the same time as my almost eight-year-old brother. title=\"I.H.\" class=\"user\" name=\"I.H.\" href=\"/user/show/34008197-i-h\">I.H.</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1089546550\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8875029712143951781\">Each Harry Potter book presents a new challenge to the young wizard and his Hogwarts counterparts, but I would argue that no book is more crucial to the series than the Prisoner of Azkaban.<br /><br />In this story, Harry gets news that an infamous traitor & murderer, Sirius Black, has escaped from Azkaban. The events that follow are shocking and intriguing in equal measure. But it's the way this book weaves into the long-term Harry Potter story that's so fantastic. Many characters of great importance a</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8875029712143951781\" style=\"display:none\">Each Harry Potter book presents a new challenge to the young wizard and his Hogwarts counterparts, but I would argue that no book is more crucial to the series than the Prisoner of Azkaban.<br /><br />In this story, Harry gets news that an infamous traitor & murderer, Sirius Black, has escaped from Azkaban. The events that follow are shocking and intriguing in equal measure. But it's the way this book weaves into the long-term Harry Potter story that's so fantastic. Many characters of great importance are introduced, and the story sets the scene for much of what is to come, as well as being an c& satisfying story in it's own right.<br /><br />Once again, Rowling triumphs in her storytelling.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8875029712143951781\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3905257-erica\"><img alt=\"Erica\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1441596836p2/3905257.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1464777604?book_show_action=false\">Dec 15, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Erica\" class=\"user\" name=\"Erica\" href=\"/user/show/3905257-erica\">Erica</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\" href=\"/book/show/17347383-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of href=\"/review/list/3905257-erica?shelf=read-2015\">read-2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1464777604\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9388316338599669876\">Re-read December 2015.<br /><br />GOD THIS ONE IS SO GOOD. It's been probably close to 7 or 8 years since I've re-read Prisoner of Azkaban and it was just as magical as my first time reading it. This story is so intricately weaved and detailed, has the perfect balance of happy and sad moments, and we learn so much more about the past in this one GAH ITS JUST THE BEST.</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1464777604\">\n  <td class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/20911318\" />\n    <a title=\"Jessica (Books: A true story)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story\"><img alt=\"Jessica (Books: A true story)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1410551817p2/1113710.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/20911318?book_show_action=false\">Sep 26, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jessica (Books: A true story)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jessica (Books: A true story)\" href=\"/user/show/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story\">Jessica (Books: A true story)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=kindle\">kindle</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=blog\">blog</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=amazon\">amazon</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=5-stars\">5-stars</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=hardcover\">hardcover</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=content-mild\">content-mild</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=ebook-challenge-2013\">ebook-challenge-2013</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=re-read-2013\">re-read-2013</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=to-kids\">to-kids</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1113710-jessica-books-a-true-story?shelf=re-read-2016\">re-read-2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer20911318\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16248982017014319254\">This book is also reviewed on my blog <a href=\"http://www.booksatruestory.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">Books: A true story</a><br /><br />I love the way that J. K. Rowling twists traditional mythology and history. When at the beginning Harry is writing an essay about witch burning, it's just funny that the witches thought it tickled when they were burned. The title of the essay, \"Witch Burning in the Fourteenth Century Was Completely Pointless - discuss\", is just charming. There is so much great humor in the books that just didn't make it into the movie. Ron's phone call is</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16248982017014319254\" style=\"display:none\">This book is also reviewed on my blog <a href=\"http://www.booksatruestory.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">Books: A true story</a><br /><br />I love the way that J. K. Rowling twists traditional mythology and history.  When at the beginning Harry is writing an essay about witch burning, it's just funny that the witches thought it tickled when they were burned.  The title of the essay, \"Witch Burning in the Fourteenth Century Was Completely Pointless - discuss\", is just charming.  There is so much great humor in the books that just didn't make it into the movie.  Ron's phone call is my favorite.  Even her book titles are funny.  \"Broken Balls: When Fortunes Turn Foul.\"  <strong>I just get giddy, now matter how many times I read these books, at the creativity and humor for even the minor details.</strong><br /><br /><em>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</em> was so fun to re-read because she does an excellent job of foreshadowing.  It's so fun seeing something differently for the first time or knowing what she is talking about this time around instead of it being a mystery. I also noticed how good J.K. Rowling was at recapping the first two books very quickly and yet covered all the major things you needed to know.  I don't think I've ever noticed this before but there are a lot of letters and news clippings throughout the book.  I liked how much depth it added.  Definitely more interesting than just being told there was something in the newspaper.<br /><br />Let's gush a little more about J. K. Rowling's writing.  <strong>She has the best blunt honesty that somehow comes off as hilarious</strong>.  For example, her observation of Aunt Marge loving to criticize people so Harry looks untidy on purpose to please her. And Ms. Rowling can spin a web of mystery better than an evil spider from <a href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mirkwood\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\">Mirkwood</a>.  She presents these extremely probable but completely wrong answers to keep you off the trail until she wants you to know the answer.  The best example of this was her clever clues about Sirius Black.<br /><br /><strong>Harry's bittersweet life and humble gratitude make him so likable and relatable.</strong>  I say bittersweet because he is neglected by his family but his life at school is magical.  Harry is very resilient and can joke about the bad things that people say about him.  I thought it was an admirable quality.  I also liked the life lessons that Harry learns at this point in the series.  Sad things happen to Harry to give an opportunity for better things to happen - like when his broom got completely smashed.<br /><br />Can I just say that I'm totally a Hermione and I would take 6 classes, including Muggle Studies, just to see how wizards viewed them.<br /><br /><strong>Something I experienced for the first time was relating to the adults in the story.</strong>  After having my son go to school the first time, I couldn't imagine how hard it would be to put your kids on a train for an entire semester.<br /><br />On a side note - <strong>I'm still curious about how special cats are</strong> in Harry Potter's world since they are important in witch mythology.  In the Harry Potter universe they seem to have more intelligence than an average cat, but I'm wondering if there is more to them than  that.<br /><br /><strong>I read this book along with <a href=\"https://www.pottermore.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\">Pottermore</a> and I really enjoyed the rich backstories.</strong>  Even though they never show up directly in the plots of her novels, it's amazing to me the amount of thought that went into even minor characters.  Marge Dursley, the awful aunt, has an entire backstory that makes everything click about why she acts the way she does.  A huge hallmark of Ms.Rowling's writing is that none of her characters do things without legitimate motivation even if we, the reader, don't know what it is.<br /><br /><strong>Pottermore Review</strong><br /><br />As far as the <a href=\"https://www.pottermore.com/en-us\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\">Pottermore</a> website's new look and navigation go, I hates them both.  It's hard to tell where you are in the story with the new layout.  I really, really miss the old layout.  Pottermore now looks like a bad social networking site with way too many sidebars cluttering things up.  It's just unattractive.  I liked the ending quotes that used to be there so you knew where you were and now they are gone.  It feels like you don't need to read the book as much with the new site, which is sad.  The one nice thing I have to say about it is kudos to them for being extremely accurate with what happens in the book.  That being said, you should definitely check out the site for the awesome backstories and bonus material.  They are pure gold.<br /><br />Read to kids may 15, 2016-September 25, 2016</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16248982017014319254\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_20911318\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_20911318\" ref=\"like\" \n\n<div id=\"review_1531449069\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1531449069\" />\n    <a title=\"Bec\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4619726-bec\"><img alt=\"Bec\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464308147p2/4619726.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1531449069?book_show_action=false\">Apr 25, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Bec\" class=\"user\" name=\"Bec\" href=\"/user/show/4619726-bec\">Bec</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Audiobook 9781781102206\" href=\"/book/show/13612284-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4619726-bec?shelf=library\">library</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4619726-bec?shelf=read-2016\">read-2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1531449069\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6440234503900131560\">This review first appeared on <a href=\"http://readerswonderland.com/review-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Readers in Wonderland</a><br><br><b>INITIAL REACTION</b><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1454802749ra/18016216.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>5 THINGS ABOUT HARRY POTTER AND THE PRISONER OF AZKABAN</b><br><br><i> <u>Things are getting more complicated</u> </i><br>There's nothing wrong with simple story lines and characters, but my favourite books are always complex. Now that the characters are getting older and things are moving along, I'm finally getting more invested in these books. They were entertaining before but now the good stuff is starting. The plot is getting more complicated and less str</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6440234503900131560\" style=\"display:none\">This review first appeared on <a href=\"http://readerswonderland.com/review-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Readers in Wonderland</a><br><br><b>INITIAL REACTION</b><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1454802749ra/18016216.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>5 THINGS ABOUT HARRY POTTER AND THE PRISONER OF AZKABAN</b><br><br><i>\n  <u>Things are getting more complicated</u>\n</i><br>There's nothing wrong with simple story lines and characters, but my favourite books are always complex. Now that the characters are getting older and things are moving along, I'm finally getting more invested in these books. They were entertaining before but now the good stuff is starting. The plot is getting more complicated and less straight forward, the characters are facing some big moral decisions, and not everyone is simply good or evil.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461626131ra/18889539.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><u>\n  <i>There was no Voldemort confrontation</i>\n</u><br>Harry had a showdown with Voldemort manifestations in the first two books, but not Azkaban. Such a confrontation isn't necessary, but I was sort of thinking it might become a tradition of sorts. I was really looking forward to seeing how Voldemort might work into Azkaban and was kind of disappointed when he didn't make an appearance.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461626131ra/18889540.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><u>\n  <i>The characters are growing up</i>\n</u><br>This brings me joy but I'm also kind of scared. Teenage years are an interesting time. Some character get real attitude and from the looks of things Harry is going to be one. He's already starting to sass the adults and show major attitude. I just hope the characters stay entertaining and don't get on my nerves like my little sister did during her teenage years.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461626131ra/18889541.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><i>\n  <u>I understand the fandom's Marauders obsession</u>\n</i><br>I swear half the Harry Potter posts I see on Tumblr are about the Marauders. Which I thought was a strange obsession... until now. I totally get it now. We don't get to see too much of the marauders in Azkaban, but the little glimpses and stories we do get left me wanting to know more about this previous generation of wizards. We really need a book or something about them.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461626131ra/18889542.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><i>\n  <u>Still waiting for some answers (or I missed something?)</u>\n</i><br>There is a high possibility that I missed something while listening to the audiobook, but I feel like I'm missing some important information that is integral to the overarching pot. Mainly why was Voldemort  going after the Potters in the first place? Like I said it's more than likely that I missed the information we got about it or have forgotten it, but if not I really hope we find out soon. I'm getting impatient. I'd also like to know how Voldemort came to power and amassed such a following, and what terribly evil things did he do before killing the Potters?<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461626131ra/18889543.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>\n  <u>In Summary</u>\n</b><br>As the story goes on I become more attached to this world and characters. The first two books were good, but Azkaban has begun to deliver what I've been waiting for: more complicated characters and complex plot lines. I'm still confused about some background aspects to the overarching plot, but I'm hoping those details are filled in during future novels.<br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6440234503900131560\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border id='comments_for_review_1531449069' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/1531449069/comments?reverse=true\">View 2 comments</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_5475737\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/5475737\" />\n    <a title=\"Susan\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/332008-susan\"><img alt=\"Susan\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1188658740p2/332008.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/5475737?book_show_action=false\">Sep 04, 2007</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Susan\" class=\"user\" name=\"Susan\" href=\"/user/show/332008-susan\">Susan</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer5475737\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16626609685346292830\">I am a word nerd, as most of my friends know (and most are themselves, which is why we are friends!). Among the things that bug me are people who mispronounce nuclear as nu-cu-ler (ahem, President Bush). If you are one of these people, stop it. Stop it now. There is only one "u" in the word. My husband is one of these people and is trying to reform. The one time in my life that GWB has been useful to me. I am also aggravated by foliage pronounced or spelled as foilage. Huh? That doesn't make</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16626609685346292830\" style=\"display:none\">I am a word nerd, as most of my friends know (and most are themselves, which is why we are friends!). Among the things that bug me are people who mispronounce nuclear as nu-cu-ler (ahem, President Bush). If you are one of these people, stop it. Stop it now. There is only one \"u\" in the word. My husband is one of these people and is trying to reform. The one time in my life that GWB has been useful to me. I am also aggravated by foliage pronounced or spelled as foilage. Huh? That doesn't make sense. And I prefer empathic over empathetic. I realize both are technically correct, but I suspect that empathetic got in there b/c the grammar gods threw in the towel.<br /><br />What does this have to do with Harry, you ask? Well, Ms. Rowling, who is not, as we all admit, the world's greatest writer while being a helluva story teller, constantly, constantly, constantly writes \"try and.\" This drives me insane. It's fine if she's writing dialogue since this is, in fact, what people say. But to write it as part of your story it should be \"try TO.\" Stupid, but I had to vent somewhere.<br /><br />Venting, mainly because I find writing about these books difficult. What is there left to say? Each one gets better and Prisoner of Azkaban is a huge leap beyond Chamber of Secrets (which is, as I've said before, almost the same book as Sorcerer's Stone). Love the development of the story, love Sirius, love Lupin, love how well Rowling can read and write about the teenaged mind. My 20th high school reunion is coming up and I'm not going for a million and one reasons, but it still has me thinking back to adolescence and pre-adolescence a lot, and she is right on the money. I only wish I could have gone somewhere as interesting as Hogwarts instead of the average American hellhole where I ended up. Wizarding thing aside, is it the boarding school aspect of it that seems so enticing? Can't tell.<br /><br />Another question about Harry's world, though, and I'm going to jump ahead to Goblet of Fire to ask it. Why can't the Weasleys use magic more to make their lives better? Mrs. Weasley gets entire meals to come out of her wand, so why can't Ron just fix up his dress robes or the hole in his bedspread? Why does his stuff have to be such rubbish? Hermione fixes an entire broken pane of glass on the train and he can't magic his clothes to be nicer? It seems inconsistent to me, although I'm sure if I cared enough, there are chatboards galore that would explore these same questions with me. I don't care that much.<br /><br />I also have, I must confess, the world's hugest crush on the film version of Lucius Malfoy. Love that blond wig! In the books, however, Bill Weasley just seems like the coolest guy going. Just wanted to share.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16626609685346292830\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review5475737\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link5475737\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1541467875?book_show_action=false\">Jun 08, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"jamieson\" class=\"user\" name=\"jamieson\" href=\"/user/show/7706640-jamieson\">jamieson</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781551924786\" href=\"/book/show/1099023.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=read-in-2016\">read-in-2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=childrens-literature\">childrens-literature</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7706640-jamieson?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1541467875\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10766651805470063498\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1465397189ra/19350869.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban is probably my second favourite Harry Potter book. I always find myself getting ridiculously emotional about the Marauders. (@J.K Rowling that is the story you should reallyy write who even cares about Harry's kids smh) <br><br>The thing is, I just care about Harry alot. As if he was me actual son, or my little brother. I just really want Harry to be happy and I feel like he (and kind of his history/backstory) is given so much depth in POA. The connection between</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10766651805470063498\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1465397189ra/19350869.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban is probably my second favourite Harry Potter book. I always find myself getting ridiculously emotional about the Marauders. (@J.K Rowling that is the story you should reallyy write who even cares about Harry's kids smh) <br><br>The thing is, I just care about Harry alot. As if he was me actual son, or my little brother. I just really want Harry to be happy and I feel like he (and kind of his history/backstory) is given so much depth in POA. The connection between Harry and Sirius, and Harry finally finding a father figure in both Lupin and Sirius is really important to me, as well as them providing a framework for him being able to \"get to know\" his parents. <br><br>I find the whole Marauder's story kind of tragic - with Lupin & Sirius losing their best friend (and, due to Peter's betrayal, 13 years worth of time with Harry) and so the huge focus of the marauders in this book just makes it an absolute favourite of mine. The ending of the book where Harry gets his letter from Sirius and reads it \"over and over\" and is just so happy makes me happy like <i>bb you deserve all the happiness in the world </i><br><br>I also think that the Quidditch matches in this book are some of the best in the whole series - the one where Gryffindor win the Quidditch Cup is THE BEST of the series, hands down. <br><br>On top of that, we also see time travelling Hermione, Hagrid as a teacher, Hermione being a total badass (damn that hit on Malfoy tho) and breaking rules all over the place, HARRY GETTIN HIS FIREBOLT (a pivotal moment in the young kids life ok), Lupin actually being a good DATDA teacher, Harry & the sexual awakening (Cho Chang got him feeling things omfg ) the Boggart scene, Harry learning to cast a partonus !! Buckbeak !!, Hogsmede (and that damn perfect scene where Fudge talk about Sirius), Ron getting Pig, the Marauders Map, -- Fred & George study in this one ??? and an emotional chat between Dumbledore and Harry about his parents and his choices which was such a perfect conclusion to the book honestly. <br><br><i>Also can we talk about how gloriously Harry's sass shows in this one because he was quippin all over the place</i><br><br>I love POA so much, I only wish it was longer ... </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10766651805470063498\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1541467875\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1541467875\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1541467875&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1541467875'><a id=\"like_count_review_1541467875\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1541467875?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">10 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1541467875\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1541467875\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=10&rating[page]=8&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1541467875&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1541467875\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 1541467875, true, ''); I love all the details and most of all I love being transported to this magical world when I read these books.</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext Rowling\">Prisoner of Azkaban</a>, you turkeys, what did you think?<br /><br />MiloU+0161: I thought that the time-turner was really cool.<br /><br />Pa: How come?<br /><br />MiloU+0161: Because I liked how Harry and Hermione went to save Sirius and save Buckbeak, and how Ron woke up and said what happened.<br /><br />Pa: How about you, Te? Rowling\">Prisoner of Azkaban</a>, you turkeys, what did you think?<br /><br />MiloU+0161: I thought that the time-turner was really cool.<br /><br />Pa: How come?<br /><br />MiloU+0161: Because I liked how Harry and Hermione went to save Sirius and save Buckbeak, and how Ron woke up and said what happened.<br /><br />Pa: How about you, Te? Did you like that part?<br /><br />BrontU+00EB: Yeah, I liked it. I like how they were going back in time. And I love how Harry, at the end, didn't know it [the person who cast the Patronus] was him because he thought it was his dad and it couldn't be him and it's the wizard world, so his dad could have been a ghost there doing the spell even though he was a ghost, but it was actually Harry, but I thought that was an amazing part, and the other one that I liked was that they were going back just to save Harry's godfather, that was really awesome, and even the fact that he was being impatient with whats-his-name...?<br /><br />Pa: Snape?<br /><br />Milos: Lupin<br /><br />BrontU+00EB: Yeah, Lupin. I loved that he was impatinet with Lupin, and then they went to save him even though they wanted to kill Peter Pettigrew. Two little kids saving Harry's godfather. It was awesome. I just think the whole book was amazing.<br /><br />MiloU+0161: Me too. <br /><br />Pa: Wow. That's crazy. Ummm. Did you like the book better than the movie?<br /><br />MiloU+0161: Yeah.<br /><br />BrontU+00EB: Of course we liked the book. Even though we haven't heard all the books we love them because the books are the real story, and the movies are just made up, or some parts are made up from the book, and the book is really the real story. <br /><br />Pa: Cool.<br /><br />MiloU+0161: Next time we go to the movie theatre, if we take Prisoner of Azkaban, I going to take the book up the steps and put it in the theatre we're stiting in and then we can watch it. Anything else?<br /><br />MiloU+0161: No that's it, oh, but I love the book it's really cool.<br /><br />BrontU+00EB: There is one more thing for me to say, though. Even though I like, like one or two maybe of the Gryffindors, I mostly like the Slytherins. I don't know why, but you look in ghosts past, and you can see Harry's dad hurting and torturing Snape, and Snape has been good to Harry, and Harry still doesn't like him, and Snape was in Slytherin, so I just like Slytherin best. Oh, but I like Ginny from Gryffindor, and I love Luna Lovegood the most.<br /><br />MiloU+0161: She's Ravenclaw<br /><br />BrontU+00EB: She wears a blue scarf<br /><br />MiloU+0161: Yeah, Ravenclaw.<br /><br />Pa: So what should we read next? should we finish <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/19302.Pippi_Longstocking__Puffin_Modern_Classics_\" title=\"Pippi Longstocking (Puffin Modern Classics) by Astrid Lindgren\">Pippi</a>, or read <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter___4_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter, #4) by J.K. Rowling\">Goblet of Fire</a> or <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3950967.The_Tales_of_Beedle_the_Bard\" title=\"The Tales of Beedle the Bard by J.K. Rowling\">Beedle the Bard</a>? Rowling\">Beedle the Bard</a> it is. class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_597854990\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/597854990\" />\n    <a title=\"Nina\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/7664770-nina\"><img alt=\"Nina\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473158830p2/7664770.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/597854990?book_show_action=false\">Apr 27, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Nina\" class=\"user\" name=\"Nina\" href=\"/user/show/7664770-nina\">Nina</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408812839\" href=\"/book/show/10840495-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=owned\">owned</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=5-star\">5-star</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=ya-pnr\">ya-pnr</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=read-in-2013\">read-in-2013</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=hp\">hp</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7664770-nina?shelf=reread\">reread</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer597854990\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6535145328289788366\">I keep fooling myself, thinking I'm going to be able to write a coherent review for any of the books in this series, when deep down I know that this is just too much awesomeness for my laptop's keyboard to process - or my brain.<br /><br />This book is possibly one of the best things I have ever read. It has a pretty convoluted storyline, especially towards the end, which makes me indescribably happy. It has characters that I wish I could meet in real life - and I know I sometimes say that about, say, dude</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6535145328289788366\" style=\"display:none\">I keep fooling myself, thinking I'm going to be able to write a coherent review for any of the books in this series, when deep down I know that this is just too much awesomeness for my laptop's keyboard to process - or my brain.<br /><br />This book is possibly one of the best things I have ever read. It has a pretty convoluted storyline, especially towards the end, which makes me indescribably happy. It has characters that I wish I could meet in real life - and I know I sometimes say that about, say, dude X in that romance novel and girl Y in that historical fic, but this time I really do, because they seem so real I want to be friends with them - or beat the shit out of them, according to their role in the story, obviously.<br /><br />I loved the fact that this book is meatier and longer than the first two HP books - I read it in 24 hours straight anyway, but that's beside the point. I can't wait to read the next, 800-page books, which will hopefully last me more than a day.<br /><br />As usual, Dumbledore astonishes me with the pure magic that his brain and heart are, Hagrid makes me want to hug and pet him (in a completely non-sexual way), and I might have developed a slight tendency to daydream about a conflicted and lusty romance between Remus Lupin and Sirius Black, but that's one of the best parts of reading non-romance novels, right? You can imagine your own romance story.<br /><br />I swear, my heart is just about exploding right now, and I was pacing around the whole house during the last sixty pages. I still can't accept that this is over.<br /><br />So, now I'm going to have to wait 10 days until books #4 and #5 are delivered. Everyday life is going to be pointless until then.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6535145328289788366\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review597854990\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link597854990\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" The whole story is so well presented , with so many twists and little surprises that will make your heart flutter . Of course , my little sweeties , Fred and George made me laugh out loud , and Oliver Wood was amazing . Also , we can't forget Lee Jordan , he made me laugh with tears .<br><br>And Ron... Ron was absolutely the cutest person in this part.<br><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1448139252ra/17100130.gif\" width=\"350\" height=\"170\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><i>U+201CI'll fix it up with Mum and Dad, then I'll call you.<b>I know how to use a fellytone nowU+2014\"</b><br>\"A telephone, Ron,\" said Hermione. \"Honestly, you should take Muggle Studies next year...U+201D </i><br><br><br><br>Lupin and Sirius Black are two of my other favorite characters from the series. itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1666087225\" />\n    <a title=\"Humera gull\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/56496640-humera-gull\"><img alt=\"Humera gull\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474169133p2/56496640.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1666087225?book_show_action=false\">Jul 28, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Humera gull\" class=\"user\" name=\"Humera gull\" href=\"/user/show/56496640-humera-gull\">Humera gull</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1666087225\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15812494762444255307\">In my opinion, the Harry Potter series has one of the best casts of characters I have ever read. J. K. Rowling really has a way of bringing her characters to life and making them seem so very realistic. The friendship between Harry, Ron and Hermione takes on a different tone in this book. Hermione has finally bitten off more than she can chew, and that along with her new pet and some tough choices she makes in an attempt to be a good friend, jeopardizes her relationship with both Harry and Ron,</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15812494762444255307\" style=\"display:none\">In my opinion, the Harry Potter series has one of the best casts of characters I have ever read. J. K. Rowling really has a way of bringing her characters to life and making them seem so very realistic. The friendship between Harry, Ron and Hermione takes on a different tone in this book. Hermione has finally bitten off more than she can chew, and that along with her new pet and some tough choices she makes in an attempt to be a good friend, jeopardizes her relationship with both Harry and Ron, but particularly Ron. The two of them argue throughout most of the story like an old married couple, and when they finally make up, there were a couple of really cute moments. This just added fuel to the fire of my prediction that they will someday be more than friends. As always, all three of them acted very heroically, especially Harry and Hermione, and once again, Harry had the opportunity to show his amazing capacity for mercy, in this case to one who didn't really deserve it, which was a beautiful thing to me.I must say that I liked Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban the best so far. Even though this was a re-read for me, I had forgotten many of the little details and rediscovering them made for a very enjoyable time.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15812494762444255307\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border title=\"Veronique\" class=\"user\" name=\"Veronique\" href=\"/user/show/12371602-veronique\">Veronique</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=audiobooks\">audiobooks</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=favourites-5and4-5\">favourites-5and4-5</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/12371602-veronique?shelf=2016\">2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer403851431\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4848049167880816983\">Still my favourite Harry Potter book!<br /><br />At this point, it isn't just the comfort of returning to Hogwarts and this magical world that I love. No, this is the book where I really got stung with the Potter bug. I still remember the first time I read it, especially that last third of the novel. I was on tenderhooks and could not stop reading, snatching time here and there from work. I mean, come on - the Marauder's Map, Moony, Padfoot, Prongs, Wormtail!!!!, the Time Turner, Dementors, Expecto Patronus</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4848049167880816983\" style=\"display:none\">Still my favourite Harry Potter book!<br /><br />At this point, it isn't just the comfort of returning to Hogwarts and this magical world that I love. No, this is the book where I really got stung with the Potter bug. I still remember the first time I read it, especially that last third of the novel. I was on tenderhooks and could not stop reading, snatching time here and there from work. I mean, come on - the Marauder's Map, Moony, Padfoot, Prongs, Wormtail!!!!, the Time Turner, Dementors, Expecto Patronus, Boggarts, Hogsmeade, ... and the list goes on.<br /><br />Maybe this is due partly to the fact that the books 'mature' with the characters, each volume growing in danger and in scope, or that Rowling improved her craft too. Whichever, this is the novel where it gets serious. The hugeness of what happened and of what is yet to happen hits you. You can see all these elements appearing in your vision and you're just flabbergasted at what they could mean.<br /><br />Ultimately I think this series's success resides in the fact that Rowling has the power to make all of us feel wonder, whatever age we are. <br /><br />And yes, \"I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.\" - always ;O)</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4848049167880816983\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border
