\n\n<div id=\"review_1105772496\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1105772496\" />\n    <a title=\"Jonathan\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6313408-jonathan\"><img alt=\"Jonathan\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478230200p2/6313408.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1105772496?book_show_action=false\">Feb 24, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jonathan\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jonathan\" href=\"/user/show/6313408-jonathan\">Jonathan</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=children-s-literature\">children-s-literature</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=favourite-series\">favourite-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=worldbuilding\">worldbuilding</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6313408-jonathan?shelf=scifi-fan-challenge-2014\">scifi-fan-challenge-2014</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1105772496\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer8071513907274744762\">This is the first book in The Harry Potter series that impressed me in terms of the plotting and overall development. I won't deny that the books have their own unique charm, so I think I'm starting to see the popularity. However, I wonder if this series will stick around like other children's fiction works I've read. <br /><br />Anyway, here's something I noticed about this series and it's something that I have complained about but it's clearly worked as a technique for Rowling. This being that her protago</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText8071513907274744762\" style=\"display:none\">This is the first book in The Harry Potter series that impressed me in terms of the plotting and overall development. I won't deny that the books have their own unique charm, so I think I'm starting to see the popularity. However, I wonder if this series will stick around like other children's fiction works I've read. <br /><br />Anyway, here's something I noticed about this series and it's something that I have complained about but it's clearly worked as a technique for Rowling. This being that her protagonist Harry is a blank slate or rather an everyman. He's a passive character (occasionally active) who can appeal to almost reader. Does that give him much personality? Well personally I find him a rather boring character and am more interested in the side characters around him - characters who provide greater definition to Harry than anything else.<br /><br />That said I'm definitely moving on to the next book when I can. More to see the continuation of this story, finish the series and hope for greater improvement. I'm not certain that this is must read fantasty, maybe it's must read children's literature however and it is more or less entertaining. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"8071513907274744762\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1105772496\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1105772496\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1105772496\" ref=\"like\" href=\"/user/show/2431873-emily\"><img alt=\"Emily\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477433724p2/2431873.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439136358\" href=\"/book/show/49116.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=ya-fiction\">ya-fiction</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2431873-emily?shelf=childrens-books\">childrens-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer60144013\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7243667636712215725\"><i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is my absolute favorite Harry Potter book (which might make it my favorite book ever??). The story gets darker and the plot gets more ambitious, but in a wholly satisfying, enormously impressive way. Harry drops his butterbeer when hearing the history between Sirius Black and his parents, and I'm pretty sure I almost dropped the entire book when reading it for the first time. It's just as fun to reread and watch all the threads come together. I read this book so many times wh</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7243667636712215725\" style=\"display:none\"><i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is my absolute favorite Harry Potter book (which might make it my favorite book ever??). The story gets darker and the plot gets more ambitious, but in a wholly satisfying, enormously impressive way. Harry drops his butterbeer when hearing the history between Sirius Black and his parents, and I'm pretty sure I almost dropped the entire book when reading it for the first time. It's just as fun to reread and watch all the threads come together. I read this book so many times when it came out that at one point I could list all the chapter titles. One of the things that I really appreciate about PoA is how earned all of the happy moments feel - the <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Quidditch Cup <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> in particular, since it's tied to Harry learning to fend off the dementors. <br /><br />I'd say that the most emotional moment in this book tops the Mirror of Erised from the first book, too - it's of course <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[when Harry thinks he's seen his father, realizes he's seen himself, and finds out that his Patronus is Prongs <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. TEARDROPS ON MY GUITAR!!!!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7243667636712215725\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n  </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer659160708\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16479443396363525307\"><i>Azkabanin</i> vanki on nyt virallisesti jaetulla kakkossijalla vitosen kanssa. En edes muistanut, miten loistava ja hahmopainoitteinen osa tU+00E4mU+00E4 oli!<br /><br />Oli niin mahtavaa pU+00E4 U+00E4stU+00E4 Siriuksen ja Lupinin kautta tutkailemaan Harryn isU+00E4n nuoruutta. HU+00E4nen lU+00E4snU+00E4olonsa tarinassa alkoi tuntua nyt paljon painavampana ja monta kertaa tuli vedet silmiin kun ajattelin niitU+00E4 tulevia osia, kun Harry saa aina vain enemmU+00E4n tiedonjyvU+00E4siU+00E4 vanhemmistaan.<br /><br />Ja Sirius? Nyt todella huomaan, miten mahtava hahmo on kyseessU+00E4. Kun luin</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16479443396363525307\" style=\"display:none\"><i>Azkabanin</i> vanki on nyt virallisesti jaetulla kakkossijalla vitosen kanssa. En edes muistanut, miten loistava ja hahmopainoitteinen osa tU+00E4mU+00E4 oli!<br /><br />Oli niin mahtavaa pU+00E4 U+00E4stU+00E4 Siriuksen ja Lupinin kautta tutkailemaan Harryn isU+00E4n nuoruutta. HU+00E4nen lU+00E4snU+00E4olonsa tarinassa alkoi tuntua nyt paljon painavampana ja monta kertaa tuli vedet silmiin kun ajattelin niitU+00E4 tulevia osia, kun Harry saa aina vain enemmU+00E4n tiedonjyvU+00E4siU+00E4 vanhemmistaan.<br /><br />Ja Sirius? Nyt todella huomaan, miten mahtava hahmo on kyseessU+00E4. Kun luin tU+00E4mU+00E4n ensimmU+00E4isen kerran joskus ala-asteella, en meinannut kU+00E4sittU+00E4 U+00E4 koko hahmoa ja mikU+00E4 merkitys hU+00E4nellU+00E4 oli Jamesin ja Harryn elU+00E4mU+00E4ssU+00E4. Nyt taas pU+00E4 U+00E4sin nU+00E4kemU+00E4 U+00E4n selkeU+00E4mmin tuota kuviota ja ai ettU+00E4... Niin paljon tunteita.<br /><br />TU+00E4mU+00E4n jU+00E4lkeen meno muuttuukin sitten jo paljon rankemmaksi... Onneksi edessU+00E4 on kuitenkin niitU+00E4 kevyiU+00E4 ja hauskojakin hetkiU+00E4, jotka tuovat tasapainoa siihen synkkyyteen. Nelososa, tU+00E4 U+00E4ltU+00E4 tullaan!<br /><br /><b>TU+00E4ydet pisteet. class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer3337729772161564795\">REREAD 2015 <br /><br />Soooo good! On to Goblet of Fire :D<br /><br />REREAD 2013 <br /><br />I loved re-reading Prisoner of Azkaban for the second time. There's so much tension in this book than the first two and things are starting to get darker. I also loved that we're finally introduced to my favorite character - Sirius Black!</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n id=\"reviewTextContainer1766750814\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1981616331309537159\">This book is when I feel like everything really starts clicking into place. I cannot tell you how much I absolutely adore this book.<br /><br />The characters are starting to grow up, starting to experience things beyond the very basics of magic, and beginning to learn about some of the horrors that are in the world.<br /><br />The story starts to get darker and really begins to take shape in this book and I love it so much. <br /><br />Incorporating the whole idea of time travel, especially when dealing with short periods of time</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1981616331309537159\" style=\"display:none\">This book is when I feel like everything really starts clicking into place. I cannot tell you how much I absolutely adore this book.<br /><br />The characters are starting to grow up, starting to experience things beyond the very basics of magic, and beginning to learn about some of the horrors that are in the world.<br /><br />The story starts to get darker and really begins to take shape in this book and I love it so much. <br /><br />Incorporating the whole idea of time travel, especially when dealing with short periods of time, was something I found absolutely fascinating from the very first time I read this book and I love how she used it. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1981616331309537159\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));;     <span id=\"reviewTextContainer970838243\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9962798377326672851\">Holy cow I read that in one day. (pat on the back for me!!) I love how now I'm starting to understand all the references to HP now with the marauders map and everything. :) I'm excited to see what happens next! hope to start book 4 soon!!!</span>\n\n stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/481101261?book_show_action=false\">Jan 31, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Emma\" class=\"user\" name=\"Emma\" href=\"/user/show/10359981-emma\">Emma</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/10359981-emma?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/10359981-emma?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer481101261\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12992377196006480861\">For me this third instalment in the series is the first big stepping stone into finding out more about Harry's past. I enjoy how again we see the trio (Harry, Ron and Hermione) grow into such diverse individuals, the character development is just flawless throughout.<br /><br /><br />When Harry returns to Hogwarts after blowing up his Aunt Marge, we discover a killer has escaped from Azkaban that we learn to have some relation to Harry. Throughout the book we're led to believe him to be someone who is a threat to</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12992377196006480861\" style=\"display:none\">For me this third instalment in the series is the first big stepping stone into finding out more about Harry's past. I enjoy how again we see the trio (Harry, Ron and Hermione) grow into such diverse individuals, the character development is just flawless throughout.<br /><br /><br />When Harry returns to Hogwarts after blowing up his Aunt Marge, we discover a killer has escaped from Azkaban that we learn to have some relation to Harry. Throughout the book we're led to believe him to be someone who is a threat to Harry's life, but as the plot plans out not all is what it seems.<br /><br /><br />Down to the trio making investigations of their own round Hogsmeade village under the invisibility cloak, they soon join the dots together and a surprise revelation is revealed.<br /><br /><br />I think my favourite characters in this book were probably Hermione with her gadget- the time turner enabling her to attend every lesson available to third years, and Professor R.J Lupin who I found to develop into more of an uncle to Harry which must have been such a comfort. Having not known who is parents were personally, Lupin managed to fill in the gaps as to what his parents were like when they were Harry's age. I can't forget the twins Fred and George Weasley, cunning, funny, and handy in providing the Marauder's map that unlocks the knowledge of secrets within Hogwarts.<br /><br /><br />I felt that this book in a way was a way for the reader to learn too, we discover new spells, potions and other various knowledge of the wizarding world as if we're students at Hogwarts too, and that's what makes this series such a wonderful experience to read!<br /><br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12992377196006480861\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review481101261\">\n  <td \n\n<div id=\"review_949138453\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/949138453\" />\n    <a title=\"Addy\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/22132160-addy\"><img alt=\"Addy\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466649096p2/22132160.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/949138453?book_show_action=false\">Mar 23, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Addy\" class=\"user\" name=\"Addy\" href=\"/user/show/22132160-addy\">Addy</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22132160-addy?shelf=ya\">ya</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22132160-addy?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22132160-addy?shelf=5-stars\">5-stars</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22132160-addy?shelf=ya-fantasy\">ya-fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22132160-addy?shelf=beautiful-covers\">beautiful-covers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22132160-addy?shelf=i-own\">i-own</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer949138453\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12050096739549777329\">So this was my first time reading this book. You heard that right. How can I even call myself an avid fantasy reader when I haven't even read HP? I've always been a huge fan of the films. They're magical and gorgeous and everything I could ever want in a movie. I have the urge to watch the whole movie series every couple of weeks. To put it lightly, I'm obsessed. But, since I've watched the movies loads of times, I've put off reading the books. I always felt like I already knew all that was</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12050096739549777329\" style=\"display:none\">So this was my first time reading this book. You heard that right. How can I even call myself an avid fantasy reader when I haven't even read HP? I've always been a huge fan of the films. They're magical and gorgeous and everything I could ever want in a movie. I have the urge to watch the whole movie series every couple of weeks. To put it lightly, I'm obsessed. But, since I've watched the movies loads of times, I've put off reading the books. I always felt like I already knew all that was going to happen and that some of the joy would be taken out of reading the books. <br /><br />Well I was wrong. Especially with this one.<br /><br />This movie was actually my least favorite. I felt like it was where the film series started to get kind of confusing for those who hadn't yet read the books. This was the one film I didn't ever really watch all the way through. It just felt really slow paced compared to the other movies. And I admit, the book is like that as well. But there's just a certain beauty in the detail. I felt like I got to know the characters and the world much more. There were little things I'd missed in the movies. I found myself laughing and tearing up at certain parts. I just realized how much of a genius J.K. Rowling was in writing this series. It is <i>perfect</i>. And trust me, I don't ever say that lightly, or really often at all.<br /><br />I was definitely surprised. I think I'd actually rate the other two books four stars, if I believed in going back to change my rating. I wholly and utterly recommend. I can finally understand why these books are so special. I'll always remember my first time reading it forever.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12050096739549777329\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n         <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780439136365\" href=\"/book/show/224926.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30553051-halley-hopson?shelf=2015-rereads\">2015-rereads</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30553051-halley-hopson?shelf=2016-rereads\">2016-rereads</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer913453144\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9971670634043321241\">Annual Reread - December 2015<br /><br />~ <br /><br />Annual Reread - August 2016<br /><br />THIS ONE IS MY FAVORITE.<br /><br />How could it not be; with the introduction of both of my favorite characters in the entire series?<br /><br />There is so much that I love about this book that I don't even know where to start. I don't think I'm capable of reviewing this one coherently without dissolving into a mess of feels. <br /><br />Update on the Ginny/Harry ship lookout I am apparently doing on this reread; Ginny isn't this particular book very much at all. But in t</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9971670634043321241\" style=\"display:none\">Annual Reread - December 2015<br /><br />~ <br /><br />Annual Reread - August 2016<br /><br />THIS ONE IS MY FAVORITE.<br /><br />How could it not be; with the introduction of both of my favorite characters in the entire series?<br /><br />There is so much that I love about this book that I don't even know where to start. I don't think I'm capable of reviewing this one coherently without dissolving into a mess of feels. <br /><br />Update on the Ginny/Harry ship lookout I am apparently doing on this reread; Ginny isn't this particular book very much at all. But in the scene of their first encounter with a dementor, she is described as looking 'nearly as bad as Harry felt' and then it is said she starts sobbing. Knowing that dementors make you relive your worst memories and that their powers are especially effective on those with true horrors in their past; imagining Ginny being forced to relive her times being possessed and controlled by Riddle the previous year is just so terrifying and heartbreaking to think about. For a twelve year old to be forced to feel that again, it's no wonder she burst into tears. She and Harry both have horrifying memories of Voldemort, enough to bring them immense dread when a dementor is near. <br /><br />Yet another thing that would draw Harry to her; because she understands something about him that no one else does.<br /><br />~</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9971670634043321241\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\" href=\"/book/show/17347383-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30924856-hassan?shelf=on-my-shelf\">on-my-shelf</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30924856-hassan?shelf=favsssss\">favsssss</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30924856-hassan?shelf=high-fantasy\">high-fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30924856-hassan?shelf=middle-grade\">middle-grade</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/30924856-hassan?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer947856155\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4128997203193480551\"><b> <i>U+201CDon't let the muggles get you down.U+201D</i> </b><br /><br />OH. MY. GOD.<br />i finished this book 3 days ago, and i cannot stop thinking about it. <br />this book was more than amazing, it was entirely different than it's predecessors in the series, it relied on a different elements to keep the readers intrigued. <br /><br />from the first chapter you can see that this book is going to have a very dark tone, and that dark tone kept clouding the story gradually, so many new characters were introduced, we saw Harry and Ron and Hermione grow</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4128997203193480551\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <i>U+201CDon't let the muggles get you down.U+201D</i>\n</b><br /><br />OH. MY. GOD.<br />i finished this book 3 days ago, and i cannot stop thinking about it. <br />this book was more than amazing, it was entirely different than it's predecessors in the series, it relied on a different elements to keep the readers intrigued. <br /><br />from the first chapter you can see that this book is going to have a very dark tone, and that dark tone kept clouding the story gradually, so many new characters were introduced, we saw Harry and Ron and Hermione grow up and evolve as a wizards, the story was wrapped up with so many mysteries the whole time to the point that made you feel like there's noway to connect all these elements together, and the result was one of the most original stories i've ever read.<br /><br />this book shows how masterful J.K. Rowling is, there was so many threads to this story and you never felt lost, or felt like it's all over the place, she knew exactly what she was doing and by the end she wrapped everything up nicely and quiet brilliantly. <br /><br />it was a dark, whimsical, emotional journey, and i absolutely adored it. <br />i can't even think how the next books are going to top that one?! <br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4128997203193480551\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext  </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1469513585\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10862479092979092923\">Fucking love time travel! It's still my favorite part of the book. Also, I think I love Lupin even more than before and of course, Black is just the best. *sobs*<br /><br />The Quidditch matches were so fun to read about especially because of Jordan's top-notch commentary.<br /><br />Also, Hermione's scene with the boggart was even more hilarious than Neville's.<br /><br />Doesn't this sum up Snape pretty (and pathetically) well: 'Is a <b>schoolboy grudge</b> worth putting an innocent man back inside Azkaban?'<br /><br />I don't know who I hate more</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10862479092979092923\" style=\"display:none\">Fucking love time travel! It's still my favorite part of the book. Also, I think I love Lupin even more than before and of course, Black is just the best. *sobs*<br /><br />The Quidditch matches were so fun to read about especially because of Jordan's top-notch commentary.<br /><br />Also, Hermione's scene with the boggart was even more hilarious than Neville's.<br /><br />Doesn't this sum up Snape pretty (and pathetically) well: 'Is a <b>schoolboy grudge</b> worth putting an innocent man back inside Azkaban?'<br /><br />I don't know who I hate more in this book, though: Snape or Pettigrew re: a bully vs a slimeball. They can both go to hell.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10862479092979092923\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n        \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11939456939458149451\">This was honestly my Harry Potter book so far. I loved how everything came together and all the new insight on Harry's father when he was younger and his friends. I also loved the new knowledge of what really happened to Harry's parents. I can't wait to read the rest of the series. </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1645340865\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16294991376467864081\">Harry'nin Hogwarts'taki U+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCncU+00FC yU+0131lU+0131, bir hayli olaylU+0131 baU+015Flar. Yaz tatilinde tek istediU+011Fi U+0F6Devlerini yapabilmek -ki bunu geceleri gizli gizli, battaniyesinin altU+0131nda bir el feneriyle yapmak zorunda bU+0131rakU+0131lU+0131r zavallU+0131m- ve U+0130ngiltere'nin baU+015Ftan aU+15FA U+011F U+0131 bU+00FCyU+0FCC U+00FClerle dolu tek kU+00F6yU+00FC olan Hogsmeade'e yapU+0131lacak okul gezilerine katU+0131labilmesi iU+00E7in gerekli imzayU+0131 eniU+015Ftesinden koparabilmek olan Harry, U+00FCstU+00FCste geliU+15FEn U+15FAnssU+0131zlU+0131klar silsilesi sonucu halasU+0131nU+0131 iU+00E7i gaz dolu bir balonmuU+015F U+0E7AsU+0131na U+015FiU+015FirmiU+015F bulur kendini.</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16294991376467864081\" style=\"display:none\">Harry'nin Hogwarts'taki U+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCncU+00FC yU+0131lU+0131, bir hayli olaylU+0131 baU+015Flar. Yaz tatilinde tek istediU+011Fi U+0F6Devlerini yapabilmek -ki bunu geceleri gizli gizli, battaniyesinin altU+0131nda bir el feneriyle yapmak zorunda bU+0131rakU+0131lU+0131r zavallU+0131m- ve U+0130ngiltere'nin baU+015Ftan aU+15FA U+011F U+0131 bU+00FCyU+0FCC U+00FClerle dolu tek kU+00F6yU+00FC olan Hogsmeade'e yapU+0131lacak okul gezilerine katU+0131labilmesi iU+00E7in gerekli imzayU+0131 eniU+015Ftesinden koparabilmek olan Harry, U+00FCstU+00FCste geliU+15FEn U+15FAnssU+0131zlU+0131klar silsilesi sonucu halasU+0131nU+0131 iU+00E7i gaz dolu bir balonmuU+015F U+0E7AsU+0131na U+015FiU+015FirmiU+015F bulur kendini. U+00D6nceki yU+0131l Dudley'lerin evinde kU+00FC U+00E7 U+00FCk bir bU+00FCyU+00FC yapan ev cini Dobby nedeniyle uyarU+0131 alan Harry, halasU+0131nU+0131 U+015FiU+015Firmek gibi U+00E7ok daha bU+00FCyU+00FCk ve tatsU+0131z -U+00FCstelik bu sefer, gerU+0E7Ekten de kendisinin gerU+0E7EkleU+015FtirdiU+011Fi- bir bU+00FCyU+00FC sonucu okuldan atU+0131lacaU+011F U+0131na emindir. BU+00FCyU+0FCC U+00FClU+00FCk hapishanesi olan Azkaban'a atU+0131lacaU+011F U+0131ndan bile kaygU+0131lanmaktadU+0131r. Ama yapacaU+011F U+0131 bir U+15FEy yoktur, o evde daha fazla kalamayacaU+011F U+0131 kesindir. EU+015FyalarU+0131nU+0131 toplar; Hogwarts kitaplarU+0131nU+0131 ve araU+00E7 gereU+00E7lerini sandU+0131 U+011F U+0131na doldurup Hedwig'in kafesini alU+0131r ve hU+0131 U+015F U+0131mla terk eder evi (halasU+0131 hU+00E2lU+00E2 U+015FiU+015FtikU+0E7E U+015FiU+15FEr ve yU+00FCkseldikU+0E7E yU+00FCkselirken).<br /><br />Harry kendini, yaU+15FAmU+0131nU+0131 dU+0131 U+015FlanmU+0131 U+015F biri olarak sU+00FCrdU+00FCreceU+011Fine ve bir daha Hogwarts'U+0131 gU+00F6rmeyeceU+011Fine inandU+0131rU+0131r, ama en azU+0131ndan bU+00FCyU+0FCC U+00FClerle birarada olabilmek iU+00E7in Londra'ya, U+0C7Atlak Kazan'a gider. AmacU+0131 handa bir oda tutup, durumunu sakin kafayla dU+00FC U+015F U+00FCnmektir. Gelgelelim Diagon Yolu'nda onu Sihir BakanU+0131 Fudge karU+015F U+0131lar -Harry'i saU+011F salim odasU+0131na yerleU+015Ftirir, bundan sonra gU+00FCvende olmasU+0131 iU+00E7in birkaU+00E7 tembih sU+0131ralar, diU+11FEr bU+00FCyU+0FCC U+00FClerden okul baU+015Flayana kadar Harry'e gU+00F6z kulak olmalarU+0131nU+0131, onu gU+00F6zlerinin U+00F6nU+00FCnden ayU+0131rmamalarU+0131nU+0131 rica eder. DeU+011Fil Sihir BakanU+0131'nU+0131n bizzat kendisi tarafU+0131ndan karU+015F U+0131lanmayU+0131, okula devam edebilmeyi bile beklemeyen Harry, U+15FA U+015FkU+0131nlU+0131k iU+00E7indedir. Bunda bir iU+015F vardU+0131r, ama ne? Sonradan ortaya U+00E7 U+0131kar ki, Azkaban'dan firar eden Sirius Black isimli U+00E7ok tehlikeli suU+00E7lu, Harry Potter'U+0131n peU+015Findedir. Voldy'nin sadU+0131k destekU+00E7ilerinden olan Black, efendisinin dU+00FC U+015F U+00FC U+015F U+00FCnden dolayU+0131 Harry'i suU+00E7lamakta, onu U+00F6ldU+00FCrerek intikam alabilmeyi, bir de tabii, KaranlU+0131k Lord'un tekrar yU+00FCkseliU+015Finde pay sahibi olabilmeyi ummaktadU+0131r. Black o kadar tehlikeli bir canidir ki, Sihir BakanlU+0131 U+011F U+0131 Muggle'larU+0131n BaU+15FBakan'U+0131nU+0131 bile ondan haberdar etmiU+015Ftir ve U+015Fimdi de, tU+00FCm gU+00F6zler U+00FCzerlerindeyken U+00E7uvallamamak, vatandaU+015FlarU+0131na rezil olmamak iU+00E7in, canla baU+015Fla Harry'i gU+00FCvende tutmaya U+0E7AlU+0131 U+015FmaktadU+0131rlar. Ancak bunlar yeterli olmayacak, Sirius Black dU+00FCnyanU+0131n en gU+00FCvenli yeri kabul edilen Hogwarts'a girmeyi baU+15FAracaktU+0131r. U+00DCstelik hakkU+0131nda Harry'nin bilmediU+011Fi U+00E7ok U+15FEy vardU+0131r.<br /><br />TU+0131pkU+0131 SU+0131rlar OdasU+0131'nda olduU+011Fu gibi Azkaban TutsaU+011F U+0131'nda da okuyucuya bU+00FCyU+0FCC U+00FClU+00FCk dU+00FCnyasU+0131na dair yepyeni U+15FEyler gU+00F6stermeye devam eden Rowling, bu dU+00FCnyayU+0131 artU+0131k iyice geniU+015Fletip bU+00FCyU+00FCtU+00FCyor. En U+00FCst katmanda duran, gU+00F6ze ilk U+0E7Arpan yeni bU+00FCyU+00FCler ve yeni U+00F6 U+011Fretmenler serinin hafif tarafU+0131nU+0131 sembolize eder ve okuyucuya gerekli eU+011Flenceyi sunarken, Harry'nin geU+00E7miU+015Fine dair yeni bilgiler hikU+00E2yeyi derinleU+015Ftiriyor ve daha yetiU+015Fkin temalara yelken aU+00E7 U+0131yor. U+0130kisi de ilk kez Azkaban TutsaU+011F U+0131'nda ortaya U+00E7 U+0131kan; karU+015F U+0131sU+0131na U+00E7 U+0131ktU+0131 U+011F U+0131 insanU+0131n en U+00E7ok korktuU+011Fu U+15FEyin biU+00E7imini alan ve ancak kahkahayla yenilen BU+0F6C U+00FCrt'ler ile karU+015F U+0131sU+0131na U+00E7 U+0131ktU+0131 U+011F U+0131 insanU+0131n tU+00FCm yaU+15FAm sevincini U+0E7Ekip alan, bazU+0131 durumlarda da kiU+015Finin ruhunu emerek geride iU+00E7i boU+015F bir kabuk bU+0131rakan ve ancak mutlulukla yenilen Ruh Emici'ler, bu kitabU+0131n temalarU+0131nU+0131 U+00F6zetliyor bize aslU+0131nda: umut sayesinde kederi yenmek.<br /><br />Azkaban TutsaU+011F U+0131 aslU+0131nda serinin tU+00FCm kitaplarU+0131 arasU+0131nda ele alU+0131ndU+0131 U+011F U+0131nda ileri bir adU+0131mdan U+00E7ok geri bir adU+0131m atU+0131yor; ki son derece doU+011Fru bir yU+00F6nde gidiyor anlamU+0131na geliyor bu. Rowling Harry'nin Voldemort'la ve onun takipU+00E7ileriyle olan geU+00E7miU+015Fini derinleU+015Ftirmek iU+00E7in bolca zaman harcU+0131yor, bu da harikulade karakter geliU+015Fimleri ve amaU+00E7larla hareketlerin (Harry'nin bU+00FCyU+00FCk bir kendini adamU+0131 U+015FlU+0131kla Voldy'i durdurmak istemesi gibi) arkasU+0131nda U+00E7ok daha inanU+0131lU+0131r, U+00E7ok daha iU+00E7i dolu nedenler olmasU+0131 demek.<br /><br />U+00D6lU+00FCm cezasU+0131 ve bunun toplumdaki yeri de kitabU+0131n ana temalarU+0131ndan. Bir Ruh Emici'nin U+00F6ptU+00FC U+011F U+00FC kiU+015Finin ruhunu emip alarak onu bir bitki, bir kabuk olarak bU+0131rakmasU+0131, apaU+00E7 U+0131k idam anlamU+0131na geliyor. Ve Sirius Black, Ruh Emici U+00D6pU+0FCC U+00FC U+011F U+00FC'ne U+0E7ArptU+0131rU+0131lU+0131yor. YarU+0131 at-yarU+0131 kartal sihirli bir yaratU+0131k olan bir hipogrif; U+15EAhgaga U+00FCzerine kurulu ara U+00F6ykU+00FC de bu temaya paralellik gU+00F6steriyor. Kendisine hakaret eden bir \"insan\"a -yani belli ki, bU+00FCyU+0FCC U+00FClU+00FCk yasalarU+0131na gU+00F6re kendinden kat be kat U+00FCstU+00FCn bir varlU+0131 U+11FA- penU+0E7E attU+0131 diye U+00F6lU+00FCm cezasU+0131na U+0E7ArptU+0131rU+0131lU+0131yor U+15EAhgaga. BU+00F6ylece birbirine paralel giden iki hikayede, U+00F6lU+00FCm cezasU+0131nU+0131 iU+015Fliyor Rowling. Kitap aynU+0131 zamanda geleceU+011Fin U+00F6ngU+00F6rU+00FClemezliU+011Fi ve zamanU+0131n deU+11FEriyle, duygularla ve onlarU+0131 kontrol etmeyi U+00F6 U+011Frenmekle, U+0F6Fke ve korkunun doU+011FuracaU+011F U+0131 U+0E7Aresizlikle ve en karanlU+0131k zamanlarda bile umut bulmaya U+0E7AlU+0131 U+015Fmakla ilgili.<br /><br />Azkaban TutsaU+011F U+0131, bir U+00E7ocuU+011Fun ya da yeniyetmenin deU+011Fil de bir yetiU+015Fkinin zihin gU+0FCC U+00FC ve zekasU+0131nU+0131 tam anlamU+0131yla cezbedecek ilk Harry Potter kitabU+0131 sanU+0131rU+0131m. Kitaba yayU+0131lmU+0131 U+015F gizem tahmin etmesi gU+00FC U+00E7 bir gizem, katmanlU+0131 olay U+00F6rgU+00FCsU+00FC ve karakter geliU+015Fimi de U+00E7ok baU+15FArU+0131lU+0131. U+00DCstelik sadece fantezi dU+00FCnyasU+0131na dair olmayan, insanoU+011Flunun en temel duygularU+0131nU+0131n derinliklerini keU+15FFe U+00E7 U+0131kan ilk Harry Potter kitabU+0131 bu. Pek U+00E7ok hikayeyi ayrU+0131 ayrU+0131 dokuyarak U+00E7ok etkileyici bir final iU+00E7in hepsini biraraya toplamayU+0131 baU+15FAran Rowling'in zekU+00E2sU+0131, insana parmak U+0131sU+0131rttU+0131rU+0131yor.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16294991376467864081\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/23273360-vaneesha?shelf=these-books-have-my-heart\">these-books-have-my-heart</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1554020510\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer2951575101478660142\">I have done little-to-no reading this past week, and that's because I've been slightly preoccupied with work (& the fact that I AM GOING TO SEE CHAMPAGNEPAPI ON SUNDAY ... totally irrelevant, sorry). Anyway, I've been stuck in a little bit of a reading-rut; this usually happens about 4 times a year to be honest, and I've come to the realization that the only way I can get myself un-stuck is by rereading Harry Potter. I don't read the books in order, and sometimes I go back-and-forth between</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2951575101478660142\" style=\"display:none\">I have done little-to-no reading this past week, and that's because I've been slightly preoccupied with work (& the fact that I AM GOING TO SEE CHAMPAGNEPAPI ON SUNDAY ... totally irrelevant, sorry). Anyway, I've been stuck in a little bit of a reading-rut; this usually happens about 4 times a year to be honest, and I've come to the realization that the only way I can get myself un-stuck is by rereading Harry Potter. I don't read the books in order, and sometimes I go back-and-forth between books reading the chapters I'm in the mood for. If I'm feeling annoyed I read \"The Prince's Tale\", if I'm feeling all sorts of self-loathing I'll go for \"The Mirror of Erised\", if I need my faith in humanity restored I'll opt for \"The Woes of Mrs. Weasley\". Regardless, when I'm going on a Harry Potter binge, I will always (and without fail) save the best (in my opinion) for last: The Prisoner of Azkaban. <br /><br />These books are like my babies, and although parents don't usually have a favourite child, this book has my heart in a way that none of the others do. It's a good thing I'm not a real parent because I'd be a totally shit one who chooses favourites. Why is this my favourite Harry Potter book? Perhaps because I have an unwavering love for the Marauders, especially Sirius Black. Perhaps it's because ole Voldy is blissfully absent. Perhaps it's because Harry, Ron, and Hermione are especially angsty with their bickering, which does a fantastic job of setting the foundation for a bomb ass friendship. Perhaps it's because the subjects are so entertaining, we have Hagrid taking over Care of Magical Creatures, Trelawney with Divination, and Lupin with Defense Against the Dark Arts. Perhaps it's because Snape gets attacked by the trio. More than likely, it's all of the above that contribute to making this book <b>my favourite book of all time</b>. I know that's high praise for a book labelled a children's story. I will personally fight anyone who taunts me. This series has my heart. I love it dearly. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"2951575101478660142\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/17295220-alexa?shelf=awesome\">awesome</a>\n          </div>\n id=\"freeTextContainer4393439141289066994\">Writing a review for this is probably impossible without spoilers. Let's just say I <b>love</b> this book. <br><br>I love the mystery, I love Remus, I love the Marauder's Map (Come on! You know you love it too!) I love the deus ex machina ending, and I love all the clues I <i>should</i> have seen but didn't. <br><br>But more than everything else, <u>I love the background story</u>. And I can easily say that I love the 'old' characters almost as much as the current ones. <br><br>Now for a little bit of Marauding fangirling. <br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1413038905i/11458635._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1413038905i/11458636._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1413038905i/11458637._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><i>All images by Vi</i></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4393439141289066994\" style=\"display:none\">Writing a review for this is probably impossible without spoilers. class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1645669879\" />\n    <a title=\"Robin\" class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1645669879?book_show_action=false\">May 22, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Robin\" class=\"user\" name=\"Robin\" href=\"/user/show/13454748-robin\">Robin</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13454748-robin?shelf=library-book\">library-book</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13454748-robin?shelf=2016\">2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13454748-robin?shelf=500-audio-2016\">500-audio-2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/13454748-robin?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1645669879\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer3498564808835880221\">As Harry Potter starts his third year at Hogwarts, things are not going well. His classes are tougher and the tests are harder. His Quidditch broom has been broken to bits. One of Harry's professors has seen an omen of his death in his tea leaves. And convicted murderer Sirius Black has escaped from Azkaban and word is he is out to get Harry Potter. Hogwarts is on lockdown with Black on the loose.<br /><br />Another excellent addition to the Harry Potter series. I don't know how the author comes up with her</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText3498564808835880221\" style=\"display:none\">As Harry Potter starts his third year at Hogwarts, things are not going well. His classes are tougher and the tests are harder. His Quidditch broom has been broken to bits. One of Harry's professors has seen an omen of his death in his tea leaves. And convicted murderer Sirius Black has escaped from Azkaban and word is he is out to get Harry Potter. Hogwarts is on lockdown with Black on the loose.<br /><br />Another excellent addition to the Harry Potter series. I don't know how the author comes up with her ideas, but they are fantastic. I love the picture on the wall that asks for the password before letting anyone into the secret passage. I love the whomping tree that actually hits anyone who comes close to it. And who doesn't love Hagrid's many strange (and sometimes scary) pets? I can't wait to dig into the next book. The narration in this series is outstanding. My rating: 5 Stars.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"3498564808835880221\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_735640492\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/735640492\" />\n    <a title=\"Tamsien West (Babbling Books)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6390827-tamsien-west-babbling-books\"><img alt=\"Tamsien West (Babbling Books)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1321595115p2/6390827.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/735640492?book_show_action=false\">Nov 25, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Tamsien West (Babbling Books)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Tamsien West (Babbling Books)\" href=\"/user/show/6390827-tamsien-west-babbling-books\">Tamsien West (Babbling Books)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6390827-tamsien-west-babbling-books?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6390827-tamsien-west-babbling-books?shelf=for-young-people\">for-young-people</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6390827-tamsien-west-babbling-books?shelf=ya\">ya</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer735640492\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1340014412516980254\">Nostalgia rating: 5 stars. Actual rating: 4 stars. Number of times heartbroken by the tragedy of Lupin: 156<br /><br />I loved rereading The Prisoner of Azkaban, more so than the first 2 books. It is the first time we understand (a little) about the Marauders, and so much foreshadowing occurs. However I feel like a few of the adult characters behave rather strangely, or awkwardly, as though for Harry's benefit rather than their own. Lupin and Sirius both just break my heart, they suffered so much, and there</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1340014412516980254\" style=\"display:none\">Nostalgia rating: 5 stars. Actual rating: 4 stars. Number of times heartbroken by the tragedy of Lupin: 156<br /><br />I loved rereading The Prisoner of Azkaban, more so than the first 2 books. It is the first time we understand (a little) about the Marauders, and so much foreshadowing occurs. However I feel like a few of the adult characters behave rather strangely, or awkwardly, as though for Harry's benefit rather than their own. Lupin and Sirius both just break my heart, they suffered so much, and there isn't much good to come for either of them. Despite my love for them I really really struggled to accept Lupin's reactions to Harry early in the book, no other adults have held back in mentioning they knew his parents. The more I write the more I justify the way he was written to myself, so I'll let it go for now.<br /><br />I am looking forward to reading the next book!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1340014412516980254\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Ashley Nuckles\" class=\"user\" name=\"Ashley Nuckles\" href=\"/user/show/55308610-ashley-nuckles\">Ashley Nuckles</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1680421001\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11098535355786551696\">There really isn't much I can say about this book other than this: Sirius Black. <br /><br />FINALLY. <br /><br />Having read this book previously I know about (and LOVE) Sirius, and I had been waiting rather impatiently for his appearance in this book. He's, like, my favorite character as of now (and at the time I read Prisoner of Azkaban before). <br /><br />But seriously, there's absolutely nothing negative I can say about this book. (Well, okay, except for that happy moment between Sirius and Harry toward the end right before</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11098535355786551696\" style=\"display:none\">There really isn't much I can say about this book other than this: Sirius Black. <br /><br />FINALLY. <br /><br />Having read this book previously I know about (and LOVE) Sirius, and I had been waiting rather impatiently for his appearance in this book. He's, like, my favorite character as of now (and at the time I read Prisoner of Azkaban before). <br /><br />But seriously, there's absolutely nothing negative I can say about this book. (Well, okay, except for that happy moment between Sirius and Harry toward the end right before all hell broke loose. Yeah, I could have done away with the all hell breaking loose part, but I guess famous Harry Potter doesn't get that perfect outcome just yet...or ever.) <br /><br />Another spectacular one from JK Rowling, and I can't wait to move on to Goblet of Fire!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"11098535355786551696\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n (KuehlerBookStop)\" href=\"/user/show/11840742-chelsea-kuehlerbookstop\">Chelsea (KuehlerBookStop)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\" href=\"/book/show/17347383-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1687149875\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1491354900445782531\">\"You think the dead we have loved ever really leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly than ever in times of great trouble? Your father is alive in you, Harry, and shows himself most plainly when you have need of him.\" -Albus Dumbledore <br /><br />There is a reason these books have been around for so long and have a HUGE fan base. Myself included. These books teach us so much about life. We don't always feel it when we read these books as kids, but as an adult, reading it with new eyes is</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1491354900445782531\" style=\"display:none\">\"You think the dead we have loved ever really leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly than ever in times of great trouble? Your father is alive in you, Harry, and shows himself most plainly when you have need of him.\" -Albus Dumbledore <br /><br />There is a reason these books have been around for so long and have a HUGE fan base. Myself included. These books teach us so much about life. We don't always feel it when we read these books as kids, but as an adult, reading it with new eyes is a delightful thing. This book has always been my favorite of the series. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1491354900445782531\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1687149875\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1687149875\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1687149875&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1687149875'><a id=\"like_count_review_1687149875\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1687149875?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">13 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1687149875\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1687149875\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=13&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1687149875&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1687149875\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 1687149875, true, ''); stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1356863492\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12970091991097563337\">I solemnly swear that I am up to no good. <br />These book really never get old. No matter how many times I read them (and I read them a lot). I love the time turner part of the book and watching them watch themselves going through everything. Love love love Sirius and Remus and this is when the overall story really starts to get going!</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1107825417?book_show_action=false\">Sep 26, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Yvonne (bookishpanda)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Yvonne (bookishpanda)\" href=\"/user/show/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda\">Yvonne (bookishpanda)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=5-stars-books\">5-stars-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=books-i-own\">books-i-own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=long-series\">long-series</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1107825417\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5113561381921044569\"><a href=\"http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.co.at/2015/07/review-harry-potter-and-prisoner-of.html\" rel=\"nofollow\"> <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1425398542i/13884056.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><br>The third Harry Potter book! I finally managed to read it and OH MY GOD, why didn't I pick it up sooner?!? I finished it within 3-4 days and absolutely LOVED it! Is it too early to say that this one is my favorite? Considering that I still have 4 books to read? I DON'T CARE!! I enjoyed every little bit of it! <br><br><blockquote> <b> <i>\"I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.\"</i> </b> </blockquote><br><br>The storyline of this book was absolutely brilliant! I have to say that I didn't remember a lot of things from the movie and therefore was ve</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5113561381921044569\" style=\"display:none\"><a href=\"http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.co.at/2015/07/review-harry-potter-and-prisoner-of.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">\n  <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1425398542i/13884056.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><br>The third Harry Potter book! I finally managed to read it and OH MY GOD, why didn't I pick it up sooner?!? I finished it within 3-4 days and absolutely LOVED it! Is it too early to say that this one is my favorite? Considering that I still have 4 books to read? I DON'T CARE!! I enjoyed every little bit of it! <br><br><blockquote>\n  <b>\n    <i>\"I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.\"</i>\n  </b>\n</blockquote><br><br>The storyline of this book was absolutely brilliant! I have to say that I didn't remember a lot of things from the movie and therefore was very curious/surprised/shocked and whatnot else by specific twists. I liked everything about Hogsmeade,the Marauder's Map, Buckbeak, the Quidditch match and all the other fantastic elements - it was so interesting to read about all of it!<br><br>Hermione is another important part of this book! While I liked Ron the most in the last one, I adored Hermione in this one! At times she seemed very lonely to me (mostly because of all the work and extra classes she had/wanted to do) and then there were these fights with Ron ... but well, she's always been there for them and supported her friends. I liked her loads and I'm sure that I'll like her even more in the next installments!<br><br><blockquote>\n  <b>\n    <i>\"We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.\"</i>\n  </b>\n</blockquote><br><br>Sirius Black and Remus Lupin were my favorites though! I LOVED EVERY LITTLE SCENE WITH THEM! Seriously, I didn't remember a thing about Sirius (well, I remember that he wasn't bad in the movies), so I was super confused while reading about him. Remus was great and I liked him as teacher of Defence Against the Dark Arts ... he's one of the teachers where I'd actually enjoy going to classes because he makes them seem interesting and fun! They're unique and there's always something new to learn - especially in a not-so-boring way!<br><br>So, generally speaking, this was one absolutely brilliant book! I loved the ending and can't wait to continue with Goblet of Fire. I plan on reading it sometime soon ... wish me luck that I'll actually get to it then! :D<br><br><a href=\"http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.com</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5113561381921044569\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/624662849\" />\n    <a title=\"Thomas\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2018505-thomas\"><img alt=\"Thomas\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463769552p2/2018505.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/624662849?book_show_action=false\">Jul 11, 2013</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Thomas\" class=\"user\" name=\"Thomas\" href=\"/user/show/2018505-thomas\">Thomas</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=own-physical\">own-physical</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2018505-thomas?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer624662849\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11652877137382013161\">Not as tight as the second book in terms of pacing and the major plot twist(s) at the end, but still enjoyable. Because Camp NaNo has my brain fried, here are a few random tidbits that stood out.<br /><br />1) Professor Lupin, who I accidentally called Professor Lupus in the middle of a conversation with my friend. Love this guy, and he better come back into the series because awesome mentor figures are awesome.<br /><br />2) Loved the minor character development. Rowling knows how to keep each character in the fray; I</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11652877137382013161\" style=\"display:none\">Not as tight as the second book in terms of pacing and the major plot twist(s) at the end, but still enjoyable. Because Camp NaNo has my brain fried, here are a few random tidbits that stood out.<br /><br />1) Professor Lupin, who I accidentally called Professor Lupus in the middle of a conversation with my friend. Love this guy, and he better come back into the series because awesome mentor figures are awesome.<br /><br />2) Loved the minor character development. Rowling knows how to keep each character in the fray; I definitely would not consider this a character-driven story, at least compared to other books outside of the science-fiction/fantasy genre, but she has a wide cast that she manages to develop with every installment. An example would be on page 149 when Professor McGonagall asks for the Hogsmeade permission forms and she informs Neville that his grandmother thought it would be safer if she sent it directly to the school.<br /><br />3) Ronmione. I sense I will ship them like no other in the future. The entire Crookshanks/Scabbers debacle as well as Ron's awkward pat on the head to Hermione has solidified my faith in this couple. Curious as to where the Harry/Cho Chang relationship will lead - maybe we'll finally see more of the houses other than Gryffindor.<br /><br />Looking forward to the fourth book! Also, here's an <a href=\"http://aroomofrequirement.wordpress.com/2012/12/03/the-sorting-hat-of-harry-potter-and-myers-briggs-personality-typology/\" rel=\"nofollow\">insanely intriguing blog post</a> that determines your Harry Potter house based on your Myers-Briggs personality type. Where are my fellow Ravenclaw/Hufflepuffs?</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"11652877137382013161\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n href=\"/user/show/2187043-mike-the-paladin\">Mike (the Paladin)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439136358\" href=\"/book/show/49116.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2187043-mike-the-paladin?shelf=ya-fantasy\">ya-fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer72482167\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17197869995987726797\">The waters are getting deeper in this volume, and a little darker...but the first readers were growing up between volumes when this was first published. These are some of the most well written books around. Kudos To Ms. Rowling.<br /><br />This book stands out for a couple of reasons...not to give any spoilers, it stands out as introing us to a couple of important characters and also for the nonappearance of another. The characters stay true to themselves and we get to know them even better.<br /><br />The characters i</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17197869995987726797\" style=\"display:none\">The waters are getting deeper in this volume, and a little darker...but the first readers were growing up between volumes when this was first published. These are some of the most well written books around. Kudos To Ms. Rowling.<br /><br />This book stands out for a couple of reasons...not to give any spoilers, it stands out as introing us to a couple of important characters and also for the nonappearance of another. The characters stay true to themselves and we get to know them even better.<br /><br />The characters in this/these books will probably be as real to you as any fictional characters in any book ever were or will be. Very, very well written. I believe you will grow to care deeply for them.<br /><br />Here Harry's relationship with his aunt and uncle (not to mention Dudley) becomes even more strained (yes I agree it seemed impossible, but there you are). Rushing off into the night Harry will soon be faced with certain changes and new challenges. He'll learn more about himself and start to learn things that will set him in good stead later in the story. <br /><br />Excellent books.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17197869995987726797\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border id=\"reviewTextContainer1580985736\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer18429526569295721280\">4.5/5<br /><br />Primero lo puntee con 4.25 estrellas pero tuve que subirlo a 4.5, es que me ha encantado! Le fuera colocado las 5 estrellitas si tuviera otra edad al leerlo, como he dicho en todas las demU+00E1s reseU+0F1A que tengo de Harry Potter. Y es que lo puedes disfrutar a cualquier edad, pero al ser mayor lo disfrutas de una manera diferente y mas critica, como es mi caso. <br /><br />Nada de lo anterior le quita lo mU+00E1gico y divertido a la lectura. Como siempre la Reina Rowling no deja decepcionar con su escritura bell</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText18429526569295721280\" style=\"display:none\">4.5/5<br /><br />Primero lo puntee con 4.25 estrellas pero tuve que subirlo a 4.5, es que me ha encantado! Le fuera colocado las 5 estrellitas si tuviera otra edad al leerlo, como he dicho en todas las demU+00E1s reseU+0F1A que tengo de Harry Potter. Y es que lo puedes disfrutar a cualquier edad, pero al ser mayor lo disfrutas de una manera diferente y mas critica, como es mi caso. <br /><br />Nada de lo anterior le quita lo mU+00E1gico y divertido a la lectura. Como siempre la Reina Rowling no deja decepcionar con su escritura bellisima y atrapante. Los nuevos personajes introducidos en este libro creo que se convertirU+00E1n en unos de mis favoritos en los prU+00F3ximos libros. Como se resuelve todo al final estuvo magnifico y las cosas reveladas me dejaron sorprendida. <br /><br />SeguirU+00E9 con el prU+00F3ximo libro muy pronto, pero por ahora no me quiero comprometerme a leer esa bestia de libro, aunque se que lo amare lo dejo para un futuro muy prU+00F3ximo. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"18429526569295721280\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13370137368537178845\">[5 Stars] Re-Read December 2014<br />I'm a little late with updating my Goodreads for this one, but I reread this for #HarryXmasToYou and I loved it! This one is neck in neck with the 4th for my favorite of the entire series!</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr false;\">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/566961858?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_566961858' style='display: none;'>\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_566961858' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review',
