class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_332135203\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/332135203\" />\n    <a title=\"Brad\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1022982-brad\"><img alt=\"Brad\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1442484575p2/1022982.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/332135203?book_show_action=false\">Jun 01, 2012</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Brad\" class=\"user\" name=\"Brad\" href=\"/user/show/1022982-brad\">Brad</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747573760\" href=\"/book/show/862686.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=children\">children</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=bronte-milos-books\">bronte-milos-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1022982-brad?shelf=geekdom\">geekdom</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer332135203\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5949366147017172194\">***There may be some spoilers ahead, but can these books really be spoiled at this point?***<br /><br />So this time through <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling\">Prisoner of Azkaban</a> something struck me about our general pop cultural acceptance that Albus Dumbledore is the goodest of the good, the best of the best, the most heroic of the heroes in Rowling's world (trumping even Harry because his sacrifice is genuine).<br /><br />I am not interested in Rowling's intentions for the characters in this; I am interested only in what I see. And what I see tells</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5949366147017172194\" style=\"display:none\">***There may be some spoilers ahead, but can these books really be spoiled at this point?***<br /><br />So this time through <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling\">Prisoner of Azkaban</a> something struck me about our general pop cultural acceptance that Albus Dumbledore is the goodest of the good, the best of the best, the most heroic of the heroes in Rowling's world (trumping even Harry because his sacrifice is genuine).<br /><br />I am not interested in Rowling's intentions for the characters in this; I am interested only in what I see. And what I see tells me that only one character is good and great and heroic in the kind of goodness and greatness and heroism that interests me.<br /><br />I am not saying that Dumbledore's a bad guy. He's no Voldemort, obviously (although I am not entirely convinced that Voldemort is the embodiment of evil we often think of him as), and he leads the battle against Voldemort's fascist rise, which makes him the Churchillian leader of English myth. He <u>does</u> sacrifice himself. He does risk his health and welfare to destroy horcruxes. He does protect Harry (while moving the boy around like the chess piece that the boy is). But what strikes me is that everything Dumbledore accomplishes is accomplished to maintain the status quo, and the status quo I see is far from worthy of maintenance. It is a status quo with a classic English power structure, rich white guys at the top (Dumbledore anyone?) and everyone else beneath. It is a status quo with the usual class divides. It is a status quo with some pretty hefty racism (goblins and giants and other Others). It is a status quo with institutionalized slavery (and Dumbledore himself uses a small army of House Elves to run Hogwarts without a hint of distaste). It is a status quo with a prison system of torture. And Dumbledore does nothing to disrupt that status quo. <br /><br />In my opinion, the character who is the goodest of the good, the best of the best, the most heroic of the heroes is the one who rails against the status quo while simultaneously battling Voldemort, and she fights Mr. Riddle far more significantly than the rest of the wizarding world. And she fights the status quo in spite of being mocked for her beliefs by everyone at every turn. For me the paragon we should aspire to is Hermione Granger. Not Dumbledore and certainly not Harry Potter. <br /><br />So with that in mind, what's not to love about <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a>. It is the moment that Hermione comes into her own. She is the key to the resolution. She keeps them all alive. She's sceptical, she's smart, and she is potent. I love Hermione. Take that Hermione haters. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5949366147017172194\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review332135203\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link332135203\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=332135203&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_332135203'><a id=\"like_count_review_332135203\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/332135203?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">15 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_332135203\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_332135203\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=15&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=332135203&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_332135203\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 332135203, true, ''); return false;\">23 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/332135203?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_332135203' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/332135203/comments?reverse=true\">View all 23 comments</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n<div id=\"comment_97647272\" class=\"brown_comment\">\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_photo\">\n    \t<a alt=\"Devy\" href=\"/user/show/411775-devy\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1190816044p1/411775.jpg\" alt=\"411775\" /></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"xhr_comment_body\">\n    <a style=\"font-weight:bold\" href=\"/user/show/411775-devy\">Devy</a>\n\n      \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5597096031316347271\">Is there such a thing as Hermione hater? How could there be anyone who hates her? She's the best role model!</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      Apr 29, 2014 09:07PM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n<div <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1477087484\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1477087484\" />\n    <a title=\"Moraes the Bookworm\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm\"><img alt=\"Moraes the Bookworm\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1465866511p2/50389307.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1477087484?book_show_action=false\">Jun 24, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Moraes the Bookworm\" class=\"user\" name=\"Moraes the Bookworm\" href=\"/user/show/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm\">Moraes the Bookworm</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=amazing-scenery-description\">amazing-scenery-description</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=feels-good-man\">feels-good-man</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=low-angst\">low-angst</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=in-your-face-magic\">in-your-face-magic</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=original-magic-system\">original-magic-system</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=contemporary\">contemporary</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50389307-moraes-the-bookworm?shelf=memorable-secondary-characters\">memorable-secondary-characters</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1477087484\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6785633752944299960\">Well, this is the book that I like the most in the whole series (I've come to notice that I tend to enjoy the third book more than any other in any given series; strange, isn't it?). Rowling keeps the dark tone of the previous book going on, and it's fantastic! That sense of danger waiting in the corner that I became used to while reading <i>The Chamber of Secrets</i> is still there, so every new chapter is a new surprise.<br><br>However, there are much more different things that go into this book that make it</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6785633752944299960\" style=\"display:none\">Well, this is the book that I like the most in the whole series (I've come to notice that I tend to enjoy the third book more than any other in any given series; strange, isn't it?). Rowling keeps the dark tone of the previous book going on, and it's fantastic! That sense of danger waiting in the corner that I became used to while reading <i>The Chamber of Secrets</i> is still there, so every new chapter is a new surprise.<br><br>However, there are much more different things that go into this book that make it excellent. <b>We are introduced to another Dursley, which, as usual, acts like a bitch.</b> Then we get to know a little bit more about Harry's dark past and its influence into his current life situation. There are also the <i>Dementors</i>, which bring a whole new meaning to the word \"evil\". Seriously, those guys are creepy. Nonetheless, Harry is back at Hogwarts with his friends and soon he is taught how to confront the Dementors with the assistance of my favorite Defense Against Dark Arts teacher of all time: Professor Lupin.<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1440166671i/15939900._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"300\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>There is also the addition of a whole new scenario: Hogsmeade.</b> Man, what I wouldn't give to go and visit that place... Due to Harry having to sneak his way into Hogsmeade we get to know some more about his father's activities while he was a student, as well as some new secret places in Hogwarts, which is really cool. What's more: Hermione starts taking some action against Draco and his troupe of sonsofbitches Slytherin friends, which is amazing to see. <b>This book really made me respect Hermione a lot more.</b><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1440166534i/15939849._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>From the half of the book forward, the story gets a very fast pace, meaning that things get absurdly intense. There's a lot of action, much more than the previous books; boundaries are broken, secrets are revealed and Rowling forcs us to get used to the darker shade to the story that would come to be dominant in the next books, with the ascension of dark forces and everything. Overall, there's not a thing that I don't like in this book!<br><br><u>\n  <b>Interesting quotes that I didn't include in the review:</b>\n</u><br><i>\n  <blockquote>The consequences of our actions are always so complicated, so diverse, that predicting the future is a very difficult business indeed.</blockquote>\n</i><br><i>\n  <blockquote>Besides, the world isn't split into good people and Death Eaters. We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.</blockquote>\n</i><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6785633752944299960\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar        <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=awesomesauce\">awesomesauce</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\"          <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=feel-good\">feel-good</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=too-many-feels\">too-many-feels</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=humour\">humour</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=family\">family</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=relationships\">relationships</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/35853271-sonja---badass-wanderer?shelf=magical-writing\">magical-writing</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1513797809\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5056491308417969760\"><b> <blockquote>\"IU+2019m not blamin' yeh!\" said Hagrid {U+2026} \"but I gotta tell yeh, I thought you two'd value yer friend more'n broomsticks or rats. Tha's all.\"</blockquote> </b><i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is my favourite book in the Harry Potter series. The first time I read it I gave it a ten out of ten; that hasn't changed. I still love <i>everything</i> about this book.<br /><br />This time I listened to the audiobook read by Stephen Fry. The audiobook was 11 hours and 42 minutes of genius. It was a wonderful experience! Stephen Fry b</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5056491308417969760\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <blockquote>\"IU+2019m not blamin' yeh!\" said Hagrid {U+2026} \"but I gotta tell yeh, I thought you two'd value yer friend more'n broomsticks or rats. Tha's all.\"</blockquote>\n</b><i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is my favourite book in the Harry Potter series. The first time I read it I gave it a ten out of ten; that hasn't changed. I still love <i>everything</i> about this book.<br /><br />This time I listened to the audiobook read by Stephen Fry. The audiobook was 11 hours and 42 minutes of genius. It was a wonderful experience! Stephen Fry brings the characters to life amazingly. I enjoyed every second!<br /><br />I can't pinpoint the <i>exact</i> reason <i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is my favourite. It just <i>is</i>. I LOVE IT. <3<br />.<br /><a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1483504758?book_show_action=false\">My Review of Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a><br />.<br />.<br />.<br /><i>\n  <u>1st read in August 2014</u>\n</i><br />U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50<b>/5 (10/10)</b><br />U+2018Harry Potter and the Prisoner of AzkabanU+2019 is a novel full of turning points and surprises. Rowling has done it again! This novel is <b>WOW</b>. There is not a sufficient amount of adjectives to describe how this novel makes me feel and how it is to read this novel. <br />The novel is in one aspect very different from the previous novels: the difficulty with understanding the novel and figuring the characters out. The plot has more layers and is more twisted than what it seems on the surface. <br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[People who were supposed to be the bad guys turned out to be the good guys. A rat, a dog and a wolf are supposedly just a rat, a dog and a wolf. NOT in this novel. In the Harry Potter universe, a rat is a villain who betrayed and fooled everyone. A dog is an innocent man who the whole world is looking for because he allegedly killed people. And a wolf is a good and kind teacher who once a month turns into a werewolf. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br />Rowling makes me believe in this world. She makes me root for the characters. When I open the novel, I am always happy to return to the Harry Potter universe and leave the Earth, that I know, behind. I grow with the characters and with the experiences they share. I learn from their mistakes. And I am excited when they are. Hogwarts feels surreal yet so real to me. <u>It is a dream I never want to wake up from.</u><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<blockquote>U+2018 U+2018You donU+2019t understand!U+2019 whined Pettigrew. U+2018He would have killed me, Sirius!U+2019 U+2018THEN YOU SHOULD HAVE DIED!U+2019 roared Black. U+2018DIED RATHER THAN BETRAY YOUR FRIENDS, AS WE WOULD HAVE DONE FOR YOU!U+2019 U+2019 - Peter and Sirius, p.275</blockquote>\n <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><blockquote> U+2018 U+2018You think the dead we have loved ever truly leave us? You think that we donU+2019t recall them more clearly than ever in times of great trouble? Your father is alive in you, Harry, and shows himself most plainly when you have need of him.U+2019 U+2019 - Dumbledore, p.312</blockquote></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5056491308417969760\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/168588390?book_show_action=false\">Jan 27, 2014</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Brendon Schrodinger\" class=\"user\" name=\"Brendon Schrodinger\" href=\"/user/show/5448792-brendon-schrodinger\">Brendon Schrodinger</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/5448792-brendon-schrodinger?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer168588390\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10543422540993092110\">So I have been visiting Hogwarts while up a ladder painting my house thanks to the dulcet tones Stephen Fry. It's a great method of making the job seem not so big. I have read all the series before and the earlier volumes several times now, but I haven't read any since Deathly Hallows came out. It was getting time to revisit these great books and I found the most brilliant way.<br /><br />What can I say about the books that hasn't been said before? I have no idea. So I guess I'll just write a little about t</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10543422540993092110\" style=\"display:none\">So I have been visiting Hogwarts while up a ladder painting my house thanks to the dulcet tones Stephen Fry. It's a great method of making the job seem not so big. I have read all the series before and the earlier volumes several times now, but I haven't read any since Deathly Hallows came out. It was getting time to revisit these great books and I found the most brilliant way.<br /><br />What can I say about the books that hasn't been said before? I have no idea. So I guess I'll just write a little about the audiobook experience and the minute details that I experience that I have forgotten in the books and were not part of the movies. There are a lot of them, especially the beginnings of each story at the Dursleys'. So even for a fan there is still an awful lot of detail that you have forgotten about. For example there is a lot of detail about Lupin in teh novels that is lost in the movies. And while the actor and the costume did a brilliant job in the movies, I feel that there was a slightly different Lupin to be found here. I think I liked him more.<br /><br />Stephen Fry does a wonderful job bringing the novels to life. He does all the voices, some better than others, and a mean Hagrid. Not literally, just spot-on. <br /><br />So I figure everyone is now either in a lover or a hater camp for Harry Potter. I'm not swaying anyone to read this. But for all those fans for who it has been a few years since reading, give it a go. It's time to revisit. And if you have an audible account or a local library with the audiobooks, experience it that way for a difference. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10543422540993092110\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review168588390\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link168588390\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=168588390&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_168588390'><a id=\"like_count_review_168588390\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/168588390?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">15 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_168588390\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_168588390\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=15&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=168588390&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_168588390\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 168588390, true, ''); return false;\">4 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href=\"/review/show/168588390?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5\">see review</a>\n    </div>\n\n\n    <div id='comments_for_review_168588390' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" href=\"/review/168588390/comments?reverse=true\">View all 4 comments</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_168588390' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 168588390, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1425503001\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1425503001\" />\n    <a title=\"Serena.. Sery-ously?\" class=\"user\" name=\"Serena.. Sery-ously?\" href=\"/user/show/2926860-serena-sery-ously\">Serena.. Sery-ously?</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439136358\" href=\"/book/show/49116.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=2015\">2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=eng_2015\">eng_2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2926860-serena-sery-ously?shelf=3-gioco-a-squadre-2015\">3-gioco-a-squadre-2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1425503001\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12948685598006696947\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1446547226i/16828749._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>MIND YOUR OWN BUSINESS, GOODREADS! Where people eat bread and socialize, I read Harry Potter!</b><br><br>A deep, paralyzing sorrow struck me: not just for Sirius (I was wondering.. Will his name ever be cleaned?? A feeling of uneasiness is driving me insane, I swear) but.. Well.. Snape. I have never felt bad for him in the third instalment before but.. It's overwhelming, I feel like crying (Again).<br><br>Snape love and despair apart, let's get back to business: I know I've said it before but.. <b>There's Harry Potter</b></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12948685598006696947\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1446547226i/16828749._SX540_.png\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>MIND YOUR OWN BUSINESS, GOODREADS! Where people eat bread and socialize, I read Harry Potter!</b><br><br>A deep, paralyzing sorrow struck me: not just for Sirius (I was wondering.. Will his name ever be cleaned?? A feeling of uneasiness is driving me insane, I swear) but.. Well.. Snape. I have never felt bad for him in the third instalment before but.. It's overwhelming, I feel like crying (Again).<br><br>Snape love and despair apart, let's get back to business: I know I've said it before but.. <b>There's Harry Potter. And then there is Harry Potter read by Stephen Fry.. class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer364767708\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16933179082705055550\">Reread in December 2014 for #HarryXmasToYou<br /><br />Such a great book! I love how much these characters develop as the books go on, and Remus and Sirius are some of my favorite characters. I feel like this is one I confuse with the movie a lot because I LOVE the PoA movie, so it was interesting to see some of the changes! Though it's a pretty faithful adaptation. Overall, just so great. I LOVE HARRY POTTER OMG.<br /><br />also ROWLING WHEN ARE WE GONNA GET SOME MAURADER SHORT STORIES EH???</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Shahad takleef\" class=\"user\" name=\"Shahad takleef\" href=\"/user/show/35406752-shahad-takleef\">Shahad takleef</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1729314959\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer184492701442103211\"><b>This. Was. The. Best. So. Far. !!!</b><br><br>This book is a turning point for the series , for several reasons , the first is that the characters are growing up into their more mature selves , and with that the book's also growing more deceitful around the twists and the terror is blinking at harry closer than ever , the world building is expanding , and there is the appearance of many important characters , those having much future influence like <b>Sirius </b>( Maybe I am biased to consider it a turning point;</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText184492701442103211\" style=\"display:none\"><b>This. Was. The. Best. So. Far. !!!</b><br><br>This book is a turning point for the series , for several reasons , the first is that the characters are growing up into their more mature selves , and with that the book's also growing more deceitful around the twists and the terror is blinking at harry closer than ever , the world building is expanding , and there is the appearance of many important characters , those having much future influence like <b>Sirius </b>( Maybe I am biased to consider it a turning point; because Sirius black is always one of my top favorite characters !! i dare say even more favorite than Harry Potter himself ) , <b>professor Lupin</b> , and even the <b>Dementors</b> . <br>Then JK Rowling's words have this curious habit of coming to life !! so vivid ! it sucks you into the HP world , then yo are unaware of anything else .<br>her characters are funny, and realistic. Fred and George , the soul of the comedy of this series !! they NEVER fail to give me good chuckles every few pages . and I love the whole Quidditch matches and Lee jordan hilarious commentary !<br>You can also clearly glimpse the clever plot Rowling has wove, the cleverly placed foreshadowing and the innocent hints ! <br>I always loved the movie , Now I love the Book even more ! All in all , its Fantastic , what else can I say ?<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1456461407i/18236981.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"184492701442103211\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1547542113?book_show_action=false\">Mar 12, 2016</a>\n\n      <a class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439136358\" href=\"/book/show/49116.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=highly-recommended\">highly-recommended</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=ebook_kindle\">ebook_kindle</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1376766-becky?shelf=2016\">2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1547542113\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6063145492361301817\">I love how this book starts and ends with the Dursleys. Horrible and nasty, and then completely terrified. Of course both are due to their own prejudices. Harry just plays them up at the end, because who wouldn't?<br /><br />This book is also a very Hermione-centric story... Her decisions and struggles and principles make the story possible. Can you imagine how it would be if she WASN'T a super ambitious student, and didn't have the time turner? Such a different story. <br /><br />I love Lupin and Harry's interactions</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6063145492361301817\" style=\"display:none\">I love how this book starts and ends with the Dursleys. Horrible and nasty, and then completely terrified. Of course both are due to their own prejudices. Harry just plays them up at the end, because who wouldn't?<br /><br />This book is also a very Hermione-centric story... Her decisions and struggles and principles make the story possible. Can you imagine how it would be if she WASN'T a super ambitious student, and didn't have the time turner? Such a different story. <br /><br />I love Lupin and Harry's interactions in this book, and they make me tear up a bit, knowing what's coming. Likewise with Sirius. *sigh*<br /><br />Love this series. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6063145492361301817\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1378413701\" />\n    <a title=\"Raquel Bookish\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/6366186-raquel-bookish\"><img alt=\"Raquel Bookish\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466678625p2/6366186.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1378413701?book_show_action=false\">Sep 16, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Raquel Bookish\" class=\"user\" name=\"Raquel Bookish\" href=\"/user/show/6366186-raquel-bookish\">Raquel Bookish</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/6366186-raquel-bookish?shelf=book-haul-tbr\">book-haul-tbr</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1378413701\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12391745928518101900\">\"U+00BFNo eres un poco mayor para leer libros de niU+00F1os?\" y \"Bueno, es que eso NO es literatura\". Ante estos dos argumentos de peso, es difU+0EDCil no derrumbarse, U+00BFverdad? Ahora que lo dices, creo que voy a dejar de leer estos libros que llenaron mi infancia y mi adolescencia de aventuras, fantasU+0EDA y amigos para toda la vida y que han tenido un papel fundamental a la hora de convertirme en quien soy. Muchas gracias por el consejo. <br /><br />NO. No voy a dejar de acudir a Harry Potter en los malos momentos, en los</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12391745928518101900\" style=\"display:none\">\"U+00BFNo eres un poco mayor para leer libros de niU+00F1os?\" y \"Bueno, es que eso NO es literatura\". Ante estos dos argumentos de peso, es difU+0EDCil no derrumbarse, U+00BFverdad? Ahora que lo dices, creo que voy a dejar de leer estos libros que llenaron mi infancia y mi adolescencia de aventuras, fantasU+0EDA y amigos para toda la vida y que han tenido un papel fundamental a la hora de convertirme en quien soy. Muchas gracias por el consejo. <br /><br />NO. No voy a dejar de acudir a Harry Potter en los malos momentos, en los regulares y en los buenos. No voy a dejar de ir a Hogwarts a recibir clases de transformaciones y pociones, no dejarU+00E9 de ir a los partidos de Quidditch, no dejarU+00E9 de quejarme de que no haya una novela sobre los merodeadores. oh. los merodeadores. Si algU+00FAn dU+0EDA sale de mi la frase \"soy demasiado mayor para Harry Potter\" serU+00E1 que el mundo ha podido conmigo, que las facetas mU+00E1s anodinas de la realidad me han sometido y una parte fundamental quiU+00E9n soy habrU+00E1 desaparecido para siempre.<br /><br />PerdU+00F3n por el discursito, pero es que no puedo hablar de Harry Potter como si SOLO fuese un libro. Harry Potter es mi infancia, es parte de quien soy, y cada vez que lo releo no dejo de sorprenderme del talento de J.K Rowling para atraparme en su mundo y hacerme sentir parte de U+00E9l (y para hilar sus novelas, todo sea dicho U+0BFC U+00F3mo demonios lo hace?, U+0BFC U+00F3mo hace que cada palabra que usa contribuya a llevarnos a esa escena final que tiene tramada desde el principio?). Pura magia.<br /><br />No sU+00E9 cuantas veces he leU+0EDDo este libro, pero dirU+0EDA que mU+00E1s de 10. PerdU+00ED la cuenta cuando tenU+0EDA 11 aU+00F1os y recuerdo que iba ya por la sU+00E9ptima. AU+00FAn asU+00ED, consigue emocionarme. Cada vez que Lupin o Sirius aparecen en el libro me da un vuelco el corazU+00F3n como si fuese la primera vez. Y cada vez que Snape o Draco hacen una de las suyas les detesto y pienso eso de \"malditos Slytherin\" (y eso que, segU+00FAn Pottermore, soy una de ellos). De verdad, no sU+00E9 cU+00F3mo lo hace la Rowling, pero es inigualable.<br /><br />Para los amantes del mundo mU+00E1gico, Hola, mis hermanos, somos la generaciU+00F3n del niU+00F1o que viviU+00F3. Ni millenials ni leches. Para los que no han leU+0EDDo esta maravillosa saga, pero quieren hacerlo, bienvenidos. Os espera un viaje sin igual.<br /><br />Nota: Hay mucha gente a la que no le gusta esta saga y es normal, porque si no serU+0EDAmos todos clones andantes y el mundo serU+0EDA soporU+0EDFero. Por fortuna la mayorU+0EDA de esta gente entiende que para gustos los colores y no me intentan convencer de quU+00E9 es lo que me \"puede gustar y lo que no\" y se merecen el mismo trato. </span>\n imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/7100759-dee\"><img alt=\"Dee U+2661\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477031502p2/7100759.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1422167044?book_show_action=false\">Oct 23, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Dee U+2661\" class=\"user\" name=\"Dee U+2661\" href=\"/user/show/7100759-dee\">Dee U+2661</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439136358\" href=\"/book/show/49116.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1422167044\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10789859333316383750\">As evident by her previous books, Rowling is the queen of magical storytelling. Prisoner of Azkaban was no different. This book was absolutely bloody brilliant. I had so much fun reading it and seeing how different the movie was from the book. IU+2019ve had a few people tell me that this book was there favorite and a few that say itU+2019s the weakest in the series and while I see both sides, itU+2019s still fantastic. It was fun, full of adventure that kept me on my toes all while completely becoming a game</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10789859333316383750\" style=\"display:none\">As evident by her previous books, Rowling is the queen of magical storytelling. Prisoner of Azkaban was no different. This book was absolutely bloody brilliant. I had so much fun reading it and seeing how different the movie was from the book. IU+2019ve had a few people tell me that this book was there favorite and a few that say itU+2019s the weakest in the series and while I see both sides, itU+2019s still fantastic. It was fun, full of adventure that kept me on my toes all while completely becoming a game changer. I loved that we got more insight on what happened the night Lily and James died and learned more about my precious Sirius. God I love him <3 And Lupin! I am not going to lie, I cried when he was leaving Hogwarts :'(<br /><br />One of my favorite parts about this book was U+201CHermioneU+2019s SecretU+201D :) I thought this was so funny seeing Harry and especially Ron completely confused as to how Hermione was in two places at once and how she was taking so many class. Leave it to Hermione to have something completely awesome and use it for more classes ;) On the other hand, it was kind of sad that because of this she was a little absent for this book, especially because the boys were not speaking with her.<br /><br />Though this book was very entertaining, it was a little calm. I know there isnU+2019t going to be some epic battle at the end or some confrontation with Voldemort, but all the build up to Sirius was intense and then when Harry meets him it was a little underwhelming. But it makes sense because Sirius being who he isU+2026<br /><br />Speaking of Sirius, oh god I am a puddle of feels after the ending of this book. I have always loved Sirius while watching the movies and the book has just made me love him more. I crumbled into pieces when Sirius asks Harry if he wants to live with him and he gets so happy when Harry says yes U+2665 U+2665 And just learning everything about his relationship with HarryU+2019s parents *sigh* such a great character.<br /><br />I donU+2019t really have much else to say about this book, but it was really great. I canU+2019t wait to read more :)<br /><br />Review originally posted on <a href=\"https://thebookishkhaleesi.wordpress.com/2015/10/23/harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban-harry-potter-3-by-j-k-rowling/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Bookish Khaleesi</a></span>\n  <a class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1377245704\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1377245704\" />\n    <a title=\"Francesca Tripiedi\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/22519507-francesca-tripiedi\"><img alt=\"Francesca Tripiedi\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473523346p2/22519507.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1377245704?book_show_action=false\">Aug 01, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Francesca Tripiedi\" class=\"user\" name=\"Francesca Tripiedi\" href=\"/user/show/22519507-francesca-tripiedi\">Francesca Tripiedi</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9788877828521\" href=\"/book/show/226246.Harry_Potter_e_il_prigioniero_di_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22519507-francesca-tripiedi?shelf=libreria-cartacea\">libreria-cartacea</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/22519507-francesca-tripiedi?shelf=lisa-simpson-bookshelf\">lisa-simpson-bookshelf</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1377245704\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15572326657591219356\">Vorrei chiedere a Beatrice Masini (la traduttrice di questa edizione della versione italiana) cosa l'abbia spinta, nel capitolo I a pagina 17, a inventarsi di sana pianta quel \"P.S. Il professor Albus Silente si unisce a me nell'augurarti un felice compleanno, Harry\". <br />Nella versione originale non c'U+00E8, cosa di cui sono stata felicemente ignara per gran parte della mia infanzia e adolescenza. Immaginate la sorpresa quando ho letto per la prima volta il testo in inglese. PiU+00F9 che di sorpresa, si puU+00F2</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15572326657591219356\" style=\"display:none\">Vorrei chiedere a Beatrice Masini (la traduttrice di questa edizione della versione italiana) cosa l'abbia spinta, nel capitolo I a pagina 17, a inventarsi di sana pianta quel \"P.S. Il professor Albus Silente si unisce a me nell'augurarti un felice compleanno, Harry\". <br />Nella versione originale non c'U+00E8, cosa di cui sono stata felicemente ignara per gran parte della mia infanzia e adolescenza. Immaginate la sorpresa quando ho letto per la prima volta il testo in inglese. PiU+00F9 che di sorpresa, si puU+00F2 parlare di un coccolone. U+00C8 soltanto una frase, U+00E8 vero, facile da ignorare forse, ma ridefinisce in modo sottile eppure definitivo due personaggi importanti della saga (la McGranitt e Silente) e conferisce loro sfumature che l'autrice non ha pensato nU+00E9/o voluto attribuirgli. Dopo tanti anni trascorsi a leggere quel P.S. e a sorriderci su, scoprire che il P.S. non esiste affatto U+00E8 irritante. Da lettrice, mi sento presa per i fondelli. Da aspirante traduttrice editoriale non capisco il senso di questa scelta di traduzione/invenzione. La ritengo inoltre una decisione molto poco professionale: se un autore affida il suo lavoro nelle tue esperte mani, non credo gli faccia piacere che tu ti prenda certe libertU+00E0 con quello che poi viene firmato a suo nome. <br /><br />Tuttavia, sebbene la delusione di questa scoperta mi abbia quasi fatto venire un'ulcera, non posso negare che per il resto ammiro moltissimo lo sforzo traduttivo che Beatrice Masini ha svolto sui libri della Rowling. La sua capacitU+00E0 di tradurre i nomi che popolano il mondo di Harry Potter con corrispettivi italiani che riuscissero a mantenere la stessa carica evocativa penso che sia innegabile. Soltanto per questo, la mia valutazione resta a cinque stelle. Senza contare che \"Il prigioniero di Azkaban\" resta dei sette il mio libro preferito U+2013 per lo meno, U+00E8 quello che rileggo piU+00F9 spesso. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15572326657591219356\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1377245704\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/134292129\" />\n    <a title=\"Saoirse Sterling\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling\"><img alt=\"Saoirse Sterling\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478339708p2/4639825.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/134292129?book_show_action=false\">Jun 01, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Saoirse Sterling\" class=\"user\" name=\"Saoirse Sterling\" href=\"/user/show/4639825-saoirse-sterling\">Saoirse Sterling</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">liked it</span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span><span title=\"liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bairns\">bairns</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=sterling\">sterling</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=childhood\">childhood</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\"        <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=ce20\">ce20</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=2016\">2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4639825-saoirse-sterling?shelf=bookshelf\">bookshelf</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer134292129\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13936432312104211404\">[First read: December 2001. 3 stars.<br />Second read: 2nd February 2016. 3 stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br />I think it was pretty similar to the first two books in terms of style, but of course there was little other development, except a small addition to the world (Hogsmeade: whilst it's a nice place, it's still far too small to provide much to the whole) and to the characters (Sirius and Lupin). At this point in the series we are st</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText13936432312104211404\" style=\"display:none\">[First read: December 2001. 3 stars.<br />Second read: 2nd February 2016. 3 stars.]<br /><br />Read as part of the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://xleptodactylous.blogspot.co.uk/2016/01/infinite-variety-book-challenge-2016.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">#InfiniteVariety2016 Reading Challenge</a> based on the BBC's Big Read poll.<br /><br />I think it was pretty similar to the first two books in terms of style, but of course there was little other development, except a small addition to the world (Hogsmeade: whilst it's a nice place, it's still far too small to provide much to the whole) and to the characters (Sirius and Lupin). At this point in the series we are still looking at rather simple children's books, but the tone of the story is getting much darker and you can see the transition as the characters themselves get older and the threats grow.<br /><br />I liked the development of Hermione, which is something I'm looking at closely during this re-read. In the first two books she just seemed like the Token Girl, who giggled and cried and was scared and needed to be rescued (much like Ginny, who has perhaps replaced her), but in this third book she seems to have dropped that moniker somewhat. She's still not quite as I remember her, though.<br /><br />It was written better than the first two: you can clearly see various improvements, but it still doesn't seem to have the magic I was expecting. Not magic-magic (y'know, wooshy wands and all that) but the magic of the whole thing. I think the severe lack of world is really getting to me: the castle is fun, the Dursley's house is fun, the solitary trips to Diagon Alley and Hogsmeade are fun, but they're so small. So so small.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13936432312104211404\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div      <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" href=\"/review/list/30817744-sandy-the-world-could-end-while-i-was-reading-and-i-would-never-notice?shelf=2016\">2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1760225121\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4204214928321166558\">I just could not go to sleep last night until I had finished #3 of the Harry Potter series. This, in my honest opinion is the best book of the series so far.<br /><br />As an adult, I had never much been interested in Harry Potter, never watched the movies, never even remotely interested in reading the books. But then I bought #1 for my grandson. But he already had the full series, and we decided to read them together.......and I love them!<br /><br />Looking forward to #4.</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1389243063\" />\n    <a title=\"U+03A7 U+03B1 U+03C1 U+03AC(Chara)_ MimL\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/46885471-chara-miml\"><img alt=\"U+03A7 U+03B1 U+03C1 U+03AC(Chara)_ MimL\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478171306p2/46885471.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1389243063?book_show_action=false\">May 06, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"U+03A7 U+03B1 U+03C1 U+03AC(Chara)_ MimL\" class=\"user\" name=\"U+03A7 U+03B1 U+03C1 U+03AC(Chara)_ MimL\" href=\"/user/show/46885471-chara-miml\">U+03A7 U+03B1 U+03C1 U+03AC(Chara)_ MimL</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/46885471-chara-miml?shelf=books-i-love\">books-i-love</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1389243063\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11366541846337201834\">I decided to review this one because it is by far my favorite of the series. I love Harry Potter, i grew up with Harry Potter and it was part of my childhood. There are no words to describe how much i love this book. I have read it 23 times. I adore it, i cherish it and i gaze at the book with nostalgia. I have the spine broken. Me. All my books look totally new, like you just bought them from the bookstore, but not this one. This looks used and reread and the spine is broken and i am feeling</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11366541846337201834\" style=\"display:none\">I decided to review this one because it is by far my favorite of the series. I love Harry Potter, i grew up with Harry Potter and it was part of my childhood. There are no words to describe how much i love this book. I have read it 23 times. I adore it, i cherish it and i gaze at the book with nostalgia. I have the spine broken. Me. All my books look totally new, like you just bought them from the bookstore, but not this one. This looks used and reread and the spine is broken and i am feeling just fine about it. It's like it's heavier whenever i get it in my hands. All my feelings, all my memories are lying between the pages. I knew parts of it by heart. I had this urge to read it all over again right after finishing it. If you haven't read the Harry Potter series, please do. You will enjoy the books and you will understand why there are so many of us praising them. Give them a shot, they are worth your time <3</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"11366541846337201834\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\"          <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1312450-danielle-love-at-first-page?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1454534521\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10827797330775551246\"><b>4-4.5 stars</b><br><br>Definitely my favorite of the series so far! Reading about the Mauraders made me so happy (and kinda sad), and I love how Harry, Ron, and Hermione sort of mirror them. I want more Sirius, Lupin, and James! <br><br>But seriously, can we talk about how Dumbledore at the end of every book be like<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1444178652ra/16463139.gif\" width=\"200\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>He's like Santa Claus, Gandalf, and Yoda rolled into one. <br><br>Now onto <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6.Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire__Harry_Potter__4_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (Harry Potter #4) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a>. Oh my god these books are about to get massive... </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_582890259\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/582890259\" />\n    <a title=\"Angela\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4255477-angela\"><img alt=\"Angela\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1398251387p2/4255477.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/582890259?book_show_action=false\">Mar 16, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Angela\" class=\"user\" name=\"Angela\" href=\"/user/show/4255477-angela\">Angela</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Kindle Edition \" href=\"/book/show/13563640-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=ya\">ya</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read\">2013-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2013-read-sequels\">2013-read-sequels</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=middle-grade\">middle-grade</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=kindle\">kindle</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4255477-angela?shelf=2016-read\">2016-read</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer582890259\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer257925018250130356\"><i>I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.</i><br /><br />This is my favorite Harry Potter book - at least to this point, and probably for the entire series. I'll let you know if that remains true by the time I get through this re-read. They're all so good that it's really a matter of degrees, though.<br /><br />This book remains one of the very few to ever (not just in Harry Potter, but in my entire reading life) completely surprise me. And not just to surprise me, but to have laid all the foreshadowing so cleverly that I</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText257925018250130356\" style=\"display:none\"><i>I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.</i><br /><br />This is my favorite Harry Potter book - at least to this point, and probably for the entire series. I'll let you know if that remains true by the time I get through this re-read. They're all so good that it's really a matter of degrees, though.<br /><br />This book remains one of the very few to ever (not just in Harry Potter, but in my entire reading life) completely surprise me. And not just to surprise me, but to have laid all the foreshadowing so cleverly that I could have guessed the truth, but still did not. Maybe I was caught up in the story, in the action and laughter, the drama and worry. It's possible, but I highly doubt it. J.K. Rowling is a master story-teller - something that becomes more and more evident on re-reads.<br /><br />Even now, so many years later, having read the series (well, at least these first few books) a couple dozen times, I find things that surprise me and make me go: \"Oh! How haven't I caught that before?!\" The foreshadowing (for the entire series, including some revelations that shocked many in the end) is there.<br /><br />Khanh brilliantly states in <a href=\"http://thebookeaters.net/2016/02/18/review-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban/\" rel=\"nofollow\">her review</a> that:<br /><br /><blockquote>This is the last Harry Potter book in which Harry is a child. Before his life - and this series - was visited by the spectre of death. I'm not talking about the long-ago deaths of James and Lily, of course Harry has experienced deaths before, but it was distant. I'm talking about the future deaths where Harry lost people he actually remembered, and respected, and loved. That's what I mean when I say that this is the last book in which Harry is a child, because as hard as his life was until now, he still had his innocence.<br /><br />Children believe that their heroes are unerring. One of the rites of passage to adulthood is the realization that heroes fall, like everyone else.</blockquote><br /><br />Harry realizes, probably for the first time, that those he always looked to for answers, to solve problems and right wrongs, aren't always able to. This is the book where Harry takes control, knowing fully that he's the only one that can do it.<br /><br />He grows up a lot in this book. And I can't help but feel badly for the little boy that deserved a much happier childhood. Still, Prisoner of Azkaban, and the series, isn't devoid of fun and humor - there's plenty here to balance out the growing darkness.<br /><br />Some of my favorite moments:<br /><br />1. Knight Bus<br />2. Crookshanks - <i>So much that I named my cat after Crookshanks</i><br />3. Chocolate: \"Eat it. It'll help.\" - <i>Yes, yes, it does.</i><br />4. \"Oh, it's you, is it? I suppose you've been doing something dangerous again?\"<br />5. Sir Cadogan<br />6. \"You're going to suffer but be very happy...\"<br />7. Professor Boggart Snape<br />8. \"...page three-hundred and ninety-four...\" - <i><3 Alan Rickman (who will forever be Snape to me)</i><br />9. Marauder's Map<br />10. Buckbeak<br />11. Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs - <i><3 <3 <3 (I won't say which I don't love, but you probably know)</i><br />12. *SLAP*<br /><br />Here comes my only complaint: I know this isn't a popular opinion, and perhaps people think I should be more forgiving, but I'm a Hufflepuff - loyalty is highly prized by me - and Ron can be an absolute ass. This is the first book where it's really driven home for me, but it's not the last.<br /><br />Oh, and no matter how good you think the movie is (and it's the first that takes real liberties with both the world and the story), the book is infinitely better. <br /><br /><i>Mischief Managed.</i><br /><br />Previous thoughts:<br />It's not possible for me to do a review for any of these books justice. I think I've finally come to that conclusion. <br /><br />I remember being absolutely awe-struck and blown away the first time I read this. Rowling threw a twist in there that I never saw coming (still one of the few books to pull one over on me), and on re-reads I always marvel at how completely she set me up for that twist. I should have seen it coming, but I didn't. <br /><br />That's just a small part of what makes this book my favorite in the series. It always has been. It always will be. <br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"257925018250130356\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review582890259\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link582890259\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=582890259&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_582890259'><a id=\"like_count_review_582890259\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/582890259?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">17 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_582890259\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_582890259\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=17&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=582890259&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span id='comments_for_review_582890259' style='display: none;'>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1479475355\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1479475355\" />\n    <a title=\"Christine (weereader)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/39719286-christine-weereader\"><img alt=\"Christine (weereader)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467736668p2/39719286.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1479475355?book_show_action=false\">Dec 29, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Christine (weereader)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Christine (weereader)\" href=\"/user/show/39719286-christine-weereader\">Christine (weereader)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/39719286-christine-weereader?shelf=read-2015\">read-2015</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1479475355\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16670079289169048141\">Prisoner of Azkaban has always been one of my favourite books in the Harry Potter series, in this book we really start to see just how intricate and complex the wizarding world is. I think this book really demonstrates how brilliant Rowling's writing is and we start to see just how well thought out the book series is.<br />It's great to see the characters develop and be able to watch so many of them grow at the one time, I love that we get to know so many of Harry's classmates and their families.<br />The w</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16670079289169048141\" style=\"display:none\">Prisoner of Azkaban has always been one of my favourite books in the Harry Potter series, in this book we really start to see just how intricate and complex the wizarding world is. I think this book really demonstrates how brilliant Rowling's writing is and we start to see just how well thought out the book series is.<br />It's great to see the characters develop and be able to watch so many of them grow at the one time, I love that we get to know so many of Harry's classmates and their families.<br />The world building in this book is also exceptional, Rowling drops so many subtle hints and pieces of information that we will be able to call upon when reading the later books in the series. I love that everything is so subtly intertwined. <br />I absolutely adore Hogsmeade and I love that we finally get to read about it in this book. Harry, Ron and Hermione also do a lot more exploring of the Hogwarts castle and grounds in this book which is always fascinating to read about. <br /> I always felt motivated by these books to do my homework and even now that I'm at university they still motivate me to work, it's mind-blowing that reading about children in a school remains magical and exciting no matter how many times I reread these books.<br />Sirius Black and Remus Lupin have always been two of my favourite characters of all time, and so I love this book as it introduces them to us. <br />I actually felt close to tears reading the ending of this book, it's so frustrating and sad, whilst also being so happy and the start of a whole new chapter in Harry's life. (I am not emotionally stable when it comes to reading these books).</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16670079289169048141\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n
