itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/46811963\" />\n    <a title=\"Henry\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1687276-henry\"><img alt=\"Henry\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1294879605p2/1687276.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/46811963?book_show_action=false\">Mar 06, 2009</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Henry\" class=\"user\" name=\"Henry\" href=\"/user/show/1687276-henry\">Henry</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1687276-henry?shelf=own\">own</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1687276-henry?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer46811963\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7412640435854938317\">Since everyone is probably already familiar with the Harry Potter series and with this book in particular, I'm not going to write any sort of summary. I am just going to say that of the three I have read so far, this is by far the best. <br />I felt that this book had the best and well thought out story line of the series so far. But keep in mind, I have only gotten through book three. Rowling also left no stones unturned by revealing the secrets behind all of the wizardry items and people introduced</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7412640435854938317\" style=\"display:none\">Since everyone is probably already familiar with the Harry Potter series and with this book in particular, I'm not going to write any sort of summary. I am just going to say that of the three I have read so far, this is by far the best. <br />I felt that this book had the best and well thought out story line of the series so far. But keep in mind, I have only gotten through book three. Rowling also left no stones unturned by revealing the secrets behind all of the wizardry items and people introduced in the book, unlike previous stories. I am thinking of The Marauder's Map and the Time Turner. She also tidily answered questions that were raised within the book as well such as the Shrieking Shack and the names Padfoot, Moony, Wormtail, and Prongs. <br /><br />The story ending of course was left open so as to move on to the next installment, but that was expected. For me though, the ending of the story was great. Once I got to Chapter 19, I couldn't put the book down. My favorite part of the book was when Remus, Sirus, Harry, Hermione, Ron, and Snape are all in that Shrieking Shack, and you finally get to learn a lot of key information about Harry's past. <br /><br />I am usually judicious with my 5 star rating, but this book deserves more than just four stars. Since I can't give a 1/2 star I am going to give it the full 5. I thought the book suspenseful, mysterious and of course adventurous. <br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7412640435854938317\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1516787612\" />\n    <a title=\"Fadwa (Word Wonders)\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/42662881-fadwa-word-wonders\"><img alt=\"Fadwa (Word Wonders)\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467335852p2/42662881.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1516787612?book_show_action=false\">Aug 19, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Fadwa (Word Wonders)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Fadwa (Word Wonders)\" href=\"/user/show/42662881-fadwa-word-wonders\">Fadwa (Word Wonders)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/42662881-fadwa-word-wonders?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1516787612\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer3705111190506054251\">I swear I'll never stop saying this but THIS SERIES IS GENIUS. How can I love it more than I did before? <br />It just blows my mind how everything is weaved together and how the characters and events are connected in ways the reader never expects. I must admit this book is probably my least favorite because it is slow for most of it as nothing concrete really happens but WHO CARES? I just love the story too damn much to not be biased about it.<br />Hermione is more badass than ever and she's stepping on ev</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText3705111190506054251\" style=\"display:none\">I swear I'll never stop saying this but THIS SERIES IS GENIUS. How can I love it more than I did before? <br />It just blows my mind how everything is weaved together and how the characters and events are connected in ways the reader never expects. I must admit this book is probably my least favorite because it is slow for most of it as nothing concrete really happens but WHO CARES? I just love the story too damn much to not be biased about it.<br />Hermione is more badass than ever and she's stepping on every rule ever and LOVES IT.<br />Dumbledore is the most hilarious man ever because he is so wise and calm that when he plays people it just adds that much more to the action especially when he's driving Snape insane. I love that !! Especially since I don't like Snape very much. I know guys, I know everything! But I just can't love him despite everything.<br />This took me waaay too long to read because... I wasn't reading lol. I probably spent 3 real days reading. <br />Okay, so I'm done rambling now. ONTO THE GOBLET OF FIRE WE GO !</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"3705111190506054251\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n if it is due to my age or something else but I did not enjoy this book as much as the previous two. At the expense of being hated I would say that in my opinion Harry Potter is overhyped.         <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer177283610\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6358144800973739733\">In this particular re-read, I think this might be my favourite so far. It's been years since I read <i>The Prisoner of Azkaban</i>, and whilst re-reading it was not as cosy an experience as <i>The Chamber of Secrets</i> (I know that book inside out, as well as the film), book 3 has a lot of my favourite things about the series: Hogsmeade, Sirius Black, Remus Lupin, that spooky dark atmosphere, and QUIDDITCH.<br /><br />5 stars for sure - even though I think the ending goes on a little too long, I still have to rate it th</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6358144800973739733\" style=\"display:none\">In this particular re-read, I think this might be my favourite so far. It's been years since I read <i>The Prisoner of Azkaban</i>, and whilst re-reading it was not as cosy an experience as <i>The Chamber of Secrets</i> (I know that book inside out, as well as the film), book 3 has a lot of my favourite things about the series: Hogsmeade, Sirius Black, Remus Lupin, that spooky dark atmosphere, and QUIDDITCH.<br /><br />5 stars for sure - even though I think the ending goes on a little too long, I still have to rate it the top rating because I love it so much.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6358144800973739733\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return I know I'm probably the two millionth bleeding person to point this out, but if they have a bleeding time machine then why don't they bleeding use it in the later books? It would have been bleeding useful. It's things like this that make me seriously doubt her bleeding claim to have planned out the whole bleeding series from the beginning. <br /><br />Bleeding heck. Why I am writing this bleeding review? I must have something better to do. $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:shown', function() {\n        if (this.up('#box')) {\n          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});\n        } else {\n          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});\n        }\n      });\n      $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {\n class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1119052058\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer2732822724916966279\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457703974i/18391345.jpg\" width=\"420\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>[Remind me sometime to stop, please!]<br>IT'S HARRY POTTER! <br>WAIT, IT'S HARRY POTTER! <br>YAY! IT'S HARRY POTTER! How do you stand out from the crowd whence the individuals seem hell bent on claiming to love the bespectacled boy more than any other person in the world? Rate the book with more stars than anyone has done so far. Until the rating system cannot take any more stars. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472839025ra/20319517.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I came into contact with the infectiously magical world of Harry Potter around the time the third movie installation of the seri</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2732822724916966279\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1457703974i/18391345.jpg\" width=\"420\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50 U+2B50[Remind me sometime to stop, please!]<br>IT'S HARRY POTTER! <br>WAIT, IT'S HARRY POTTER! <br>YAY! IT'S HARRY POTTER! How do you stand out from the crowd whence the individuals seem hell bent on claiming to love the bespectacled boy more than any other person in the world? Rate the book with more stars than anyone has done so far. Until the rating system cannot take any more stars. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472839025ra/20319517.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>U+23E9I came into contact with the infectiously magical world of Harry Potter around the time the third movie installation of the series came out and the <b>Time Turner</b> is one of the earliest memories I have, in addition to the <b>life-sized game of Chess</b> that the trio played in <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a> and the name <i>Tom Marvolo Riddle</i> rearranging itself to form <i>Lord Voldemort</i> in <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter___2_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter, #2) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a>. It was a long time ago, that Harry Potter has now come to symbolize a customary walk down memory lane and revisiting my childhood; even though this is my first time reading the books, seventeen odd years after the first one came out.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472839025ra/20319518.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>U+23E9I was 13 years old when <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban__Harry_Potter___3_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (Harry Potter, #3) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a> movie hit the big screens. I didn't know what relation there was between the puny pet <b>Scabbers</b> and the buck-teethed man it morphed into- <i>Peter Pettigrew</i>. I watched with fascination the transmogrification of a rat into a man and many years later, here I am, learning the truth behind the act- <i>animagus!</i> And, Peter Pettigrew is, sure enough, disgusting to look at! Ew! <br><br>U+23E9This book introduced many fun novelties like <br>U+2705<i>the Knight Bus, <br>U+2705the Dementors, <br>U+2705Professor Trelawney, <br>U+2705the Boggarts, <br>U+2705the Patronus, <br>U+2705the amazing trio- Padfoot, Moony, Prongs</i>(who wants anything to do with Wormtail?), <br>U+2705<i>the Marauder's Map</i>(I am eternally grateful for the slogan <b>\n  <blockquote>\"I solemnly swear that I am upto no good\"</blockquote>\n</b>) and <br>U+2705the amazing man behind the steering wheel- <b>Professor Lupin.</b> <br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1472839025i/20319519.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>U+23E9If you peruse through the chapter titles, you will find one major thing to be missing. Again that maybe because Rowling had thought that this person had the power to change the course of Harry's past: not in literal sense, though! <br><i>The Grim. Padfoot. The Prisoner of Azkaban, The Godfather. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[Sirius Black. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></i> <br><br>U+23E9<b>\n  <u>Okay, I have an issue with Gary Oldman.</u>\n</b> His real blond hair from <i>The Dark Knight</i> series is a major turn-off for me. His shaggy black-haired character in the movie fades into background in a jiffy and is replaced by the powerful presence of the police commissioner of Gotham city. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1384401741ra/6868365.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>U+2757 U+2757All in all, this is the only book in the series where <u>Mouldy ol' Voldy maintains a low profile.</u> Because we all know that he's going to be <i>back with a bang</i> in the next book!<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472839025ra/20319520.gif\" width=\"400\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1483634664?book_show_action=false\">Dec 28, 2015</a>\n\n      <a id=\"reviewTextContainer1483634664\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1455881986485084005\">4.5<br /><br />My favorite Harry Potter so far. The cast of characters and world really expanded in this one and there were some moments of brilliance. My one complaint was the pacing, as something great would happen and then there'd be long stretches of time without much plot development. I still don't feel like I'm aboard the HP fandom train but I think I might be getting there. Also psyched I finally know what the Marauders Map is.</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border href=\"/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=messed-with-my-feelings\">messed-with-my-feelings</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/38658747-evelyn-devours-and-digests-words?shelf=bagful-of-laughs\">bagful-of-laughs</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1221841106\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4557648591194133457\">ALL. THE. STARS. <br /><br />ALL. THE. LOVE.<br /><br />I've always admired how so much more complex the plot in <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is. Even after many rereads and re-watches, I am still taken aback by the <b>twists within the plot twist.</b> I never saw it coming at first and eventhough I do very much now, I still marvel at how Rowling really took precision in her mysteries. All those hints and suspicions from the previous pages came together and connected all the dots to form one huge, mindblowing explanation that cleared</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4557648591194133457\" style=\"display:none\">ALL. THE. STARS. <br /><br />ALL. THE. LOVE.<br /><br />I've always admired how so much more complex the plot in <i>Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is. Even after many rereads and re-watches, I am still taken aback by the <b>twists within the plot twist.</b> I never saw it coming at first and eventhough I do very much now, I still marvel at how Rowling really took precision in her mysteries. All those hints and suspicions from the previous pages came together and connected all the dots to form one huge, mindblowing explanation that cleared everything up.<br /><br />Hermione's time turning events may leave the door wide open for many, many plot holes but I DON'T EVEN WANT TO THINK ABOUT THEM. Honestly, <b>if there ever was a flaw in the Harry Potter series, I'm very willing to overlook all of them and just sit back and enjoy the stories. </b>For one thing, I did not care about Harry's Special Chosen One Syndrome and I'm not EVER going to, with good reasons.<br /><br />My heart really hurt (gross exaggeration, there) to revisit this book in the series where Sirius Black is first introduced to Harry Potter as a murderous-convict-turned-godfather. All those great chances Harry could have had with Black never happened and damn it, Rowling, that's still such a huge blow even <b>after all this time.</b><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4557648591194133457\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1221841106\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_1250198185\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1250198185\" />\n    <a title=\"Steve\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\"><img alt=\"Steve\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463021489p2/2314568.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1250198185?book_show_action=false\">Apr 11, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Steve\" class=\"user\" name=\"Steve\" href=\"/user/show/2314568-steve\">Steve</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=read-in-2015\">read-in-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=rmfao-2015-genre-challenge\">rmfao-2015-genre-challenge</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/2314568-steve?shelf=ya\">ya</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1250198185\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6015603133402254888\">Now this is where Rowling strikes gold! I thought AZKABAN was not only easily the best of first three, but one of the best books I've read in a long time. The storyline is easily the strongest of the first three installments, and for once Voldemort is not the main villain driving the plot, but a renegade supporter who murdered 13 people with a single curse.<br /><br />What makes Azkaban so interesting is learning about the relationships between James Potter, Remus Lupin, Sirius Black, Peter Pettigrew, and S</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6015603133402254888\" style=\"display:none\">Now this is where Rowling strikes gold! I thought AZKABAN was not only easily the best of first three, but one of the best books I've read in a long time. The storyline is easily the strongest of the first three installments, and for once Voldemort is not the main villain driving the plot, but a renegade supporter who murdered 13 people with a single curse.<br /><br />What makes Azkaban so interesting is learning about the relationships between James Potter, Remus Lupin, Sirius Black, Peter Pettigrew, and Severus Snape.<br /><br />Rowling introduces a new magical artifiact called the Marauder's Map, which she uncharacteristically fully explains by the end of the novel. The map shows you the location of everyone on the Hogwarts grounds, a tremendously useful item, supplied, appropriately enough, by those masters of mischief, Fred and George.<br /><br />Another great new bit of magic in the book is the Patronus, a magical spell that will help fight back the dementors and fear, a very advanced piece of magic for third year students. <br /><br />There are many memorable scenes and events, and there's a lot more key information revealed about Harry's past.<br /><br />On to the next one! </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6015603133402254888\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1250198185\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1250198185&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1250198185'><a id=\"like_count_review_1250198185\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1250198185?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">26 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1250198185\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1250198185\" ref=\"like\" class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\"      <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=laugh-out-loud-moments\">laugh-out-loud-moments</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\"          <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=favorite-series\">favorite-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=the-feels\">the-feels</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/15094746-vilda?shelf=wipes-tears\">wipes-tears</a>, \n    </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer468115263\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17504378960056507785\">5+ stars<br /><blockquote> <i>\"'Would anyone like me to help them interpret the shadowy portents within their Orb?' she murmured over the clinking of her bangles.<br />'I don't need help,' Ron whispered. 'It's obvious what this means. There's going to be loads of fog tonight.'\"</i> </blockquote><br />Book #3 has always been a huge favorite of mine when it comes to the Harry Potter series, but when you haven't re-read a book for about 10 years, the specific reasons why you loved said book becomes a bit blurry. <b>It was therefore truly wonderful to</b></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17504378960056507785\" style=\"display:none\">5+ stars<br /><blockquote>\n  <i>\"'Would anyone like me to help them interpret the shadowy portents within their Orb?' she murmured over the clinking of her bangles.<br />'I don't need help,' Ron whispered. 'It's obvious what this means. There's going to be loads of fog tonight.'\"</i>\n</blockquote><br />Book #3 has always been a huge favorite of mine when it comes to the Harry Potter series, but when you haven't re-read a book for about 10 years, the specific reasons why you loved said book becomes a bit blurry. <b>It was therefore truly wonderful to finally re-read this book and realize yet again why I love it so very much.</b> As well as realizing, once again, that the movies definitely left <i>a lot</i> of awesome out of this story. And, in my opinion, this is where the series really start taking off for the more darker story-line which follows through the rest of the books.<br /><br />I don't wanna go into details in a super in-depth review, but would much rather pick up the next book and continue this re-read marathon <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/user/show/19501274-nika-off-to-neverland\">Nika</a> and I've got going. <b>However, I have to say that Sirius Black and Remus Lupin</b> (along with a James Potter, whom I wish both us readers as well as Harry would have gotten to know better) <b>are some of my absolute favorite characters and I love the crazy start to their relationship with their best friend's son.</b><br /><br />Loved all of it. For the x-number of times. Brilliant.<br /><br /><blockquote>\n  <i>'You think the dead we have loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly than ever in times of great trouble? Your father is alive in you, Harry, and shows himself most plainly when you have need of him.'</i>\n</blockquote></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17504378960056507785\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review468115263\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link468115263\" \n\n<div id=\"review_1644350532\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1644350532\" />\n    <a title=\"Alexis Rodrigue\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/36907106-alexis-rodrigue\"><img alt=\"Alexis Rodrigue\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463452680p2/36907106.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1644350532?book_show_action=false\">Jun 11, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Alexis Rodrigue\" class=\"user\" name=\"Alexis Rodrigue\" href=\"/user/show/36907106-alexis-rodrigue\">Alexis Rodrigue</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\" href=\"/book/show/17347383-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/36907106-alexis-rodrigue?shelf=52-books-2016\">52-books-2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1644350532\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9253567829460102875\">This is definitely my favorite book in the series so far. I just loved how this book felt like the true beginning to the plot, with the introduction of the Marauders and the more detailed account of Harry's past. This book was the first book where Harry and the crew felt like they were growing up. In books one and two, they were still very childish and young. But this book felt a lot like a loss of innocence in a way, and I really enjoyed that. Super excited to pick up the next book.</span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_64890171\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/64890171\" />\n    <a title=\"Greg\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/42508-greg\"><img alt=\"Greg\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1368721201p2/42508.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/64890171?book_show_action=false\">Jul 26, 2009</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Greg\" class=\"user\" name=\"Greg\" href=\"/user/show/42508-greg\">Greg</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/42508-greg?shelf=sf-fantasy-and-other-dorky-shit\">sf-fantasy-and-other-dorky-shit</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/42508-greg?shelf=books-for-kids\">books-for-kids</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/42508-greg?shelf=girls-girls-girls\">girls-girls-girls</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer64890171\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer18081434607402199273\"><i>My Harry Potter Apology</i><br /><br />A couple of summers ago I tried to read <i>Harry Potter</i>. I expected to be unimpressed, and I was was. The first two novels in the series are unspectacular. After reading more children's literature recently I've realized that they are fairly standard fair for the kiddie fantasy genre, but that still left me wondering why everyone cared so much about this little nerdling. If I hadn't engrossed myself in books for kids this summer I probably wouldn't have ever gotten decided to</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText18081434607402199273\" style=\"display:none\"><i>My Harry Potter Apology</i><br /><br />A couple of summers ago I tried to read <i>Harry Potter</i>. I expected to be unimpressed, and I was was. The first two novels in the series are unspectacular. After reading more children's literature recently I've realized that they are fairly standard fair for the kiddie fantasy genre, but that still left me wondering why everyone cared so much about this little nerdling. If I hadn't engrossed myself in books for kids this summer I probably wouldn't have ever gotten decided to give <i>Harry Potter</i> another chance. I needed to figure out why, why was this series so popular? What makes this a huge cultural phenomena, while a book series like <i>Percy Jackson</i> is only a best-seller that adults don't jizz themselves over? Having read two of the <i>PJ</i> and <i>HP</i>, I decided I needed to investigate this a little more. It didn't hurt that I was bored last weekend and watched the second <i>Harry Potter</i> movie and found myself enjoying it and actually watched it all in one sitting, something I haven't done for a movie in months. <br /><br />Ok. Going into <i>HP3</i> I was skeptical. I found the <i>PJ</i>'s first two novels if not better than more interesting. They were about Greek mythology, and while silly at times they were a pretty fun take on all of the creatures and God's met in <i>The Odyssey</i>. I'll take stories involving Athena and Gorgons over Dumbledore and Voldemort any day. <br /><br />Strangely I was wrong about <i>Harry Potter</i>. I hate to admit when my prejudices are wrong, but apparently I am not infallible. While I still stand behind my judgment of books one and two being fairly fun but predictable and too episodic for my taste, book three seemed to move drastically beyond the almost cookie-cutter quality of Rowling's first two forays, and created a very full world that had enough depth to the characters and actions that I stopped feeling like I was being dragged along by the nose through an unengaging text. I don't know what to really say, except I really ended up enjoying it, enough so that I looked forward to starting book 4 (which I have started but have to say isn't living up to this book so far). <br /><br />When I was shamefully buying this book a cashier told me that this was her favorite in the series. Someone else stopped to tell me while I sat on the stoop behind work that it was their favorite too. I'm wondering if this is the pinnacle of the series, and that after this it just becomes a need to keep on reading, hoping that the heights of book 3 will be reached again, and feeling compelled to finish a series that one could feel very invested in. I don't know. <br /><br />As a side note, I had the thought that while I made fun of adults who loudly proclaimed their love for the HP books, especially around the time when the fourth one came out (this was the moment the little nerdling entered on to my myopic cultural radar, and I had my initial disgust at reading newspaper articles with adults saying they love the books and they aren't kids books, blah blah blah), I kind of get what they are saying. I don't agree with them, I don't think it's the greatest thing ever written, and I have lots of books I liked more than this one, but for a person who reads shitty books and lives on a diet of Grisham and Patterson with some other easy to digest cookie cutter adult novelists thrown in, this book would read like literature. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"18081434607402199273\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/36812736-fatima-havilliard?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a href=\"/review/list/36812736-fatima-havilliard?shelf=awesome-world-building\">awesome-world-building</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1385042488\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16639132346450450144\"><b> <i>U+201CI don't go looking for trouble. Trouble usually finds me.U+201D </i> </b> <br><br>Why the hell I don't read this series soon? <br><br>The third book of Harry Potter as usual start in summer vacations, Harry needs to live with his annoying and muggle uncles and, if it wasn't enough, his Aunt Mage go to spend a week in the Dursley's house, which causes an altercation and Harry runs away from home. Also, a serial killer has escaped from Azkaban.<br><br>For now, this is my favorite of the series. I love that this book doesn't focus i</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16639132346450450144\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <i>U+201CI don't go looking for trouble. Trouble usually finds me.U+201D </i>\n</b> <br><br>Why the hell I don't read this series soon? <br><br>The third book of Harry Potter as usual start in summer vacations, Harry needs to live with his annoying and muggle uncles and, if it wasn't enough, his Aunt Mage go to spend a week in the Dursley's house, which causes an altercation and Harry runs away from home. Also, a serial killer has escaped from Azkaban.<br><br>For now, this is my favorite of the series. I love that this book doesn't focus in Voldemort, and explores more about James Friends: Sirius, Remus and Petter. I have a love-hate relationship with some characters like Draco, Snape and (please don't kill me) Hermione. <br><br>J.K Rowling became one of my favorite authors, her writing style is simply perfect. And yes, probably I don't grow with the characters like some of you but, I think that whoever you are: child, teenager or adult, these books will be part of your life forever and teach you many lessons of life. That's the magic of Harry Potter. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1456545584ra/18247890.gif\" width=\"550\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I love the Marauders, I think Sirius and Remus are my favorite characters with Fred and George. (Please don't die!!) <br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1456546036i/18247922.gif\" width=\"550\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>And can we talk about the places? I just want to be in Hogwarts. I hope isn't later to receive my letter Lol. And Hogsmeade is just Incredible, I'm waiting to go to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter, enter to Honeydukes and eat until can no more. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1413778808ra/11561929.gif\" width=\"550\" height=\"250\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16639132346450450144\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1483806181\" />\n    <a title=\"Kaitlin\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/19126246-kaitlin\"><img alt=\"Kaitlin\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466422085p2/19126246.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1483806181?book_show_action=false\">Dec 30, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Kaitlin\" class=\"user\" name=\"Kaitlin\" href=\"/user/show/19126246-kaitlin\">Kaitlin</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780747573623\" href=\"/book/show/4256.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">Everyone</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1483806181\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11645834840248768262\">I finished this yesterday and I loved every page. There's so much more that you get out of these books on a reread and learning anything more about the wider wizarding world is always fascinating. This book definitely sets the tone for the later ones with a lot more dialogue and character-focus being introduced rather than just action and plot and I think it makes this story one of the most enjoyable ones. I also loved the mystery and fun, but the characters do truly make this storyline!<br /><br />As alway</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11645834840248768262\" style=\"display:none\">I finished this yesterday and I loved every page. There's so much more that you get out of these books on a reread and learning anything more about the wider wizarding world is always fascinating. This book definitely sets the tone for the later ones with a lot more dialogue and character-focus being introduced rather than just action and plot and I think it makes this story one of the most enjoyable ones. I also loved the mystery and fun, but the characters do truly make this storyline!<br /><br />As always another 5* read and I loved hearing about the Quidditch House Cup, the Firebolt and our exciting new Defense Against The Dark Arts teacher because they're all highlights for me :) And as always I would recommend these to any and everyone :D</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"11645834840248768262\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/869881276\" />\n    <a title=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder\"><img alt=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476896265p2/3048260.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/869881276?book_show_action=false\">Jun 04, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" class=\"user\" name=\"Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*\" href=\"/user/show/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder\">Erin U+2615 *Proud Book Hoarder*</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=a-own-book-form\">a-own-book-form</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=magic-powers\">magic-powers</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=part-of-series\">part-of-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=witches\">witches</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=monsters\">monsters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=shapeshifters\">shapeshifters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=s-king-recommends\">s-king-recommends</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=4-star\">4-star</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=movie-seen\">movie-seen</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=cover-love\">cover-love</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=ttiv\">ttiv</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3048260-erin-proud-book-hoarder?shelf=buddy-or-group-read\">buddy-or-group-read</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer869881276\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer17441146710521413678\"><br />4.5 stars<br /><br /><b>U+201CThe consequences of our actions are always so complicated, so diverse, that predicting the future is a very difficult business indeed.U+201D </b><br /><br />The strongest of the first three, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban opens the same way the others did - Poor Harry in the hideous house he's grown up in, but he doesn't stay there as long this time. He escapes in a moment of rebellion - yay! take that, horrible Dursleys! - gets picked up by this bizarre wizard bus I wish we'd have for convenienc</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText17441146710521413678\" style=\"display:none\"><br />4.5 stars<br /><br /><b>U+201CThe consequences of our actions are always so complicated, so diverse, that predicting the future is a very difficult business indeed.U+201D </b><br /><br />The strongest of the first three, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban opens the same way the others did - Poor Harry in the hideous house he's grown up in, but he doesn't stay there as long this time. He escapes in a moment of rebellion - yay! take that, horrible Dursleys! - gets picked up by this bizarre wizard bus I wish we'd have for convenience, and then finds that all is not as it was in the world of wizardry. A dangerous criminal has escapes the prisons, and people are all aflutter, worried not only about his eventual plans to release the dark lord, but of his more immediate plans to get revenge on Harry.<br /><br />By now the characters have taken their footing in my heart, so I was almost as happy as Harry to reunite with Ron and the Weasly clan, Hermione and her ambitions, Hagrid and his animal woes, and the majestic Hogwarts that sounds like perhaps the best school ever invented. There's much familiar ground to retread - that annoying bully Malfoy and his overriding father, Snape and his sinister schooling, new experiments that sound as dangerous as they do educational...but also some new issues arises, namely wondering when Black will show his face and what will happen when that showdown finally strikes.<br /><br />It's frustrating a little to not see more of Voldemort yet (so much build up and I'm already eager for appearance), but the book delves further into the history of 'that night' when Harry's parents were viciously slaughtered. It was written well into the form of the dementer's eliciting memories in Harry's psyche, and there's a twist in the story that shows there's more to the legends and stories than previously known. As usual, misconceptions and half-truths for crimes.<br /><br />I do have to say the wizarding world loses a brownie point from me because of the dementers. They're awesome villains, creepy inventions that serve the story well, but it disturbs me prisoners are constantly tortured by them. The magical world is certainly not to be respected for having that occur at their awful prison.<br /><br />As I've said before, you'd think it would get dull going with the kids to a classroom of all things, but it stays fascinating. The lessons this time are perhaps the best of the first three - especially with another new Dark Arts professor, who shows nifty tricks tricks to Harry. Finally he seems to be learning some interesting things. This new professor is a welcome addition to the book; he plays a lot into the story, being easy to get attached to.<br /><br />Familiar focuses are brought clearer, like the Willow Tree and Invisibility Cloak, but we also get new goodies like that amusing Map, deeper journey into Diagon Alley, and of course Hogsmeade and it's delightful shops. Dumbledore has always been awesome, but he's even better here while he stands up for Hagrid and actually listens to Harry and others with sanity and reasonable instead of hilarity and prejudice.<br /><br />It was frustrating at the end when there was so much time people struggled to convince of a truth; it's a pet peeve when a main character won't listen for a second, or if someone is trying to tell the truth but isn't believed. I end up wanting to slap people around over that, but it's a small annoyance in the midst of greatness. There's a surprise at the end that I didn't see coming in the form of fur (I had suspected one surprise, the other I didn't.) The rescue of a surprising hero was also well done and crafted by Rowling, who has proven herself to be incredibly inventive.<br /><br />The series continues strong, getting better with each installment.<br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"17441146710521413678\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n<div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_869881276' style='display: none'>\n<textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick=\"expand_comment_form_for('review', 869881276, true, '')\">Write a comment...</textarea>\n</div>\n\n  </td>\n</tr>\n\n      </div>\n\n  </div>\n\n  <div class=\"clear\"></div>\n</div>\n\n    </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_511034115\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/511034115\" />\n    <a title=\"Jon\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/9822645-jon\"><img alt=\"Jon\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1439348441p2/9822645.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/511034115?book_show_action=false\">May 25, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jon\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jon\" href=\"/user/show/9822645-jon\">Jon</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer511034115\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10976193989528030858\">To be honest, over the years I've been a bit of a book snob when it comes to the Harry Potter books. I appreciated the fact that my nephews and nieces loved the books and that they would buy and read them as soon as they came out. Anything that helps children learn to enjoy reading deserves special praise, but ME read "a kid's book"? It wasn't going to happen and I was especially annoyed when The Goblet of Fire won the premier sci-fi award, The Hugo Award, in 2001. However, I've watched all the</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10976193989528030858\" style=\"display:none\">To be honest, over the years I've been a bit of a book snob when it comes to the Harry Potter books. I appreciated the fact that my nephews and nieces loved the books and that they would buy and read them as soon as they came out. Anything that helps children learn to enjoy reading deserves special praise, but ME read \"a kid's book\"? It wasn't going to happen and I was especially annoyed when The Goblet of Fire won the premier sci-fi award, The Hugo Award, in 2001. However, I've watched all the movies with my daughter, who absolutely loved them, and finally felt curious enough to pick up a copy of the 1st book and give it a try. I surprised myself by liking it.<br /><br />I enjoyed this book also. Rowling may not have the most elegant of prose styles, but she has a wealth of imagination and the ability to write a carefully plotted story with some well drawn characters in it. There's a nice mix of the magical and the mundane throughout the book. There are invisability cloaks and magical maps, but there are also essays to write, bullies and intimidating teachers to endure, and final exams to survive that help give children (and those of us who remember being children) things we can relate to.<br /><br />Events in this book also take a decidely darker and more adult turn as the story progresses and it does a good job of adding emotional depth to the back story. So I'm happy to admit that I made a mistake with this series and should have lined up at the book store with my nephew and nieces each time one of these books was published.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10976193989528030858\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review511034115\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right \n\n<div id=\"review_38425387\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/38425387\" />\n    <a title=\"Jason Koivu\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1742824-jason-koivu\"><img alt=\"Jason Koivu\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464843865p2/1742824.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/38425387?book_show_action=false\">Nov 12, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Jason Koivu\" class=\"user\" name=\"Jason Koivu\" href=\"/user/show/1742824-jason-koivu\">Jason Koivu</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1742824-jason-koivu?shelf=fiction\">fiction</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1742824-jason-koivu?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer38425387\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer2437299770893664362\">Shit got real!<br /><br />For me, <i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i> was when the series got exciting! It certainly got darker and more mature. Torture, loss, a foreboding sense of dread and death itself descended upon this happy little world of magic where school exams and difficult professors were the worst things to worry about until recently. <br /><br />I'm a big fan of the tone. The series jumps right into its bigboy pants here. As an adult reading these books, I was glad to see the maturity. Yeah, it's sti</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2437299770893664362\" style=\"display:none\">Shit got real!<br /><br />For me, <i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i> was when the series got exciting! It certainly got darker and more mature. Torture, loss, a foreboding sense of dread and death itself descended upon this happy little world of magic where school exams and difficult professors were the worst things to worry about until recently. <br /><br />I'm a big fan of the tone. The series jumps right into its bigboy pants here. As an adult reading these books, I was glad to see the maturity. Yeah, it's still YA and not targeted towards me, but at least now it felt a little closer to something in my old man range. <br /><br />As mentioned before, there's an ever present element of death in <i>The Prisoner of Azkaban</i>. Those ghoulish dementors are death itself. However, it also introduced a reason for Harry to want to live: his godfather, a connection to his parents. Up until then there was little joy in Harry's life. Sure there was the school, but that would end soon enough. Rowling did a smart thing when she introduced Sirius Black, she gave Harry a human bond and something to lose. As readers our attachment grew with his. That was when Harry became real to me. <br /><br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"2437299770893664362\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n href=\"/review/list/6511257-sue-hollywood-news-source?shelf=middle-grade\">middle-grade</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1276758738\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16189561410099950349\"><i>I cried tears.</i> <b>THEORY DISPROVEN: I'm not heartless.</b><br /><br />Like I always say I gravitate towards books that highlight familial aspect and lonely characters. <br /><br />What always struck me about Harry Potter is that he grew up in a toxic and abusive environment. He was an orphan. And he had no one. but then he met Ron, Hermione and the Weasleys, who showed him that blood ties isn't the only means of family. Love, bond and loyalty do. And that's the most beautiful thing about this whole series. </span>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1276758738\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1276758738\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1276758738\" ref=\"like\" </div>\n  </div>\n    <div class=\"elementListBrownSeparator\"></div>\n\n\n\n  <div class=\"friendReviews elementListBrown\" >\n    <div class=\"section\">\n      \n\n<div id=\"review_854590643\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/854590643\" />\n    <a title=\"Vane J.\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/19590155-vane-j\"><img alt=\"Vane J.\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468102148p2/19590155.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/854590643?book_show_action=false\">Dec 23, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Vane J.\" class=\"user\" name=\"Vane J.\" href=\"/user/show/19590155-vane-j\">Vane J.</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=amazing-characters\">amazing-characters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=2012\">2012</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=speshul-snowflake\">speshul-snowflake</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/19590155-vane-j?shelf=all-the-feels\">all-the-feels</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer854590643\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer7629078556423545489\"><a href=\"https://bookswithchemistry.wordpress.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\"> <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1433653616i/15127136._SX540_.png\" width=\"350\" height=\"117\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><br>For this review, I decided to make a list of the top ten things I realised in my first and definitely not last re-read of <i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i>. Without further ado, here they are:<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1450845691i/17476800._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>1. Our little Harry Potter has grown up!</b> I still remember how <i>innocent</i> he was in book 1. He still has some of it left, but I know for sure he would <i>never</i> rise his voice to his uncles in the previous books, and in this one he's capable of defying them!<br><br><b>2. I love Hagrid.</b> Not in a I-want-to-marry-him wa</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText7629078556423545489\" style=\"display:none\"><a href=\"https://bookswithchemistry.wordpress.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">\n  <img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1433653616i/15127136._SX540_.png\" width=\"350\" height=\"117\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"></a><br><br>For this review, I decided to make a list of the top ten things I realised in my first and definitely not last re-read of <i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i>. Without further ado, here they are:<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1450845691i/17476800._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>1. Our little Harry Potter has grown up!</b> I still remember how <i>innocent</i> he was in book 1. He still has some of it left, but I know for sure he would <i>never</i> rise his voice to his uncles in the previous books, and in this one he's capable of defying them!<br><br><b>2. I love Hagrid.</b> Not in a I-want-to-marry-him way, but in the same way you love your grandfather. Whenever he appears, I just want to hug him! And his love for his weird creatures is just so cute! Gah!<br><br><b>3. Remus Lupin is my newest book crush.</b> This man is fantastic. I mean it. I love every bit of him. He's a great DADA teacher (the best one IMO), is brave and intelligent. He's not perfect, but that only makes him better. I could build an altar to him.<br><br><b>4. Hermione Granger is a goddess.</b> I'm not saying she's my favourite character, but I just <i>love</i> that she takes so seriously her study, and that she puts lots of effort in it. I'm a little like her in what my studies are concerned, so there's another reason why I liked her so much.<br><br><b>5. Severus Snape... I have confused feelings about him.</b> I don't hate him, but I don't love him either. I do admire his expertise in Potions. God, it's fantastic! I just <i>love</i> the fact that there's a character who is good at Chemistry (which we know is basically what Potions is). The sad part is that Snape is so <i>horrible and unfair</i> towards some students, and that annoys me. Oh well, we shall see.<br><br><b>6. I want a Time-Turner so I can study and read at the same time.</b> It could be useful for other things, but imagine if I could do both of those things without compromising my grades! Too good to be true, actually.<br><br><b>7. </b><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<b>I feel terribly bad for Sirius Black.</b> Locked in Azkaban (possibly the worst prison in existence) during 12 years... and worse even, he was innocent. It makes me even more sad that his only hope for finally getting free (handing Pettigrew) turned out to be shallow because the man escaped. Sigh. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br><b>8. </b><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<b>I <i>despise</i> Peter Pettigrew.</b> Seriously, he makes me sick. That sorry excuse of a man is the biggest coward I've ever met in books, and I just <i>hate</i> cowardice... and I hate betrayal even more. Oh, damn him! Please rot in Hell, Wormtail. Or if there's something worse than Hell, let that be your place. <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br><b>9. I love Fred and George and the Marauder's Map and mischief managed!</b> They're just so funny, and the map is so useful and you have to admit the words you have to say to make it work are the best thing.<br><br><b>10. <i>Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</i> is the first book in the HP series that truly deserves the five stars.</b> Yeah, I gave books 1 and 2 the same rating as this one, but <i>this</i> is the one that screams five starts from beginning to end. It's more mature than the previous one, the plot is better, charcters are more developed, etc. I think this was the book that settled my love for HP. I wasn't sure I loved it before this re-read, but now? I've got no doubt.<br><br>So there you have my 10 things. Now I'll continue my re-read with <i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i>. I'm getting to darker paths. I might need help after I finish the rest of the books. is the one that screams five starts from beginning to end. It</[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"7629078556423545489\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review854590643\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link854590643\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=854590643&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_854590643'><a id=\"like_count_review_854590643\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/854590643?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">22 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_854590643\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_854590643\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=22&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=854590643&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_854590643\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 854590643, true, ''); data-remote=\\\"true\\\">2 stars <span class=\\\"greyText\\\">(19487)<\\/span><\\/a><span class=\\\"loadingAnimation\\\"><\\/span><span class=\\\"loadingError\\\"><\\/span><\\/span>\\n Lemay\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay\"><img alt=\"Raeleen Lemay\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475215415p2/3452652.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/108852877?book_show_action=false\">Feb 27, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Raeleen Lemay\" class=\"user\" name=\"Raeleen Lemay\" href=\"/user/show/3452652-raeleen-lemay\">Raeleen Lemay</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/3452652-raeleen-lemay?shelf=own\">own</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer108852877\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10344586632732974668\"><i>re-read in February 2016</i><br />Harry is getting his sass on. I love it. <br /><br /><i>Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas to You</i><br /><br />OH MAN. THIS BOOK IS SO MY FAVORITE.<br /><br />The phone conversation at the beginning between Ron and Uncle Vernon was PRICELESS. I wish so much that that scene had been in the movie.<br /><br />I was so into reading this book that I failed to take notes, so I don't have many specifics to add except that I love how Crookshanks was basically Sirius's secret agent spy cat friend and I LOVE THAT.<br /><br />Also, this</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10344586632732974668\" style=\"display:none\"><i>re-read in February 2016</i><br />Harry is getting his sass on. I love it. <br /><br /><i>Re-Read in December 2014 for Harry Christmas to You</i><br /><br />OH MAN. THIS BOOK IS SO MY FAVORITE.<br /><br />The phone conversation at the beginning between Ron and Uncle Vernon was PRICELESS. I wish so much that that scene had been in the movie.<br /><br />I was so into reading this book that I failed to take notes, so I don't have many specifics to add except that I love how Crookshanks was basically Sirius's secret agent spy cat friend and I LOVE THAT.<br /><br />Also, this book demonstrated some very REAL aspects of school. For example, Hermione took on too much work, and she gradually started to go crazy (and consequently distanced herself from her friends, became more moody, and then finally just bitch-slapped Malfoy). I also found Oliver Wood to be hilarious in this book for similar reasons: this was his last year at Hogwarts, and he wanted nothing more than to win the Quidditch Cup so he could have some sort of glory at Hogwarts, and he became so consumed by it (as I'm sure lots of people on sports teams do). The way he was so emotionally invested really cracked me up but also felt so real. <br /><br />Side note: CEDRIC IS SO DAMN NICE. when he realized that Harry fell off his broom during the Quidditch game and Hufflepuff won he called for a rematch, which says a lot about him, and it just makes what happens in the next book that much worse.<br /><br />But of course, all of the Marauders stuff made my inner fangirl go nuts because it has to be my favorite Harry Potter storyline. (I mean, I didn't name my YouTube channel after them or anything...)<br /><br />Also time travel.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10344586632732974668\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id='comments_for_review_108852877' style='display: none;'>\n<div class='brown_comment'>\n<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a class=\"loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\"
