<div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/50405799-sofii?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1727710741\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer2257323995312954486\"><br><i> <b> <blockquote>U+201CYou think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?U+201D</blockquote> </b> </i> <br><br><br>This has been <u>INCREDIBLE </u>!<br><br><br><u>This is a of those books that is so well written that just want to read it again</u>, I've enjoyed it alot, but I also had some problems when trying to get involved myself with the plot, and even seems a bit tedious in parts , but half onwards goes gradually improving.<br><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1453090623ra/17779775.gif\" width=\"500\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><br>.<u><b>The way Harry rebels against his uncles seemed to me wonderful, I thought , F</b></u></span>\n  <span id=\"freeText2257323995312954486\" style=\"display:none\"><br><i>\n  <b>\n    <blockquote>U+201CYou think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?U+201D</blockquote>\n  </b>\n</i> <br><br><br>This has been <u>INCREDIBLE </u>!<br><br><br><u>This is a of those books that is so well written that just want to read it again</u>, I've enjoyed it alot, but I also had some problems when trying to get involved myself with the plot, and even seems a bit tedious in parts , but half onwards goes gradually improving.<br><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1453090623ra/17779775.gif\" width=\"500\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><br>.<u><b>The way Harry rebels against his uncles seemed to me wonderful, I thought , FINALLY !. </b>It's exciting to see our Harry grow that way and face the consequences of his actions, but guys, what could be worse than the Dursleys? !</u><br><br><br><i>\n  <b>\n    <blockquote>U+201CI solemnly swear that I am up to no good.U+201D</blockquote>\n  </b>\n</i> <br><br><br><u>I've loved the dementers</u>, I think they are a great addition to the plot , I don't know if they reappear later or not, but they have brought a creepy touch to the story. I believe, that like these new villains, like any dark force that attacks Harry manages to make the best of him, I mean ,in terms of magic , those moments where shows his power and his courage, are thanks to this kind of villains who are amazing and are very well described.<br><br><br><br>At first I was somewhat irritated by the absurd fights between Hermione and Ron, I was so angry with them !. I haven't stopped love them, I couldn't , but guys, really?.<br><u>On the other hand <b>I really liked Hermione's rol in this book</b>, she revealing her secret, helping Harry and everything they spend together, I think their friendship has grown even more<br>In fact my favorite chapters of books are about they.</u><br><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472178115ra/20162057.gif\" width=\"500\" height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><br><u>The revelations in this book are incredible, everything about Sirius Black and Lupin left me shocked, I did not expect anything like that and I loved it !.</u><br>one of the things I enjoy the most, is to know more about Harry's parents and how has been the past in Hogwarts!<br><br><br><i>\n  <b>\n    <blockquote>U+201CHappiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.U+201D</blockquote>\n  </b>\n</i> <br><br><br>I'm like I said before excited to continue the saga soon, is a, magical incredible story with solid characters and a stunning world, never ceases to amaze me! : D.<br><br><u>\n  <i>I want to know more about the secrets that this history hidden , I have the feeling that there are many more to discover.</i>\n</u><br><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467094006ra/19550484.gif\" width='500\"' height=\"200\" alt=\"description\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br></span>\n  <a itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/542175849\" />\n    <a title=\"Rachel Reads Ravenously\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously\"><img alt=\"Rachel Reads Ravenously\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476518708p2/14514998.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/542175849?book_show_action=false\">Sep 02, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Rachel Reads Ravenously\" class=\"user\" name=\"Rachel Reads Ravenously\" href=\"/user/show/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously\">Rachel Reads Ravenously</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439136358\" href=\"/book/show/49116.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=witches\">witches</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=werewolves-shapeshifters\">werewolves-shapeshifters</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=ya-fantasy\">ya-fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=magic\">magic</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=june-2015\">june-2015</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/14514998-rachel-reads-ravenously?shelf=hardcover\">hardcover</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer542175849\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1574560192834508640\"><b> 5 Expecto Patronum stars! </b><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434732912ra/15257141.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I grew up with Harry Potter. Yes, I am that generation. I was a little bit younger than 11 when the books were released, and when the final book was published I had just graduated high school. I'm also the same age as Daniel Radcliffe and he's only older than me by less than a month. I also have a deathly hallows bumper sticker on my car. So, I think it's safe to say that this series has had a profound effect on me, to the point where I am still a little bit bitter tha</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1574560192834508640\" style=\"display:none\"><b> 5 Expecto Patronum stars! </b><br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434732912ra/15257141.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>I grew up with Harry Potter. Yes, I am that generation. I was a little bit younger than 11 when the books were released, and when the final book was published I had just graduated high school. I'm also the same age as Daniel Radcliffe and he's only older than me by less than a month. I also have a deathly hallows bumper sticker on my car. So, I think it's safe to say that this series has had a profound effect on me, to the point where I am still a little bit bitter that I never got my Hogwarts acceptance letter.<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434732912ra/15257142.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>A couple years ago I reread the first two books in the series and loved them just as much as when I was a kid. So when I got into a horrible reading slump, I saw my dad watching Harry Potter weekend on ABC Family (as he does for every fucking Harry Potter weekend mind you), I said to myself, what the hell. Time for a reread. So hence, Harry Potter 3 reread. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434732912ra/15257143.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>All of us may know the story but I am going to reiterate. In his third year at Hogwarts, Harry Potter learns that a dangerous man named Sirius Black has escaped from the wizard prison Azkaban. Harry then overhears the fact that Black is the reason his parents are dead, as Black sold them out to Voldemort and then killed 13 people in broad daylight. <br><br><b> So in a unique part of the review from me, here are all the amazing parts of this book that I forgot because I've been watching the movies instead: </b><br><br><b>-Peeves the Poltergeist:</b> Holy crap how did I forget about this hilarious menacing spirit? He's not as present in this book but he has always had a part in the series and I completely forgot he existed! I know they can't include everything in the movies but I wish Peeves had been included.<br><br><b>-Charlie Weasley:</b> Ron had yet ANOTHER sibling that is only mentioned in the films! This one is the cool brother in Egypt.<br><br><b>-Cho Chang and Cedric Diggory:</b> there are soooooo many mentions of Cho and Cedric in this book! I never really noticed Cedric until the 4th book where he becomes prominent. And this is the book where Harry's crush on Cho began. Stomach flutters!<br><br><b>-More details on Whomping Willow/Shrieking Shack:</b> This may be a spoiler for those of you who haven't read it, but the Whomping Willow was actually planted to hide Lupin's werewolfism as well as the shrieking shack to hide him. I thought this little tidbit was super interesting, along with the details of how Black escaped Azkaban. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434732912ra/15257144.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>And just in general, I love JK Rowling's ability to tie things together. There's so much in this book that becomes important later and tiny little details and sharp wit that make me giggle. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434732912ra/15257145.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>So in a small factoid, this book is probably my least favorite of the entire series. It's good, obviously, but for some reason I like all the other ones better. The movie, well it's my second to last favorite (just ahead of that godawful Goblet of Fire film which ruined everything but I digress). The movie director added so many unnecessary things that weren't in the book, and I wish he hadn't so he could of kept the good stuff! (And I've heard a rumor that he didn't even read the fucking book until JK kept vetoing all of his weird ideas. Look it up!)<br><br>If you haven't read these books, do not tell me!!!!! I will smack you!<br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1434732912ra/15257146.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1574560192834508640\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review542175849\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link542175849\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=542175849&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_542175849'><a id=\"like_count_review_542175849\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/542175849?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">63 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_542175849\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_542175849\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=63&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=542175849&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_542175849\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 542175849, true, ''); imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/30710594-luke-taylor\"><img alt=\"Luke Taylor\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476826671p2/30710594.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1739320418?book_show_action=false\">Sep 06, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Luke Taylor\" class=\"user\" name=\"Luke Taylor\" href=\"/user/show/30710594-luke-taylor\">Luke Taylor</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1739320418\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer804665726383998899\">So what is Harry Potter and The Prisoner of Azkaban?<br /><br />Well, let me ask you this. What is a Hippogriff?<br /><br />Hippogriffs are magical animals described as <i>Half horse, half eagle creatures, immensely proud and extremely dangerous.</i><br /><br />And, conveniently so, such is my metaphor for this book.<br /><br />Longer than the last two, and for good reason, Prisoner of Azkaban simmers with a heightened sense of maturity from the very first word, and throughout the book, Harry is peppered with other's view of his father, pelted and b</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText804665726383998899\" style=\"display:none\">So what is Harry Potter and The Prisoner of Azkaban?<br /><br />Well, let me ask you this. What is a Hippogriff?<br /><br />Hippogriffs are magical animals described as <i>Half horse, half eagle creatures, immensely proud and extremely dangerous.</i><br /><br />And, conveniently so, such is my metaphor for this book.<br /><br />Longer than the last two, and for good reason, Prisoner of Azkaban simmers with a heightened sense of maturity from the very first word, and throughout the book, Harry is peppered with other's view of his father, pelted and bombarded with <i>their</i> words concerning <i>his own</i> flesh and blood, whom he sadly can't remember, though he does look incredibly like. Thus, Prisoner of Azkaban carries a hefty helping of something so terribly thrilling, it nearly pains me to think that too many adults view these as children's books, because Jo dove headfirst into the Gringotts vault and crafted, what? A SPY THRILLER???<br /><br />Hah! <i>Expecto Patronum!</i><br /><br />Hitchockian to the last word, Jo uses her mastery of psychology to create a false villain in Sirius Black, deepening the story to masterful levels with her careful use of incredibly dangerous ingredients, such as the Marauder's Map and the Time Turner. With her weaving of even more unpredictable elements like Animagi and Snape's jealousy, Prisoner of Azkaban suddenly begins to bubble over, like an experiment gone wrong, exploding with too many wild ingredients.<br /><br />Or not.<br /><br />This Hippogriff of a book doesn't die under the burden of being misunderstoodU+2026this Hippogriff takes to the sky, spreads its wings, and flies.<br /><br />Because at the foundation of all the wild, wacky, and fun, lies the deeply disturbing, the dangerous, the dementing, dark and deadly details undergirding the perfectly planned acceleration of magical mystery to spy thriller. Double-crosses and old secrets, misunderstood wizards and life-changing choices on full display under the waxy silver light of a full moon, who is it that saves the day?<br /><br /><i>Expecto Patronum!</i><br /><br />That's right. Just look at that cover. Because this book is about perception and reality, and about the destiny of realizing what is true within and letting it out.<br /><br />Dementors be damned, this book is Siriusly amazing.<br /><br />Recommended for everyone.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"804665726383998899\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1739320418\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1739320418\" title=\"Flag this review as inappropriate.\" href=\"/flagged/new?resource_id=1739320418&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/5.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">flag</a>\n\n\n\n\n\n      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1739320418'><a id=\"like_count_review_1739320418\" rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"/rating/voters/1739320418?resource_type=Review\"><span class=\"likesCount\">60 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class=\"loadingLinkSpan\"><a id=\"like_action_review_1739320418\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-like-container-id=\"like_container_review_1739320418\" ref=\"like\" class=\"jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink\" data-remote=\"true\" data-method=\"post\" href=\"/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=60&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1739320418&rating[resource_type]=Review\">Like</a><span class=\"loadingAnimation\"></span><span class=\"loadingError\"></span></span></span>\nU+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id=\"commentLink_1739320418\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"comment_form_for('review', 1739320418, true, ''); imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/9340136-evgeny\"><img alt=\"Evgeny\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1349810697p2/9340136.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/381016592?book_show_action=false\">Feb 02, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Evgeny\" class=\"user\" name=\"Evgeny\" href=\"/user/show/9340136-evgeny\">Evgeny</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408810569\" href=\"/book/show/8723737-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9340136-evgeny?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer381016592\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5261802662442642153\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453316547i/17811996._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"340\" height=\"220\" alt=\"Monster Book of Monsters\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Harry Potter is in his third year of Hogwarts School of Wizardry. His studies at the school are never boring so this time an escaped evil wizard whose sole remaining purpose in life seems to be pay back Harry for Lord Voldemort's humiliation stirs quite an excitement. <br><br>Let us stop here for a second because I want to ask myself a following question. Why do I even bother with the plot descriptions? Is it possible to find a modern educated person with even passing interest in literature who never re</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5261802662442642153\" style=\"display:none\"><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453316547i/17811996._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"340\" height=\"220\" alt=\"Monster Book of Monsters\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Harry Potter is in his third year of Hogwarts School of Wizardry. His studies at the school are never boring so this time an escaped evil wizard whose sole remaining purpose in life seems to be pay back Harry for Lord Voldemort's humiliation stirs quite an excitement. <br><br>Let us stop here for a second because I want to ask myself a following question. Why do I even bother with the plot descriptions? Is it possible to find a modern educated person with even passing interest in literature who never read the books and never saw the movies? However I already wrote the previous paragraph, so I am not going to erase it.<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453316234i/17811958._SX540_.jpg\" width=\"340\" height=\"280\" alt=\"Harry Potter\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>This is the first book of the series which made me realize that we are not in Kansas anymore - to quote another children classic (yes, I call Harry Potter a children classic series). This is the place where the series leave comfortable and fluffy status of simple children books and slowly crosses in to an adult territory. I would call it young adult, but the modern understanding of the term demands a presence of heartbreaking romance and Harry Potter does not fit. To make a long story short do not expect a happy ending here, but do expect some quite dark moments.<br><br>I thought about reducing the otherwise perfect rating by one star because of some minor inconsistencies and the whole Time Turner thingy. I would not call the latter Deux Ex Machina as it did not come up from nowhere, but it was way too convenient for the final resolution for me. The fact that it completely disappears from the series never again to be heard about does not help any. Still this was not big enough annoyance for the lower rating, so the 5 stars remain. <br><br>So the book is very much worth reading - as if I need to say it. I had exactly the same amount of fun rereading the book as I had during my first read; knowing what would happen next had not diminish my enjoyment any. </span>\n  <a </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1758278065\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11778311574019082270\">En los primeros capU+00EDtulos la lectura iba cuesta arriba, no porque no fuera un libro fabuloso, sino debido a que esta entrega se corresponde con la pelU+0EDCula de la serie que mU+00E1s me ha gustado y mU+00E1s veces he visto. Por esto y porque sobre todo al principio la adaptaciU+00F3n cinematogrU+0E1Fica ha sido bastante fiel, me era imposible no asociar cada pU+00E1gina con alguna escena y saber de antemano con tanta certeza lo que ocurrirU+0EDA... me estaba desmotivando.<br /><br />Sin embargo, a poco andar, la pluma de J.K. Rowling me</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11778311574019082270\" style=\"display:none\">En los primeros capU+00EDtulos la lectura iba cuesta arriba, no porque no fuera un libro fabuloso, sino debido a que esta entrega se corresponde con la pelU+0EDCula de la serie que mU+00E1s me ha gustado y mU+00E1s veces he visto. Por esto y porque sobre todo al principio la adaptaciU+00F3n cinematogrU+0E1Fica ha sido bastante fiel, me era imposible no asociar cada pU+00E1gina con alguna escena y saber de antemano con tanta certeza lo que ocurrirU+0EDA... me estaba desmotivando.<br /><br />Sin embargo, a poco andar, la pluma de J.K. Rowling me cautivU+00F3 por completo y avanzaba cada pU+00E1gina con un disfrute total. Cada vez me impresiona mU+00E1s la imaginaciU+00F3n de la autora para crear una trama tan ingeniosa y original, combinada con una narrativa tan cuidada.<br /><br />Muy bueno!<br /></span>\n  <a stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer794900318\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16126518909417650402\"><b> <blockquote>U+201CI solemnly swear that I am up to no good.U+201D</blockquote> </b><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1421858468i/13422530._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Wasn't this epic. Didn't this stun you into silence after reading it.<br><br>These are rhetorical. So, don't bother answering because I already know what you'll say. You'll agree with me that this is by far the best Harry Potter novel, and I'll add that I just couldn't put it down, nor did I want to.<br><br>This was great, this was stunning, this was grand. I loved it so much. This was a tad bit scary too, considering the previous two novels. I think Harry is growing</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16126518909417650402\" style=\"display:none\"><b>\n  <blockquote>U+201CI solemnly swear that I am up to no good.U+201D</blockquote>\n</b><br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1421858468i/13422530._SX540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Wasn't this epic. Didn't this stun you into silence after reading it.<br><br>These are rhetorical. So, don't bother answering because I already know what you'll say. You'll agree with me that this is by far the best Harry Potter novel, and I'll add that I just couldn't put it down, nor did I want to.<br><br>This was great, this was stunning, this was grand. I loved it so much. This was a tad bit scary too, considering the previous two novels. I think Harry is growing up, so do Ron & Hermione. Our little heroes are no longer babies, they are growing up fast and I am gladly keeping up with them.<br><br>Is there any other way to say that I loved what J. K. Rowling did with Wormtail, I loved how it was all a big twist. I loved how things were so unpredictable and you didn't know what to get ready for next.<br><br>This was thrilling and exhilarating. I was just reading and reading and reading like a junkie addicted to their drug, that was my brand of heroine for sure..<br><br>I loved Sirius and I loved Remus. I loved everything about this. I love the relationship between Harry, Ron & Hermione. They all fit together, they need no one else. It's just them three and it's enough because they know that they'll always have together, and no matter what they'll stick together because that's what friends are for. And being different people, having diffent personalities doesn't bring us apart, it brings people together. It makes the friendship more interesting, more unpredictable. <br><br><b>\n  <blockquote>U+201CMischief managed.U+201D</blockquote>\n</b></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16126518909417650402\" href=\"#\"      <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=reviewed\">reviewed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\"  <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/40792319-councillor?shelf=friendship\">friendship</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1471598035\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer4847197984580503660\">Is there any way to write a review on any of the Harry Potter books without doing it injustice? Nearly nobody attempts to create a full review on this series because of 1) its popularity, 2) its huge fanbase and 3) its awesomeness in general. And neither will I do so. The first book was fantastic, although I read it probably ten years too late in my life. The second book was not so fantastic, but still a great book. And the third one ... completely blew my mind.<br /><br />I wanted to write a review on this</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText4847197984580503660\" style=\"display:none\">Is there any way to write a review on any of the Harry Potter books without doing it injustice? Nearly nobody attempts to create a full review on this series because of 1) its popularity, 2) its huge fanbase and 3) its awesomeness in general. And neither will I do so. The first book was fantastic, although I read it probably ten years too late in my life. The second book was not so fantastic, but still a great book. And the third one ... completely blew my mind.<br /><br />I wanted to write a review on this book; I even started a checklist to keep track of what I wanted to add here. But the further I delved into the stories about the Prisoner of Azkaban, the more did I realize that the only things I was going to say were 'X is awesome', 'Y rocks' and 'Z simply <i>has</i> to be the winner'. The only aspect which might be criticized about this book might be the fact that some characters like Voldemort, Malfoy or, on the other hand, Harry, Hermione or Ron are relatively black or white, evil or good. But I don't mind. Because. Those. Characters. Are. Amazing. Hagrid and Lupin are my new favorites after reading this book. <i>And I want more of Hedwig, because - owls!</i><br /><br />In contrast to the two previous books, the pace is so wonderfully matching in this book. Just at the right time before the descriptions of the Hogwarts school year (all of them contributing to the entire plot) might turn too extensive, the story climbs up to its climax and concludes within one hundred pages of incredible tension. Logical relevations, long-desired confrontations and a <i>lot</i> of surprises will accompany you during your journey with Harry and his friends, resulting in the convergence of several different plotlines which were established during the course of the novel.<br /><br />Most of the people I know have read this book, but if you happen to be one of the few exceptions, then <u>go read it.</u> Maybe you fear it because of its fantasy elements? I've never been a fan of fantasy either, but this book series changed my opinion. Maybe you fear it because of its popularity? Don't be afraid. <b>The hype is completely justified.</b><br /><br /><br /><b>My reviews in the Harry Potter series:</b><br /><br />1) <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3.Harry_Potter_and_the_Sorcerer_s_Stone__Harry_Potter___1_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (Harry Potter, #1) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone</a>: <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1316706192?book_show_action=false\">Go to review</a><br />2) <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/15881.Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets__Harry_Potter__2_\" title=\"Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (Harry Potter #2) by J.K. Rowling\">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a>: <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1469645452?book_show_action=false\">Go to review</a></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"4847197984580503660\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/4845030-micheline\"><img alt=\"Micheline\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1434381852p2/4845030.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/156419696?book_show_action=false\">Aug 18, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Micheline\" class=\"user\" name=\"Micheline\" href=\"/user/show/4845030-micheline\">Micheline</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9780439136358\" href=\"/book/show/49116.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n          <div><span class=\"uitext greyText\">Recommends it for: </span>\n           <span class=\"uitext reviewText\">everyone</span></div>\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=multiple-reads\">multiple-reads</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=classics\">classics</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=magic-witches-wizards\">magic-witches-wizards</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=vampires-werewolves\">vampires-werewolves</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=hero-worship\">hero-worship</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=young-adult\">young-adult</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=epic\">epic</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/4845030-micheline?shelf=high-fantasy\">high-fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer156419696\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer9261414671249363050\"><b>Harry Potter & the Prisoner of Azkaban</b> has always been, in my opinion, one of the best books of the series. Even as far as the movies go, I feel that <b>PoA </b>is by far the best book to film adaptation out of all 8 movies. Yes Harry Potter and Ron and Hermione are still fairly young in the third book, but I find they have matured quite a bit this time around. They're officially in their teens, and they've already had their fair share of adventures. This time around however, Harry has more to worr</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText9261414671249363050\" style=\"display:none\"><b>Harry Potter & the Prisoner of Azkaban</b> has always been, in my opinion, one of the best books of the series. Even as far as the movies go, I feel that <b>PoA </b>is by far the best book to film adaptation out of all 8 movies. Yes Harry Potter and Ron and Hermione are still fairly young in the third book, but I find they have matured quite a bit this time around. They're officially in their teens, and they've already had their fair share of adventures. This time around however, Harry has more to worry about than just Voldemort (as if that wasn't already enough). Harry's Summer vacation at the Dursley's take a turn for the worse when Uncle Vernon's vile sister Marge comes to visit. She is completely horrible to Harry, and by comparison makes his Aunt & Uncle look almost human. After a disastrous visit ends abruptly (lol) Harry finds himself spending his last two weeks of Summer vacation in Diagon Alley. I always feel so happy about Harry being able to soak in his magical surroundings and do as he pleases...I mean how fun would it be to hang out in Diagon Alley?!<br /><br />The writing here is above reproach. I read somewhere that <i>J.K. Rowling</i> said that when she had finished writing <b>Half Blood Prince</b>, she hadn't been that satisfied with a book since <b>The Prisoner of Azkaban</b>, and I think it shows: this is <i>Rowling</i> at her best. There are so many new magical elements added in the mix this time : The Maurauder's Map, the discovery of the identity of the Maurauders themselves, the Dementors are absolute nightmares <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ I've always found it incredibly telling of Harry that his Boggart is NOT Voldemort, but a Dementor. Like Lupin says, Harry's worst fear, is fear itself. And Lupin is right; it is really brave U+2665  <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> , the Patronus charms are really cool, and always have me imagining what I think my own Patronus would be. I also really enjoy the visits the the wizarding village of Hogsmeade, the only all wizard settlement in London.<br /><br /><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ Now as for a few of the best elements of <b>Prisoner of Azkaban<b>: Remus Lupin & Sirius Black. Lupin is the first competent Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher we've ever been introduced to. But as a character, he's quite tragic but I just adore him. He's kind and capable and his bond with Harry is truly special. He happens to have the same birthday as me though and that's pretty cool :) And after reading the book thinking one thing about Sirius Black, finding out the truth is staggering, and wonderful all at once. Sirius is and always will be one of my favorite characters in the series and meeting him the way we do is a treat, even without the mystery involved the first time around. Also? The 30 minutes Harry believes he'll be able to move in with Sirius...*sigh* and have something close to a home...and a family. Again it's tragic but beautiful. </b></b> <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />As usual, the book ends with the requisite Dumbledore & Harry heart to heart. And Dumbledore always contributes a hint at a key plot element that will come to play again later on in the story. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ There will come a time when Harry is grateful he saved Pettigrew's life...  <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Upon rereading you really get to savour that expert foreshadowing. It's brilliant to see how it all fits together in the end...every little detail is woven into the plot for a reason. Not many authors can ever dream of accomplishing such a feat, but <i>J.K. Rowling</i> does it seamlessly.<br /><br /><b>The Prisoner of Azkaban</b> is one of my absolute favorite books in the world. From the very first sentence where Rowling re-introduces us to our beloved hero by telling us how strange he is, I was, and still am in love. I adore the tone, the new characters and how Harry and co. have obviously matured and grown so much already. The feels are strong for this one...U+2665</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"9261414671249363050\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Hardcover 9781408855911\" href=\"/book/show/22037424-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=favourites\">favourites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=owned-books\">owned-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\"        <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/33481873-chelsea?shelf=re-read\">re-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" id=\"reviewTextContainer1269178454\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer12131570201130236734\">Reread November 2015<br /><br />It took me over a month to read this, because I have been so busy with college. It definitely got in the way of my reading experience, but I loved POA nonetheless! It has been two or three years since I've read it and I forgot so much! <br /><br />My only complaint is that there were a lot of references to events in previous books. She explained Quidditch again, told us who Ron and Hermione are, what happened at the end of last school year... And to me, that wasn't necessary.<br /><br />There are so</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText12131570201130236734\" style=\"display:none\">Reread November 2015<br /><br />It took me over a month to read this, because I have been so busy with college. It definitely got in the way of my reading experience, but I loved POA nonetheless! It has been two or three years since I've read it and I forgot so much! <br /><br />My only complaint is that there were a lot of references to events in previous books. She explained Quidditch again, told us who Ron and Hermione are, what happened at the end of last school year... And to me, that wasn't necessary.<br /><br />There are some differences between the film and book (not as many as the later books/films though), but I don't really mind! The film is my absolute favourite, I like the changes they've made (expect for leaving out information about the Marauders) so I don't really know which one I actually prefer :) <br /><br />JK Rowling really needs to come out with a prequel ASAP! I love this book so much because of the Marauders, and I wish we knew more about them and their era. I think we can all agree that we'd prefer a prequel over a sequel, such as The Cursed Child. And yes, I know about Fantastic Beasts, but that's not really Potter related so that doesn't count ;) </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"12131570201130236734\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/168698174\" />\n    <a title=\"U+265BTash\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/5451856-tash\"><img alt=\"U+265BTash\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1456286012p2/5451856.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/168698174?book_show_action=false\">Dec 21, 2015</a>\n\n      <a title=\"U+265BTash\" class=\"user\" name=\"U+265BTash\" href=\"/user/show/5451856-tash\">U+265BTash</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer168698174\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11801627937095928286\">Re-read 2015 - 5 always magical stars<br><br>Let's not talk about how Sirius kept his sanity (most of it anyway) in Azkaban to avenge his id=\"reviewTextContainer1744011778\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15078343028043315297\">How do you even write a review of Harry Potter when you're one of the very few people in this muggle world who is reading it for the first time and just want to fangirl about it?! I have no idea why I waited so long to start this series, but I am going to rectify that and finish rest of the books this year! Also, I might be the only person who haven't been spoiled for this series. Which also includes movie because I've only watched first two :P So basically I am reading HP series for the first</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15078343028043315297\" style=\"display:none\">How do you even write a review of Harry Potter when you're one of the very few people in this muggle world who is reading it for the first time and just want to fangirl about it?! I have no idea why I waited so long to start this series, but I am going to rectify that and finish rest of the books this year! Also, I might be the only person who haven't been spoiled for this series. Which also includes movie because I've only watched first two :P So basically I am reading HP series for the first time. <br><br>I am obviously not going to write about what I loved in this book. Because, well, then I'll have to mention every scene of this book because it was that amazing! Instead, I am going to write about what I'll remember this series by.<br><b><br>Harry, Ron, and Hermione's friendship. </b><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472624176ra/20216351.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><i>Hagrid's love for animals/dragons. </i><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472624545ra/20216360.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>Villains.</b> <br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470710345ra/19955647.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><i><br>Dumbledore </i><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472625271ra/20216391.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><b>Draco Malfoy</b> <br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1472625271ra/20216392.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br>^^well, he deserved it ;P<br><br><i>Sirius black. <a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[ The plot twist at the end was really unexpected  <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br></i><br><b>Don't trust some animals in Hogwarts, you never know what they might turn into.<br></b><br><i>I love Weasleys. Every. one. of. them. <3<br></i><br><b>Owl posts are awesome, and so are owls!</b><br><br><i>Lastly, one of the memorable characters so far, Professor Lupin.<br></i><br><br>Off to start Goblet of Fire!</[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n I have so much Adulting to do,but these books.</span>\n\n    <br/>\n\n    <span class=\"xhrCommentFooter greyText\">\n      Dec 15, 2015 10:14AM\n    </span>\n\n  </div>\n  <div Hey don't look at me accusing loathsome eyes, I'm not a racist just Slytherin. I'm supposed to say mean things like that.<b><< Gotta keep the stereotype and all.</b> <br><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084653ra/18822166.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084654ra/18822167.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"> <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br> So lets talk about <b>HOW</b> your unassuming life will change if you read this magical series;<br><br>U+270F De-friending <s>not so</s> innocent bystanders announcing<b> \"<u>Harry Potter</u> is dumb\" </b>or <b>\"<u>Harry Potter</u> is for kids\"</b> will become a common occurrence. Ask any potterhead, it happens a lot of times.<br><br>U+270F What is your Hogwarts house will become your idea of small talk.<br><br>U+270F You'll start saying <u>Harry Potter</u> cliches like\"I'm still waiting for my Hogwart's letter\", (probably) make random curse references (accio remote) and maybe start saying things like she is such a fake <u>Harry Potter</u> fan when someone doesn't know that Owlpost is the first chapter of <u>Harry Potter</u> and the prisoner of Azkaban.<br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461086153i/18822492._SY540_.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>U+270F Umm you'll make a lot of new friends starting this way.<a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461083766i/18822012.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"> <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>U+270F or maybe kicked out of class for calling a teacher Muggle who will unfortunately understand the reference, get offended and ban you from his class. I bet he was a Gryfinndor.<br><br>U+270F You''ll probably have a shrine of a lot of <u>Harry Potter</u> goodies.<br><br>U+270F <b>Then try to convert the remaining unassuming people into <u>Harry Potter</u> fans. </b><br><br>U+270F Or become obsessive and say <u>Harry Potter</u> 50 times a day and get a award for reiteration.*thank you all*<br><br><br><b>P.S</b> RIP Alan Rickman. We'll always remember your always and oily hair.<br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461086006ra/18822467.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br><b>P.P.S</b> OOO and even if you hate Malfoy in the books you'll have a---Lets call it a crush,for want of a better word. ON HIM. (Really)<a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461083766ra/18822013.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"> <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>And I'm not kidding with the next spoiler. It's anything but fake.<br><a class=\"jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction\">(view spoiler)</a><span class=\"spoilerContainer\" style=\"display: none\">[<img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822080.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822081.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822082.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822083.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822084.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822085.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822086.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1461084267ra/18822087.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"> <a class=\"jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction\">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></[\"br\"]></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13362681631219723896\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; \n\n<div id=\"review_1117944488\" class=\"review\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1117944488\" />\n    <a title=\"Maxwell\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/1381728-maxwell\"><img alt=\"Maxwell\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474578952p2/1381728.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1117944488?book_show_action=false\">Nov 29, 2014</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Maxwell\" class=\"user\" name=\"Maxwell\" href=\"/user/show/1381728-maxwell\">Maxwell</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780545582933\" href=\"/book/show/17347383-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=i-own-it\">i-own-it</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/1381728-maxwell?shelf=2014\">2014</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1117944488\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer16508384784987964566\"><i>Reread November 2014</i><br /><br />The third film is my favorite of the series because it's a bit darker than the previous too, and the story gets creepier and moodier with the unfolding of Sirius Black's tale. However, I don't think the third book is my favorite to read. I do <i>love</i> the whole Time-Turner/Inception situation that goes on near the end. And the introduction of Lupin and Black are such great additions to the series (and Buckbeak, but what ever happens to him?). <br /><br />I'm really enjoying these rereads, an</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText16508384784987964566\" style=\"display:none\"><i>Reread November 2014</i><br /><br />The third film is my favorite of the series because it's a bit darker than the previous too, and the story gets creepier and moodier with the unfolding of Sirius Black's tale. However, I don't think the third book is my favorite to read. I do <i>love</i> the whole Time-Turner/Inception situation that goes on near the end. And the introduction of Lupin and Black are such great additions to the series (and Buckbeak, but what ever happens to him?). <br /><br />I'm really enjoying these rereads, and it makes me even more excited to get into books 4-7 because I haven't reread those books in so long! And the kids get older, the story gets more intense, and everything begins to unravel and you have to try and start putting the pieces back together. <br /><br />Here, as I've done with <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1116433719?book_show_action=false\">Sorcerer's Stone</a> and <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1116981984?book_show_action=false\">Chamber of Secrets</a>, are some of my thoughts from rereading the 3rd book:<br />-Hermione's boggart is McGonagall telling her she's failed all her subjects haha.<br />-For not liking Scabbers as a pet that much, Ron really has a hard time letting him go when Sirius asks to prove he is Pettigrew<br />-\"Ron put his weight gingerly on the leg\"- ok Rowling, a ginger pun? Great.<br />-At one point when they're healing in the hopsital wing, Hermione is described as looking 'petrified.' #TBT<br />-Also, Madame Pomfrey's first name is Poppy. Poppy Pomfrey. What.<br /><br />Again, 5/5 stars because SIRIUS BLACK AND ALL THE FEELS.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"16508384784987964566\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review1117944488\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div class=\"updateActionLinks\">\n        <a class=\"right flag\" rel=\"nofollow\" id=\"flag_link1117944488\" title=\"Flag class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9780747546290\" href=\"/book/show/464164.Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban\">review of     \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1548346141960318284\">This honestly has to have one of best plots in the Harry Potter series! It's so well devised and was perfectly planned out from the very start, utterly fantastic!!<br /><br />Prisoner of Azkaban will always be one of my favourites in the series, both book and film, because I feel like we really get to learn a lot about the characters and the wizarding world.<br /><br />I love getting to know more about the marauders and I nEED to know more! It honestly breaks my heart when reading this because Lupin and Sirius really d</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1548346141960318284\" style=\"display:none\">This honestly has to have one of best plots in the Harry Potter series! It's so well devised and was perfectly planned out from the very start, utterly fantastic!!<br /><br />Prisoner of Azkaban will always be one of my favourites in the series, both book and film, because I feel like we really get to learn a lot about the characters and the wizarding world.<br /><br />I love getting to know more about the marauders and I nEED to know more! It honestly breaks my heart when reading this because Lupin and Sirius really did deserve so much better!<br /><br />So glad I reread this! It was a quick, entertaining and brilliant read and I feel like it deserves more appreciation within the series!!</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1548346141960318284\" href=\"#\" itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/241902728\" />\n    <a title=\"Stepheny\" class=\"left imgcol\" href=\"/user/show/7091879-stepheny\"><img alt=\"Stepheny\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476841174p2/7091879.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/241902728?book_show_action=false\">Jan 04, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Stepheny\" class=\"user\" name=\"Stepheny\" href=\"/user/show/7091879-stepheny\">Stepheny</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Kindle Edition \" href=\"/book/show/13611643-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=books-everyone-should-read\">books-everyone-should-read</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=favorite-series\">favorite-series</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=ya\">ya</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=coming-of-age\">coming-of-age</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=like-a-meth-addiction\">like-a-meth-addiction</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=badd-ass-fantasy\">badd-ass-fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=guilty-pleasure-reads\">guilty-pleasure-reads</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=classics\">classics</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/7091879-stepheny?shelf=reliving-my-childhood\">reliving-my-childhood</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer241902728\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer13692487666477231781\"><br /><a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/241902710?book_show_action=false\">My own journey</a> with Harry Potter started a long time ago. But when Delee mentioned she had never read it before I knew I had to change that. And I think some deeper part of her understood that if our friendship were to stand the test of time she would have to read them. When she <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/900860104?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1\"> gave 5 stars to book 1</a> I knew I had her! <br /><br />And sure enough we made our way to <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/241902773\">Chamber of Secrets</a>.I was unsure what she would make of the second book. It seems to be the most criticized. Many state that it is too much like</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText13692487666477231781\" style=\"display:none\"><br /><a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/241902710?book_show_action=false\">My own journey</a> with Harry Potter started a long time ago. But when Delee mentioned she had never read it before I knew I had to change that. And I think some deeper part of her understood that if our friendship were to stand the test of time she would have to read them. When she <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/900860104?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1\"> gave 5 stars to book 1</a> I knew I had her! <br /><br />And sure enough we made our way to <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/241902773\">Chamber of Secrets</a>.I was unsure what she would make of the second book. It seems to be the most criticized. Many state that it is too much like the first one and that it doesn't serve much purpose. I tend to give people a heads up that the first 3 books of the series in general are aimed at a much younger crowd than the last 4. I have to say I was shocked but very excited to see that once again, Delee had given <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1268939794?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1\"> 5 shiny stars</a> to Chamber as well. <br /><br />So here we are. Our journey began in March of 2014 and I have been trying my best to be a patient and understanding leader. Sometimes I take her hand and gently guide her, other times I chase her with a wooden spoon threatening severe punishments if she doesn't commit to a date to begin the next book. But I do try to be patient. I hope she knows that. ;) We picked up another buddy for this read- <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/104910588\"> The Enchanting Ivonne</a>. <br /><br />When it comes to the world of Harry Potter there is little that I am unfamiliar with. And there is even less that I wonU+2019t do to get people to read it. Now that Delee <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1465110878?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1\">has the third book under her belt</a> I think it will take less and less persuasion to get her on board for the next one. In fact, we finished this one in December and weU+2019re starting Goblet in March! MARCH. ThatU+2019s not that far away! <br /><br />Prisoner has been a fan favorite since it came out. I think it was one of the most popular of the movies as well. But it has never been <i>my</i> favorite. Obviously I still love it and itU+2019s a wonderful book, but in the grand scheme of things it falls lower on my list than most other PottheadsU+2019. <br /><br />A crazy murdering psycho is on the loose. His name is Sirius Black and he has somehow escaped the Wizard prison- Azkaban. No one, and I do mean no one, has ever done this before. Now, this isn't some wimpy old Muggle prison like Alcatraz.We are talking the big time here folks. The place is packed with dementors! They suck the happiness and life right out of you. They make you so incredibly sad and sorrowful that youU+2019ll be left with no hope.<br /><br />So how did Black do it? How was he able to remain sane in a place as awful as Azkaban? They say he was lucid and even downright chatty whenever the Minister for Magic had to do a check on the prison. Is he just that crazy that the dementors donU+2019t affect him? Most importantly- <b>why</b> did he escape? <br /><br />But Harry soon finds out that Black has come to finish what he started 12 years earlier. He has come to kill Harry.<br /><br />Prisoner offers a break in what was perceived as the U+201CFormulaU+201D. In this one we learn to battle our depression. We learn to find our happiest moments in our weakest and most awful ones. We learn to forgive and we learn to show mercy. We learn what it means to have a second chance. And we are introduced to Buckbeak. <br /><br />Prisoner of Azkaban is a great story and added a nice dynamic to the Harry Potter series. It is the only one like it within the series where the other ones can be compared fairly easily to one another. <br /><br />I am so thankful to have such an incredible friend agree to accompany me on this journey. I am so thankful that she trusts me to guide her. But mostly I am so thankful that we can share these stories together. It is a bonding experience like no other. </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"13692487666477231781\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" id=\"update_comment_stuff_Review241902728\">\n  <td colspan=\"2\">\n    <div href=\"/review/show/1723217279?book_show_action=false\">Oct 29, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)\" class=\"user\" name=\"Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)\" href=\"/user/show/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh\">Joshua Gabriel (Forever Bookish Josh)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9781408855676\" href=\"/book/show/22842001-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh?shelf=favorites\">favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh?shelf=owned\">owned</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh?shelf=magic-schools\">magic-schools</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/8832758-joshua-gabriel-forever-bookish-josh?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1723217279\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer11008530885424388283\">I'm now inevitably on the verge of a book hangover. I need to get my hands on the next book ASAP. I can hardly wait for payday this Friday!<br /><br />Our Lady Rowling's writing seems to become more powerful as the series progresses. She just has this subtle way of evoking such positive emotions in her readers, bedazzling them with an awesome fictional world, an addictive storyline, and totally best-friend-worthy characters.<br /><br />I had a delightful time witnessing Harry, Ron and Hermione's transition into young a</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText11008530885424388283\" style=\"display:none\">I'm now inevitably on the verge of a book hangover. I need to get my hands on the next book ASAP. I can hardly wait for payday this Friday!<br /><br />Our Lady Rowling's writing seems to become more powerful as the series progresses. She just has this subtle way of evoking such positive emotions in her readers, bedazzling them with an awesome fictional world, an addictive storyline, and totally best-friend-worthy characters.<br /><br />I had a delightful time witnessing Harry, Ron and Hermione's transition into young adulthood. It was clear that the hormones were finally kicking in because they had <i>many</i> arguments in this novel. Ron and Hermione in particular often got on each other's nerves for reasons both shallow and significant. As for Harry, I was grinning from ear to ear when he had finally met a girl that made his stomach drop in the best possible way. With all that said, the interactions between these beloved characters made me reminisce about my late teenage life, evoking in me feelings of longing, happiness, and even gratitude. And if I must say so, my admiration for Hermione grows stronger <i>by the book</i>.<br /><br />Honestly, I probably enjoyed this book so much also because I watched the movie adaptation beforehand (4/5 times). It was nearly effortless for me to imagine all the intriguing events that were happening, which was practically a huge bonus to my reading experience. Furthermore, I was actually delighted to spot the differences between the movie and book; although I already knew the story by heart through the movie, I still experienced moments of blissful enlightenment. <br /><br />In conclusion, I would like to apologize for putting this book on hold for almost a month. I would've finished it sooner if I had less than ten books in my currently-reading list. Tee-hee. This is my favorite Harry Potter book so far, and I won't be surprised if the next books throw me off my feet as well.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"11008530885424388283\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1361894110\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer1559111540093585572\">Wow! So far this is my favorite book of the series. The set up and execution of this book was flipping amazing! The attention to detail amazes me. Now I understand why so many people adore this series. Usually I'm good at keeping the movie separate from the book, but this time the book was better than the movie. I mean the movie is still amazing in my opinion, but the book definitely holds many more details and background stories. I feel like the story is really taking off! I can't wait to read</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText1559111540093585572\" style=\"display:none\">Wow! So far this is my favorite book of the series. The set up and execution of this book was flipping amazing! The attention to detail amazes me. Now I understand why so many people adore this series. Usually I'm good at keeping the movie separate from the book, but this time the book was better than the movie. I mean the movie is still amazing in my opinion, but the book definitely holds many more details and background stories. I feel like the story is really taking off! I can't wait to read the Goblet of Fire now.</span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"1559111540093585572\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n itemprop=\"reviews\" itemscope itemtype=\"http://schema.org/Review\">\n  <link itemprop=\"url\" href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1369791189\" />\n    <a title=\"eKa (THe ShALLoWbiRd)\" href=\"/review/show/1369791189?book_show_action=false\">Aug 09, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"eKa (THe ShALLoWbiRd)\" class=\"user\" name=\"eKa (THe ShALLoWbiRd)\" href=\"/user/show/37421969-eka-the-shallowbird\">eKa (THe ShALLoWbiRd)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Paperback 9789796558537\" href=\"/book/show/1378962.Harry_Potter_dan_Tawanan_Azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/37421969-eka-the-shallowbird?shelf=filmed\">filmed</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/37421969-eka-the-shallowbird?shelf=all-time-favorites\">all-time-favorites</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/37421969-eka-the-shallowbird?shelf=beautiful-setting\">beautiful-setting</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/37421969-eka-the-shallowbird?shelf=brilliant-twist\">brilliant-twist</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1369791189\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer10924874524782243452\">Finally a happy life for Harry Potter. I am really happy for him. Not only he got his two best friends and Dobby, now he got a godfather!!! A REAL family member who LOVES him so much. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470724602ra/19956518.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>So, rather than writing a usual review, I would write a comparison between the third and the second book of the series. Not so deep, just some random comparisons based on what I cared about more. <br><br>1. Hermione<br><br> Oh, this girl is a KICK-ASS here. She's the real definition of speak less, do more. No whining anymore. See</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText10924874524782243452\" style=\"display:none\">Finally a happy life for Harry Potter. I am really happy for him. Not only he got his two best friends and Dobby, now he got a godfather!!! A REAL family member who LOVES him so much. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470724602ra/19956518.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>So, rather than writing a usual review, I would write a comparison between the third and the second book of the series. Not so deep, just some random comparisons based on what I cared about more. <br><br>1. Hermione<br><br> Oh, this girl is a KICK-ASS here. She's the real definition of speak less, do more. No whining anymore. See how she punched that braggart in the face. You deserved that, Malfoy! <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1470724602ra/19956519.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>And she lives up to her brain capacity even more. I mean, in the second book she fangirled over Gilderoy Lockhart, which was absurd to me. A smart girl madly in love with a narcisist? COME ON! But here, she walk out of Divination class. Not that I approved her insulting Professor Trelawney. It's just that a high IQ person like Hermione doesn't rely on predictions. So it makes sense Hermione acted that way. <br><br>2. Professor Remus Lupin<br><br>Of all the teacher of Defence Against the Dark Arts, Professor Lupin is the best Hogwarts and its students had ever had. Everybody, except the Slytherin and Snape of course, loves him. He's kind and tolerant with the students. And it makes Gilderoy Lockhart unbearably ridiculous. Yes. RIDICULOUS. <br><br><img src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1384401741ra/6868368.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>3. Dementor vs Basilisk<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470724602i/19956520.gif\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Dementor left my heart with spookiness. It still buried deep inside me. The way Rowling depicted how scary and demented this creature is is so real. I got goosebumps even when I read it in the daylight. But I have to say that Basilisk is still the best horror of all Harry Potter series. I still can hear it hissing Kill... Kill... in my ears. Plus, there were Moaning Myrtle and Aragog. They both added to the frightening moment of my reading experience. Sorry, Dementor. You can now suck my happiness out of me. Wooooo. But then I have to kill you haha.<br><br>4. Buckbeak vs Fawkes<br><br><img src=\"https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1470724602i/19956521.jpg\" class=\"gr-hostedUserImg\"><br><br>Well, I can't choose between these two birds. Both of them have their own appeal. Buckbeak is so cute and funny while he's a big creature. And Fawkes is so wise and affectionate just like Dumbledore. They both strong and loyal. One thing differentiates them is that Fawkes's teardrops can heal wound while Buckbeak's can't. So, I think Fawkes wins.<br><br>Now I can't wait to read the fourth book!!! YEAY!!!<br><br><br><br><br><br><br><br><br></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"10924874524782243452\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n
