  <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=fantasy\">fantasy</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/26681101-markus?shelf=harry-potter\">harry-potter</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1698827207\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer15860452083955511840\">This book has no plot.<br /><br />ItU+2019s more or less exclusively a series instalment providing character introduction. Fortunately, the characters introduced are worth it.<br /><br />A few thoughts:<br /><br />The Sirius Black storyline (okay, okay, there is a little plot) is the best yet, and provided the series with more intrigue, atmosphere and worldbuilding that was sorely needed.<br /><br />I hate quidditch.<br /><br />Everything about Azkaban is amazing and I am so ridiculously disappointed the book didnU+2019t take me there. Bloody waste of opportunity.</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText15860452083955511840\" style=\"display:none\">This book has no plot.<br /><br />ItU+2019s more or less exclusively a series instalment providing character introduction. Fortunately, the characters introduced are worth it.<br /><br />A few thoughts:<br /><br />The Sirius Black storyline (okay, okay, there is a little plot) is the best yet, and provided the series with more intrigue, atmosphere and worldbuilding that was sorely needed.<br /><br />I hate quidditch.<br /><br />Everything about Azkaban is amazing and I am so ridiculously disappointed the book didnU+2019t take me there. Bloody waste of opportunity.<br /><br />Sarcastic, sassy Professor McGonagall is now my favourite character.<br /><br />Moving on!<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"15860452083955511840\" href=\"#\" src=\"https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1441213786p2/9246169.jpg\" /></a>\n\n  <div class=\"left bodycol\">\n    <div class=\"reviewHeader uitext stacked\">\n        <a class=\"reviewDate createdAt right\" itemprop=\"publishDate\" href=\"/review/show/1742284879?book_show_action=false\">Sep 06, 2016</a>\n\n      <a title=\"Wanda\" class=\"user\" name=\"Wanda\" href=\"/user/show/9246169-wanda\">Wanda</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">really liked it</span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"really liked it\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p0\"></span></span>\n\n\n\n        \n\n\n          <div class=\"uitext greyText bookshelves\">\n            Shelves:\n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9246169-wanda?shelf=female-authors\">female-authors</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9246169-wanda?shelf=childrens-books\">childrens-books</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9246169-wanda?shelf=brit-lit\">brit-lit</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9246169-wanda?shelf=read-in-2016\">read-in-2016</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9246169-wanda?shelf=public-library\">public-library</a>, \n              <a class=\"actionLinkLite\" href=\"/review/list/9246169-wanda?shelf=halloween-bingo-2016\">halloween-bingo-2016</a>\n          </div>\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1742284879\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer6405917169344074529\">As a newbie to the whole Harry Potter phenomenon, IU+2019m amazed at the devoted following that J.K. Rowling has built! Child and adult, those who read it as children but continue to adore it as adults, devotU+0E9Es of all ages.<br /><br />I love the names that she assigned to charactersU+2014of course someone named Lupin is going to be a werewolf! (The French for wolf being loup.) ItU+2019s these little treats that appeal to adults reading this series. Rowling nails the angst of school, too, with the dread of being mocked by</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText6405917169344074529\" style=\"display:none\">As a newbie to the whole Harry Potter phenomenon, IU+2019m amazed at the devoted following that J.K. Rowling has built! Child and adult, those who read it as children but continue to adore it as adults, devotU+0E9Es of all ages.<br /><br />I love the names that she assigned to charactersU+2014of course someone named Lupin is going to be a werewolf! (The French for wolf being loup.) ItU+2019s these little treats that appeal to adults reading this series. Rowling nails the angst of school, too, with the dread of being mocked by oneU+2019s peers, the fixation on who wins what game, the anxiety about test scores, the rows with friends, and doubting oneU+2019s abilities. These are the worries of childhood which morph into our adult problems. Everyone can identify. <br /><br />And the teachers! As Robertson Davies wrote in <i>Fifth Business</i>, U+201CIf a boy can't have a good teacher, give him a psychological cripple or an exotic failure to cope with; don't just give him a bad, dull teacher. This is where the private schools score over state-run schools; they can accommodate a few cultured madmen on the staff without having to offer explanations.U+201D I personally sometimes learned interesting life lessons from the teachers who hated teaching or who were on the brink of a nervous breakdown. They may not have been the best at teaching chemistry or English or whatever, but I learned to cope with people who had power over my life and who were not having a good time.<br /><br />Read as part of my Halloween Book Bingo 2016, to count towards the Witches square.<br /></span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"6405917169344074529\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div class=\"reviewFooter uitext buttons\">\n          \n\n<tr class=\"no_border feedFooterReview\" href=\"/user/show/23004131-kayla-bookadoodles\">Kayla (BOOKadoodles)</a>\n\n        rated it\n        <span class=\" staticStars\"><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\">it was amazing</span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span><span title=\"it was amazing\" size=\"15x15\" class=\"staticStar p10\"></span></span>\n\n          <span class=\"greyText\">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>\n          <a class=\"lightGreyText\" title=\"Audible Audio \" href=\"/book/show/27876147-harry-potter-and-the-prisoner-of-azkaban\">review of another edition</a>\n\n\n        \n\n\n    </div>\n\n\n        <div class=\"reviewText stacked\">\n              <span id=\"reviewTextContainer1759044046\" class=\"readable\"\n              >\n            \n<span id=\"freeTextContainer5553682106097232801\">I've always been that person who wonders why people consider this book their favorite installment, but after listening to it and revisiting the adventure, I can definitely see why that's the case. So many things happen! The Scabbers twist, the whole Marauders storyline, Lupin, Sirius, sneaking into Hogsmeade. winning the Hogwarts Quidditch cup, going back in time to save Buckbeak & Sirius--it's pure genius and sets up the darker tone for the rest of the series quite perfectly. (Side note:</span>\n  <span id=\"freeText5553682106097232801\" style=\"display:none\">I've always been that person who wonders why people consider this book their favorite installment, but after listening to it and revisiting the adventure, I can definitely see why that's the case. So many things happen! The Scabbers twist, the whole Marauders storyline, Lupin, Sirius, sneaking into Hogsmeade. winning the Hogwarts Quidditch cup, going back in time to save Buckbeak & Sirius--it's pure genius and sets up the darker tone for the rest of the series quite perfectly. (Side note: Can we give Jim Dale a huge round of applause for his impeccable narration? Seriously) </span>\n  <a data-text-id=\"5553682106097232801\" href=\"#\" onclick=\"swapContent($(this));; return false;\">...more</a>\n\n          </span>\n        </div>\n\n\n      <div
